在公共场所语境里，这个词常与隐私（privacy）、监控（surveillance）、人脸识别（facial recognition）等话题一起出现；表达时要注意不同文化与地区对遮挡面部（如口罩、宗教面纱）的敏感性与法规差异。

summary.en: Anti-dispensational means “opposed to dispensationalism” in Christian theology.
summary.zh: anti-dispensational 指“反对基督教神学中的时代论/分期论”。

definition.en: Opposed to dispensationalism (a Christian theological view that divides history into distinct “dispensations” or eras in God’s plan).
definition.zh: 反对“时代论/分期论”（dispensationalism，一种把救赎历史划分为不同“时代/分期”的基督教神学观点）的。

examples.en: The author takes an anti-dispensational approach to interpreting prophecy.
examples.zh: 这位作者用反时代论的方式来解读预言。

examples.en: Some churches are explicitly anti-dispensational in their teaching about Israel and the church.
examples.zh: 有些教会在讲解以色列与教会的关系时，明确持反时代论立场。

extraExplanation: “anti-dispensational”多见于神学讨论（尤其是末世论、圣约论与时代论之争）。它不是日常英语高频词，常出现在学术文章、教会立场声明、书评或神学争论中。
时代论常与“前千禧年”“被提（rapture）”“以色列与教会的区分”等话题相关；“反时代论”者往往更强调救赎历史的连续性（例如更接近某些形式的圣约神学），但具体立场因作者/宗派而异。

summary.en: Antidiuretic means reducing urine production; it can also refer to a substance that causes this effect.
summary.zh: anti-diuretic 指“抗利尿的、减少尿量的”；也可指具有这种作用的物质（如抗利尿激素）。

definition.en: (of a drug or hormone) reducing the amount of urine the body produces.
definition.zh: （指药物或激素）具有抗利尿作用的；能减少尿量的。

examples.en: The doctor prescribed an antidiuretic medication to help with nighttime urination.
examples.zh: 医生开了抗利尿药，帮助缓解夜间频繁排尿。

examples.en: Antidiuretic effects can help the body conserve water.
examples.zh: 抗利尿作用可以帮助身体保留水分。

definition.en: A substance (such as a hormone) that decreases urine production.
definition.zh: 抗利尿物质（如某种激素），能减少尿液生成。

examples.en: Antidiuretics are sometimes used to treat certain forms of diabetes insipidus.
examples.zh: 抗利尿物质有时用于治疗某些类型的尿崩症。

examples.en: The body releases an antidiuretic when it needs to conserve water.
examples.zh: 当身体需要保水时，会释放抗利尿物质。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配是 **antidiuretic hormone (ADH)**，中文多译为“抗利尿激素”，也叫 **vasopressin（加压素）**。它能让肾脏回收更多水分，从而减少尿量。
拼写上也常见不加连字符的 **antidiuretic**；含义相同，但在医学写作中两种形式都可能出现。

summary.en: Anti-division means opposing separation or fragmentation and supporting unity.
summary.zh: anti-division 指“反对分裂、支持团结”。

definition.en: opposed to dividing people, groups, or a country; aiming to prevent separation or fragmentation.
definition.zh: 反对分裂的；旨在防止人群、团体或国家分离、破裂的。

examples.en: The group promoted an anti-division message to reduce tensions between communities.
examples.zh: 该团体宣传反分裂的信息，以缓解不同社群之间的紧张。

examples.en: The new policy is described as anti-division because it encourages dialogue instead of blame.
examples.zh: 这项新政策被称为反分裂政策，因为它鼓励对话而不是互相指责。

definition.en: a stance, policy, or movement that opposes division or separation.
definition.zh: 反分裂立场／政策／运动。

examples.en: Their campaign focused on anti-division and national unity.
examples.zh: 他们的竞选重点是反分裂与国家团结。

extraExplanation: “anti-division”不是特别固定、常见的词条，更常见的表达有：anti-separatist（反分离主义的）、anti-secession（反分裂/反独立）、anti-partition（反分治/反分割）或 anti-divisive（反对制造分裂的）。具体用哪个取决于语境：国家领土完整常用 secession/separatist；社会群体对立、撕裂常用 divisive。
写作中如果担心读者不熟悉“anti-division”，可以在第一次出现时补一句解释，例如：an anti-division (pro-unity) policy。

summary.en: Anti-divorce means opposed to divorce or supporting actions that discourage or restrict divorce.
summary.zh: anti-divorce 指“反对离婚的”，或“支持劝阻/限制离婚的做法”。

definition.en: opposed to divorce; supporting policies, beliefs, or values that discourage divorce or make it harder to get one.
definition.zh: 反对离婚的；支持阻止或劝阻离婚（或使离婚更难）的政策、观念或价值观。

examples.en: Some anti-divorce groups campaign for stricter divorce laws.
examples.zh: 一些反对离婚的团体会倡议制定更严格的离婚法。

examples.en: The bill was criticized as anti-divorce because it increased waiting periods.
examples.zh: 这项法案因延长等待期而被批评为“反对离婚”的。

examples.en: Her anti-divorce views come from her religious background.
examples.zh: 她反对离婚的观点与她的宗教背景有关。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/对抗”。“anti-divorce”多用于政治、社会议题或媒体语境，常修饰group（团体）、law/policy（法律/政策）、stance（立场）、campaign（运动）等。
写法上常见带连字符（anti-divorce），尤其在它直接放在名词前作定语时更清晰：anti-divorce law。放在表语位置有时也可不加连字符，但加连字符更常见、更易读。

summary.en: Anti-Docetae: opponents of Docetism in early Christian theology.
summary.zh: Anti-Docetae：早期基督教中反对“幻影说”的人。

definition.en: People (especially early Christian writers) who opposed Docetism—the belief that Jesus only seemed to have a physical human body and did not truly suffer physically.
definition.zh: 反对“幻影说”（认为耶稣只是看似有肉身、并未真正受苦的观点）的人；尤指早期基督教著作者与神学家。

examples.en: Many Anti-Docetae argued that if Christ did not truly suffer, the meaning of the crucifixion would be undermined.
examples.zh: 许多反幻影说者认为，如果基督并未真实受苦，那么十字架受难的意义就会被削弱。

examples.en: In some church histories, the Anti-Docetae are described as defending the reality of Jesus’s human body.
examples.zh: 在一些教会史著作中，反幻影说者被描述为捍卫耶稣真实的人性身体。

extraExplanation: “Anti-Docetae”来自“anti-（反对）+ Docetae（幻影说者）”。Docetism（幻影说）一词源自希腊语 dokein，意为“看起来像”。因此“反幻影说者”强调耶稣的“真实成肉身”（真正有肉身、真实受苦与死亡），常见于讨论早期基督论争、反异端著作的语境中。
该词多见于学术/历史文本，日常英语不常用。写作时常见近义表达是“opponents of Docetism”或“anti-Docetic writers”。

summary.en: Anti-dogmatic means open-minded and not rigidly tied to fixed beliefs or official doctrines.
summary.zh: anti-dogmatic 指“反教条的”，强调思想开放、不僵化地遵循固定信条或官方教义。

definition.en: Not rigidly following fixed beliefs or rules; open-minded and willing to question accepted ideas.
definition.zh: 反教条的；不僵化地遵循固定信条或规则；思想开放，愿意质疑既定观念。

examples.en: She takes an anti-dogmatic approach to learning and encourages students to ask questions.
examples.zh: 她用一种反教条的方式教学，鼓励学生提问。

examples.en: The team’s anti-dogmatic culture makes it easier to change plans when new evidence appears.
examples.zh: 团队的反教条文化让他们在出现新证据时更容易调整计划。

definition.en: Opposed to dogma (official or strongly held beliefs) in religion, politics, or ideology.
definition.zh: 反对宗教、政治或意识形态中的教义/教条（官方或强烈坚持的信念）。

examples.en: The writer was known for his anti-dogmatic views on religion.
examples.zh: 这位作家以其反教条的宗教观点而闻名。

examples.en: An anti-dogmatic mindset can support respectful debate across different political beliefs.
examples.zh: 反教条的心态有助于在不同政治立场之间进行尊重的讨论。

extraExplanation:
“anti-”表示“反对、对抗”，如 antiwar（反战）、antivirus（杀毒/抗病毒）。
“dogmatic”来自“dogma”（教义、教条），常带有“过于自信、固执、不容质疑”的语气。
语气提示：anti-dogmatic 往往是褒义或中性，强调“开放、灵活”；但在某些语境也可能被理解为“不够坚定、缺少原则”。可根据上下文选择更精确的词，如 open-minded（思想开放的）、flexible（灵活的）、non-doctrinaire（不教条的，较正式）。

summary.en: Anti-dogmatism is the attitude of rejecting rigid, unquestionable beliefs and staying open to evidence and debate.
summary.zh: 反教条主义指拒绝僵化、不可质疑的信念，保持对证据与讨论的开放态度。

definition.en: Opposition to dogmatism; a belief that people should not treat ideas as absolutely certain, and should stay open to evidence, debate, and alternative views.
definition.zh: 反教条主义；反对把观点当成绝对真理的态度，强调保持开放、接受证据与讨论、允许不同看法。

examples.en: In science, anti-dogmatism encourages researchers to change their theories when new evidence appears.
examples.zh: 在科学中，反教条主义鼓励研究者在出现新证据时修正理论。

examples.en: Her anti-dogmatism made classroom discussions more respectful and open-minded.
examples.zh: 她的反教条主义让课堂讨论更尊重彼此、更开放。

examples.en: The group promoted anti-dogmatism rather than loyalty to any single ideology.
examples.zh: 这个团体提倡反教条主义，而不是对某一种意识形态的盲目忠诚。

extraExplanation: “dogmatism（教条主义）”通常指在缺乏足够证据或不允许质疑的情况下，把某种观点当作不可动摇的真理；“anti-”表示“反对”。因此 anti-dogmatism 常用于哲学、政治讨论、教育与科学语境。
注意：anti-dogmatism 并不等于“什么都不相信”或“没有立场”，更接近“愿意被证据说服、允许修正观点”。

summary.en: Anti-domestic means “against domestic life at home” or, in politics/economics, “against domestic (local) products or policies,” depending on context.
summary.zh: anti-domestic 可指“反居家/反家庭生活”，也可在政经语境中指“反国内（本国产品或政策）”，具体含义取决于上下文。

definition.en: Opposed to domestic life or home-centered values; not interested in traditional household roles.
definition.zh: 反对（或不喜欢）家庭/居家生活与以家庭为中心的价值观；不认同传统的家务或家庭角色。

examples.en: She wrote an anti-domestic essay arguing that women should not be judged by their housekeeping skills.
examples.zh: 她写了一篇反家庭（反居家）的文章，主张不应以家务能力来评判女性。

examples.en: The film is openly anti-domestic, showing its hero happiest when he leaves home.
examples.zh: 这部电影明显反家庭（反居家），把主角最快乐的时刻放在离开家之后。

definition.en: Against “domestic” in the sense of a country’s internal products, policies, or markets (used mainly in political or economic contexts).
definition.zh: 反对“国内的/本国的”产品、政策或市场（多用于政治或经济语境）。

examples.en: Some critics called the proposal anti-domestic because it prioritized foreign suppliers over local factories.
examples.zh: 一些批评者称该提案“反国内”，因为它优先考虑外国供应商而不是本地工厂。

examples.en: The party was accused of taking an anti-domestic stance on industry by cutting support for local manufacturing.
examples.zh: 该党被指在产业问题上持“反国内”立场，因为它削减了对本国制造业的支持。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制”。“domestic”既可以指“家庭/家务的”，也可以指“国内的/本国的”，所以 anti-domestic 的含义要看上下文。
这个词并不算非常固定或常用，写作中有时会换成更明确的表达，例如：anti-household / anti-home（强调反居家），或 anti-local / anti-domestic-industry（强调反国内产业）。
注意不要与“anti-domestic violence（反家暴）”混淆；anti-domestic 本身并不等于“反对家庭暴力”。

summary.en: “Anti-Dominican” describes hostility or prejudice against Dominicans or the Dominican Republic.
summary.zh: “anti-Dominican”指对多米尼加人或多米尼加共和国的敌意、偏见或歧视。

definition.en: Opposed to Dominicans or the Dominican Republic; showing hostility, prejudice, or discrimination toward Dominican people, culture, or interests.
definition.zh: 反多米尼加人的；反对多米尼加共和国的；对多米尼加人或其文化/利益表现出敌意、偏见或歧视的。

examples.en: The report documented anti-Dominican discrimination in hiring and housing.
examples.zh: 报告记录了在雇佣和住房方面存在反多米尼加人的歧视。

examples.en: Some politicians used anti-Dominican rhetoric to gain support.
examples.zh: 一些政客利用反多米尼加人的言论来争取支持。

examples.en: Community leaders spoke out against anti-Dominican sentiment online.
examples.zh: 社区领袖公开反对网络上的反多米尼加人情绪。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制/敌视”，常与国籍或群体词搭配（如 anti-immigrant）。写作中更常见的搭配是 anti-Dominican sentiment/rhetoric/violence/discrimination（反多米尼加人的情绪/言论/暴力/歧视）。
该词涉及族群与国别议题，常出现在新闻、历史或人权语境（例如讨论伊斯帕尼奥拉岛地区关系、移民政策与社会偏见）。使用时注意区分：批评某项政策（anti-government policy stance）不等于敌视某个族群。

summary.en: “Anti-doubt” means reducing doubt or something that reassures people.
summary.zh: anti-doubt 指“减少怀疑/让人安心的”，也可指“消除疑虑的措施或事物”。

definition.en: intended to reduce or prevent doubt; designed to make people feel more certain or confident.
definition.zh: 用来减少或防止怀疑的；旨在让人更确定、更有信心的。

examples.en: The company added an anti-doubt guarantee: free returns within 30 days.
examples.zh: 这家公司推出了“反疑虑”保证：30天内可免费退货。

examples.en: Clear, simple instructions are anti-doubt—they help new users feel secure.
examples.zh: 清晰、简单的说明很“反疑虑”——能让新用户更安心。

definition.en: something (a message, feature, policy, or action) that removes doubt or reassures people.
definition.zh: 消除疑虑、让人安心的事物（如信息、功能、政策或行动）。

examples.en: A quick demo is the best anti-doubt for customers who are unsure.
examples.zh: 对犹豫的顾客来说，快速演示是最好的“消疑利器”。

examples.en: Her calm explanation was an anti-doubt for the whole team.
examples.zh: 她冷静的解释让整个团队都不再疑虑。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是英语常见前缀，表示“反对、对抗、预防”（如: anti-virus 防病毒）。因此 anti-doubt 直译为“对抗怀疑”。
anti-doubt 不是非常固定、常见的词汇，更像是营销、产品设计或自我成长语境里的“造词/组合词”，用于强调“让人放心、降低不确定感”。写作中也可以用更常见的表达替换，如 doubt-free、reassuring、confidence-building。

summary.en: anti-DR means “against DR,” where DR is an abbreviation whose meaning depends on context (e.g., drug-resistant, damage reduction, disaster recovery).
summary.zh: anti-DR 表示“反对/对抗DR”，其中DR是缩写，具体含义依语境而定（如：耐药、伤害减免、灾难恢复等）。

definition.en: Opposed to or designed to fight something abbreviated as “DR” (the exact meaning depends on context).
definition.zh: “反对/对抗DR”的；这里的DR是缩写，具体指什么取决于语境。

examples.en: The report compares pro-DR and anti-DR opinions among voters.
examples.zh: 这份报告比较了选民中支持DR和反对DR的观点。

examples.en: We need more context—what does “DR” mean in this document?
examples.zh: 我们需要更多语境——这份文件里的“DR”指什么？

definition.en: (Medicine / public health) Effective against drug-resistant (DR) infections or strains.
definition.zh: （医学/公共卫生）抗耐药（DR，drug-resistant）感染或菌株的。

examples.en: Researchers are developing anti-DR treatments for drug-resistant TB.
examples.zh: 研究人员正在研发用于耐药结核的抗耐药治疗方案。

examples.en: The hospital updated its anti-DR protocol to reduce resistant infections.
examples.zh: 医院更新了抗耐药流程，以减少耐药感染。

definition.en: (Gaming / RPGs) Designed to reduce, bypass, or counter “damage reduction (DR).”
definition.zh: （游戏/RPG）用于削弱、无视或克制“伤害减免（DR, damage reduction）”的。

examples.en: This weapon is anti-DR, so it performs well against armored enemies.
examples.zh: 这把武器是反DR的，所以对高护甲敌人表现很好。

examples.en: Players chose anti-DR builds to deal consistent damage in late game.
examples.zh: 玩家选择反DR的配装，以便在后期稳定输出。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是英语里常见前缀，表示“反对、对抗、用于预防”。“DR”是缩写，因此“anti-DR”不是固定单一词义，必须看领域与上下文。常见的DR含义包括：drug-resistant（耐药）、damage reduction（伤害减免）、disaster recovery（灾难恢复）等。若你告诉我它出现的句子/行业（医疗、IT、游戏、政治等），我可以帮你锁定最准确的解释与更地道的用法。

summary.en: Anti-draft means “draft-proof”: it prevents cold air (drafts) from entering through gaps; it can also refer to a strip or seal used for that purpose.
summary.zh: anti-draft 意为“防穿堂风/防冷风灌入的”；也可指用于挡风的密封条、挡风条等。

definition.en: Designed to prevent cold air from entering through gaps around doors, windows, or other openings (draft-proof).
definition.zh: 防穿堂风的；防冷风灌入的（用于门窗缝等处，起到防风密封作用）。

examples.en: We installed anti-draft seals around the front door to keep the hallway warm.
examples.zh: 我们在前门周围装了防穿堂风的密封条，让走廊更暖和。

examples.en: An anti-draft window frame can reduce heating costs in winter.
examples.zh: 防穿堂风的窗框在冬天可以减少取暖费用。

definition.en: A device or material (such as a strip, seal, or stopper) that blocks drafts, especially under a door.
definition.zh: 防风条；挡风条；门缝挡风器（尤其用于门底，阻挡冷风）。

examples.en: Put an anti-draft under the door to stop the cold air.
examples.zh: 在门底放一个挡风条，挡住冷风。

examples.en: This anti-draft is easy to cut to size and stick on.
examples.zh: 这个防风条很容易裁剪尺寸并贴上。

extraExplanation: “draft”在这里不是“草稿”，而是指从门窗缝隙吹进来的冷风（英式英语里也常写作“draught”）。因此“anti-draft”多用于家居保暖、节能的语境，也常见近义表达：draft-proof / draught-proof。
在实际使用中，“anti-draft”常作定语（anti-draft seal/strip），而不是单独成句子中心词；购物或装修说明中更常见。

summary.en: “Anti-Dreyfus” means opposed to Dreyfus or to the pro-Dreyfus movement during the Dreyfus Affair; it can also refer to a person in that opposition.
summary.zh: “anti-Dreyfus”指在德雷福斯事件中反对德雷福斯或反对支持德雷福斯的平反运动；也可指反对阵营中的个人或团体。

definition.en: Opposed to Alfred Dreyfus or to the movement that defended him during the Dreyfus Affair in France (1894–1906).
definition.zh: （在法国“德雷福斯事件”中）反对阿尔弗雷德·德雷福斯本人，或反对为他辩护与平反的阵营/运动。

examples.en: Many anti-Dreyfus voices in the press portrayed Dreyfus as a traitor.
examples.zh: 当时媒体中许多反德雷福斯的声音把德雷福斯描绘成叛徒。

examples.en: In class we read speeches from both Dreyfusard and anti-Dreyfus groups.
examples.zh: 课堂上我们读了支持德雷福斯派和反德雷福斯派双方的演讲。

definition.en: A person or group that opposed Dreyfus or the Dreyfusard cause.
definition.zh: 反对德雷福斯或反对“德雷福斯派”（为其辩护与平反者）的人或团体。

examples.en: The anti-Dreyfus in the debate argued for protecting the army’s reputation.
examples.zh: 辩论中反德雷福斯派主张维护军队的声誉。

examples.en: Some anti-Dreyfus activists organized rallies against reopening the case.
examples.zh: 一些反德雷福斯的活动人士组织集会，反对重审此案。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是英语中常见前缀，表示“反对……/与……对立”。“anti-Dreyfus”通常写作带连字符的形式，属于历史语境很强的词。
德雷福斯事件（Dreyfus Affair）是法国第三共和国时期的重大政治与社会危机：犹太裔军官德雷福斯被错误定罪为间谍，引发关于司法公正、军队权力、媒体影响与反犹主义的激烈对立。
常见对立词：Dreyfusard（支持德雷福斯、主张重审与平反者）与 anti-Dreyfus（反对者）。文学与公共写作中经常提到左拉的公开信《我控诉…！》(J’Accuse…!)，它在历史叙述中常与“anti-Dreyfus”阵营形成对照。

summary.en: Anti-dreyfusard means a person or viewpoint opposed to Alfred Dreyfus and the Dreyfusards during the Dreyfus Affair in France.
summary.zh: Anti-dreyfusard 指在法国“德雷福斯事件”中反对德雷福斯及其支持者（德雷福斯派）的人或立场。

definition.en: a person who opposed Alfred Dreyfus and/or opposed efforts to defend him during the Dreyfus Affair in France (late 1800s–early 1900s)
definition.zh: 反德雷福斯派；在法国“德雷福斯事件”（19世纪末至20世纪初）中反对阿尔弗雷德·德雷福斯及/或反对为其辩护者的人

examples.en: Many anti-Dreyfusards supported the army’s original verdict and rejected calls for a retrial.
examples.zh: 许多反德雷福斯派支持军方最初的判决，并拒绝重审的呼声。

examples.en: Historians often discuss how anti-Dreyfusard newspapers fueled public hostility.
examples.zh: 历史学家常讨论反德雷福斯派报纸如何煽动公众敌意。

definition.en: relating to or expressing opposition to Dreyfus or the Dreyfusard cause
definition.zh: （态度或言论）反德雷福斯的；反对德雷福斯派主张的

examples.en: The pamphlet used strongly anti-Dreyfusard language.
examples.zh: 这本小册子使用了强烈的反德雷福斯措辞。

examples.en: His anti-Dreyfusard stance aligned with nationalist politics of the time.
examples.zh: 他的反德雷福斯立场与当时的民族主义政治相呼应。

extraExplanation: “Dreyfusard（德雷福斯派）”指支持德雷福斯、主张重审与公正审判的人；“anti-”表示反对，因此 anti-Dreyfusard 就是“反德雷福斯派/反德雷福斯的”。
该词高度历史语境化，常见于历史、政治学、新闻史与反犹主义研究中；在一般日常英语里较少使用。
“Dreyfus Affair（德雷福斯事件）”是法国一场著名政治丑闻与社会分裂事件，牵涉军方、司法、媒体与反犹情绪；写作时常用作讨论“舆论分裂、政治极化、少数群体遭污名化”的案例。

summary.en: Anti-drinking describes policies, campaigns, or attitudes that oppose or discourage alcohol use.
summary.zh: Anti-drinking 用来形容反对或劝阻饮酒（酒精）的政策、宣传活动或态度。

definition.en: opposed to drinking alcohol; intended to prevent or discourage alcohol consumption.
definition.zh: 反对饮酒（酒精饮品）；旨在预防或劝阻饮酒的。

examples.en: The school introduced an anti-drinking campaign for teenagers.
examples.zh: 学校为青少年发起了一项反对饮酒的宣传活动。

examples.en: He supports anti-drinking laws that limit alcohol sales at night.
examples.zh: 他支持限制夜间售酒的反饮酒法律。

examples.en: Some workplaces offer anti-drinking programs to promote safety.
examples.zh: 一些工作场所提供反饮酒项目以促进安全。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，所以 anti-drinking 常用于描述“反对饮酒（酒精）”的政策、运动、宣传或态度。
写法上常见连字符 anti-drinking，也可能写作 anti drinking；更正式或学术语境里也常用 anti-alcohol（反酒精）或 alcohol-free（无酒精的）。

summary.en: Anti-dropout means aimed at preventing students from dropping out.
summary.zh: Anti-dropout 指“旨在防止学生辍学/退学的”。

definition.en: Designed to prevent students from leaving school or a program before finishing (dropping out).
definition.zh: 旨在防止学生在完成学业或项目之前退学（辍学）的。

examples.en: The school started an anti-dropout program for ninth graders.
examples.zh: 学校为九年级学生启动了一项防辍学项目。

examples.en: Anti-dropout measures include tutoring and counseling.
examples.zh: 防辍学措施包括辅导和心理/学业咨询。

examples.en: They collected data to see whether the anti-dropout policy worked.
examples.zh: 他们收集数据来查看这项防辍学政策是否有效。

extraExplanation: “anti- + 名词/动名词”是一种常见构词法，表示“反对/防止……的”。这里的 dropout 指“辍学者/退学（现象）”，所以 anti-dropout 常见于教育政策、社会项目、学校管理等语境。
写作中也常见更正式的表达，如 “dropout-prevention program” 或 “dropout prevention efforts”。

summary.en: Anti-drug means opposed to illegal drugs or drug abuse, or aimed at preventing drug use.
summary.zh: anti-drug 指“反毒的”，即反对非法毒品或药物滥用、或旨在预防吸毒的。

definition.en: Opposed to illegal drugs or drug abuse; intended to prevent drug use or reduce drug-related harm.
definition.zh: 反毒的；反对非法毒品或药物滥用的；旨在预防吸毒或减少毒品危害的。

examples.en: The school started an anti-drug campaign for middle school students.
examples.zh: 学校为初中生发起了一项反毒宣传活动。

examples.en: She joined an anti-drug organization that teaches kids how to say no.
examples.zh: 她加入了一个反毒组织，教孩子如何拒绝毒品。

examples.en: The city funded anti-drug programs in neighborhoods with high overdose rates.
examples.zh: 这座城市为过量用药率高的社区提供资金支持反毒项目。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对、抵制”。“anti-drug”常用来修饰名词（anti-drug campaign/program/message）。在美式英语中常写作带连字符的 anti-drug，尤其放在名词前；有时也会看到 antidrug 的写法，但较少见。
语境上，“anti-drug”多指“反对非法毒品/滥用”的立场或教育宣传；如果是药物本身（例如抗癌药、抗菌药），英语通常用 “anti-”+具体对象（anti-cancer, antibacterial），而不是用 anti-drug 来表示“抗药”。

summary.en: An organized public effort to prevent and discourage drug use.
summary.zh: 有组织的反毒/禁毒宣传与行动。

definition.en: A public effort (often by the government, schools, or NGOs) to discourage people from using illegal drugs and to promote prevention, treatment, and healthy choices.
definition.zh: 反毒／禁毒宣传活动：通常由政府、学校或公益组织发起，旨在劝阻吸毒、推广预防与戒治，并倡导健康选择。

examples.en: The city launched an anti-drug campaign in local schools.
examples.zh: 这座城市在当地学校发起了反毒宣传活动。

examples.en: The anti-drug campaign focused on prevention and counseling, not just punishment.
examples.zh: 这场反毒宣传强调预防和辅导，而不只是惩罚。

examples.en: He volunteered to design posters for an anti-drug campaign.
examples.zh: 他志愿为反毒宣传活动设计海报。

extraExplanation: 常见搭配：launch/run/lead an anti-drug campaign（发起/开展/领导反毒运动）；anti-drug awareness campaign（反毒意识宣传）；anti-drug education（反毒教育）。
语气与语境：多用于公共政策、学校教育、媒体宣传等正式语境；更口语可说：drug prevention campaign（预防毒品的宣传）。
etymology: “anti-”表示“反对、抵制”（源自希腊语 anti-，意为“对抗、相反”），“campaign”原指军事行动，后来引申为“有组织的长期活动/宣传”。合在一起就是“反对毒品的宣传/行动”。
mnemonic: 把 anti- 记成“反- / 抗-”，像中文里的“反毒”。看到 anti-drug 就是“反对毒品”。
campaign 可联想成“camp（营地）+ aim（目标）”：有组织、有目标的一系列活动＝宣传运动。

summary.en: “Anti-dry” describes something made to prevent or reduce dryness, especially in personal-care products.
summary.zh: “anti-dry”指用于防止或减轻干燥的，常见于个护产品描述。

definition.en: (Product/ingredient) designed to prevent dryness or reduce the feeling of dry skin, lips, hair, or eyes.
definition.zh: （产品/成分）用于防止干燥或减轻皮肤、嘴唇、头发或眼睛等干燥不适的。

examples.en: This hand cream has an anti-dry formula for winter weather.
examples.zh: 这款护手霜有防干燥配方，适合冬天使用。

examples.en: Look for anti-dry shampoo if your scalp feels tight and flaky.
examples.zh: 如果你的头皮感觉紧绷、起屑，可以找防干燥洗发水。

examples.en: These anti-dry wipes are gentle enough for everyday use.
examples.zh: 这些防干燥湿巾足够温和，适合每天使用。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/防止”。“anti-dry”多见于商品标签与广告文案（如护肤品、洗护用品），属于偏口语化的市场用语。更正式或更常见的表达包括：“moisturizing（保湿的）”“hydrating（补水的）”“anti-drying（防止变干的）”。
连字符（anti-dry）常用于把前缀和形容词连接成复合形容词；有时也会写作“anti dry”（较少见）或用更自然的说法替换，如“prevents dryness（防止干燥）”。

summary.en: “Anti-drying” means moisturizing or preventing dryness, often used to describe skincare, haircare, or cleansing products.
summary.zh: “Anti-drying”指“保湿/抗干燥”，常用于护肤、护发或清洁类产品的功效描述。

definition.en: (Of a product or ingredient) designed to prevent skin, hair, or another surface from becoming dry; moisturizing.
definition.zh: （指产品或成分）用于防止皮肤、头发或其他表面变干的；保湿的、抗干燥的。

examples.en: This hand cream has an anti-drying formula for winter weather.
examples.zh: 这款护手霜配方抗干燥，适合冬天使用。

examples.en: Choose an anti-drying shampoo if your scalp feels tight after washing.
examples.zh: 如果你洗完头皮会紧绷，选择抗干燥洗发水更合适。

examples.en: The mask includes anti-drying ingredients like glycerin and hyaluronic acid.
examples.zh: 这款面膜含有甘油、透明质酸等抗干燥成分。

extraExplanation: “anti-drying”常见于护肤、护发、清洁用品的包装或说明中，属于产品功效描述，意思接近“moisturizing / hydrating”。
英语里常用连字符（anti-drying）把“anti-（抗、反）”和“drying（变干的）”连成一个形容词；也可能写成“anti drying”或“anti-dry”，但连字符形式在标签文案中更常见。

summary.en: “Anti-duke” means against a duke or ducal rule; it can describe a stance (adj.) or the people holding it (n.).
summary.zh: “anti-duke”指反对公爵或公爵统治；可作形容词表示立场，也可作名词指反对者。

definition.en: opposed to a duke, a dukedom, or ducal (duke-related) power or influence.
definition.zh: 反对公爵、反对公国或反对公爵（贵族）势力/影响的。

examples.en: The rebels formed an anti-duke movement after the duke raised taxes.
examples.zh: 公爵加税后，叛军组织了一个反公爵运动。

examples.en: Her speech sounded strongly anti-duke and pro-democracy.
examples.zh: 她的演讲明显反公爵、支持民主。

definition.en: a person or group that is against a duke or ducal rule.
definition.zh: 反对公爵或反对公爵统治的人（或团体）。

examples.en: In the story, the anti-dukes meet in secret to plan a protest.
examples.zh: 在故事里，反公爵派秘密集会策划抗议。

examples.en: He was labeled an anti-duke by the royal court.
examples.zh: 他被王室贴上“反公爵”的标签。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是英语常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制”。“anti-duke”不是固定常用词，更像是根据语境临时造出来的表达，常见于历史叙述、政治评论、奇幻小说或游戏设定中。
更自然的替换说法可能是：anti-ducal（反公爵的/反公爵统治的）、anti-aristocratic（反贵族的）、anti-nobility（反贵族阶层的）。具体用哪个取决于你要强调“反对某位公爵个人”还是“反对贵族制度”。

summary.en: Anti-dumping refers to policies or actions that fight unfairly low-priced imports (dumping), often by adding special tariffs.
summary.zh: anti-dumping 指反制不公平低价进口（倾销）的政策或行动，常通过加征反倾销税等方式实现。

definition.en: (trade/business) Intended to stop “dumping,” the practice of exporting goods at unfairly low prices; often describing laws, investigations, or tariffs used to protect local industries.
definition.zh: （贸易/商业）用于反制“倾销”（以不公平的低价出口商品）的；常用于形容相关法律、调查或关税，以保护本国产业。

examples.en: The government imposed anti-dumping duties on imported steel.
examples.zh: 政府对进口钢铁征收了反倾销税。

examples.en: The company filed an anti-dumping complaint against a foreign competitor.
examples.zh: 这家公司对一家外国竞争对手提出了反倾销申诉。

examples.en: An anti-dumping investigation can take months and involves price and cost data.
examples.zh: 反倾销调查可能持续数月，并涉及价格与成本数据。

definition.en: Anti-dumping measures or actions (such as special tariffs) taken to counter dumping.
definition.zh: 反倾销措施；为对抗倾销而采取的行动（如征收特别关税）。

examples.en: The new anti-dumping will likely raise prices for some consumers.
examples.zh: 新的反倾销措施可能会让部分消费者面临更高价格。

examples.en: Several countries coordinated their anti-dumping actions in the same sector.
examples.zh: 多个国家在同一行业协调了反倾销行动。

extraExplanation: “dumping（倾销）”在国际贸易中通常指出口商在国外市场的售价低于其本国市场价格，或低于成本，从而对进口国相关产业造成损害。
“anti-dumping duties（反倾销税）”是常见工具：在调查认定存在倾销且造成损害后，进口国可加征额外关税。
在新闻与政策文件里常见搭配：anti-dumping duties（反倾销税）、anti-dumping investigation（反倾销调查）、anti-dumping measures（反倾销措施）、anti-dumping petition/complaint（反倾销申请/申诉）。

summary.en: Anti-dynastic means opposing a ruling dynasty or dynastic (hereditary) rule.
summary.zh: anti-dynastic 指反对某一统治王朝或反对王朝（世袭）统治。

definition.en: opposed to a ruling dynasty (a hereditary royal ruling family) or to dynastic rule in general
definition.zh: 反对某一王朝（世袭统治家族）或反对王朝统治的

examples.en: The newspaper published several anti-dynastic essays criticizing the royal family’s control of the government.
examples.zh: 这家报纸发表了几篇反王朝的文章，批评皇室对政府的控制。

examples.en: Anti-dynastic movements often grow during periods of famine, corruption, or military defeat.
examples.zh: 在饥荒、腐败或军事失败时期，反王朝运动往往会兴起。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，“dynastic”来自“dynasty（王朝）”。合起来多用于历史或政治语境，描述反对某个世袭政权或“王朝政治”的立场、言论或运动。
在中文历史叙述中，可对应“反清/反明/反某朝”等表达，但英文的 anti-dynastic 更强调“反王朝体制或某个王朝统治”，不一定等同于现代意义的“反君主制（anti-monarchy）”，两者有时重叠但不完全相同。

summary.en: Anti-dysentery means used to prevent or treat dysentery.
summary.zh: anti-dysentery 指用于预防或治疗痢疾的（药物或措施）。

definition.en: preventing or treating dysentery (an intestinal infection that causes severe diarrhea, sometimes with blood).
definition.zh: 用于预防或治疗痢疾（肠道感染，会引起严重腹泻，有时带血）。

examples.en: The clinic distributed anti-dysentery tablets after the flood.
examples.zh: 洪水过后，诊所发放了抗痢疾药片。

examples.en: Soldiers were given anti-dysentery medicine before traveling to areas with unsafe water.
examples.zh: 士兵在前往饮用水不安全的地区前领取了抗痢疾药物。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反……、抗……、预防/对抗……”。因此 anti-dysentery 通常用来修饰药物、疫苗、措施等，意思是“抗痢疾的/防痢的”。
“dysentery（痢疾）”在历史上常与战争、灾害、卫生条件差和不洁饮水有关，所以在公共卫生语境中常见到如 anti-dysentery drugs/measures（抗痢疾药物/措施）这类搭配。

summary.en: Anti-dysrhythmic describes medicines or actions that prevent or treat abnormal heart rhythms (arrhythmias).
summary.zh: anti-dysrhythmic 用来描述预防或治疗心律失常（异常心律）的药物或措施。

definition.en: (Medicine) Preventing or treating an abnormal heart rhythm; antiarrhythmic.
definition.zh: （医学）用于预防或治疗心律失常的；抗心律失常的。

examples.en: Amiodarone is an anti-dysrhythmic drug used to control certain irregular heartbeats.
examples.zh: 胺碘酮是一种抗心律失常药，用于控制某些不规则心跳。

examples.en: The doctor prescribed an anti-dysrhythmic medication after the patient’s arrhythmia was confirmed.
examples.zh: 在确认患者心律失常后，医生开了抗心律失常药物。

extraExplanation: “anti-dysrhythmic”主要见于医学语境，日常与临床更常用的拼写是“antiarrhythmic”。两者含义基本相同。
词源上：anti- 表示“反/对抗”，dys- 表示“异常/功能不良”，rhythm 指“节律”，合起来就是“对抗异常节律（心律）”。
常见相关词：arrhythmia（心律失常），antiarrhythmic drug（抗心律失常药），dysrhythmia（心律失常，较少用）。

summary.en: Anti-dysuria means relieving or preventing painful/difficult urination, or a medicine used for that purpose.
summary.zh: anti-dysuria 指缓解或预防排尿疼痛/困难的（药物或治疗），也可指此类药物本身。

definition.en: (Medicine) Relieving or preventing dysuria (painful or difficult urination); used to describe a drug or treatment.
definition.zh: （医学）缓解或预防排尿困难/排尿疼痛（dysuria）的；常用来形容药物或治疗方法。

examples.en: The doctor prescribed an anti-dysuria medication to ease burning during urination.
examples.zh: 医生开了抗排尿痛药物来缓解排尿时的灼痛感。

examples.en: Some herbal teas are marketed as anti-dysuria remedies, but evidence varies.
examples.zh: 一些草本茶被宣传为缓解排尿痛的“抗排尿痛”偏方，但证据不一。

definition.en: A drug or agent used to relieve dysuria.
definition.zh: 缓解排尿困难/排尿疼痛的药物或制剂；抗排尿痛药。

examples.en: An anti-dysuria may reduce discomfort, but it does not always treat the underlying infection.
examples.zh: 抗排尿痛药可能减轻不适，但不一定能治疗潜在感染。

extraExplanation: 这是由前缀 anti-（“反/对/抑制”）+ dysuria（“排尿困难或疼痛”）构成的医学用语。在日常英语里更常见的说法是 “medication for painful urination” 或具体药名（如 urinary analgesic 一类）。
如果症状来自尿路感染、结石或前列腺问题，仅用“anti-dysuria”类止痛/缓解药可能掩盖症状而延误治疗；英文医疗语境中常会同时强调“treat the cause”。

summary.en: Anti-Earth is a hypothetical (or fictional) “counter-Earth,” imagined as a hidden twin world opposite Earth, often used in science fiction or symbolism.
summary.zh: Anti-Earth 指假想或虚构的“反地球/对地球”：被想象为位于太阳另一侧、与地球对称（或镜像）的隐藏世界，也常用于科幻与象征表达。

definition.en: a hypothetical planet on the opposite side of the Sun from Earth, imagined to share Earth’s orbit so it is always hidden from our view
definition.zh: （假想的）“反地球”：被设想与地球共用轨道、始终位于太阳另一侧、因此从地球看不见的行星

examples.en: Some early science-fiction stories used the idea of an anti-Earth to explain a hidden twin world.
examples.zh: 一些早期科幻故事用“反地球”的设定来解释一个隐藏的孪生世界。

examples.en: Astronomers do not support the anti-Earth idea because its gravity would affect other planets in detectable ways.
examples.zh: 天文学家不支持“反地球”设想，因为它的引力会以可观测的方式影响其他行星。

definition.en: (by extension) a fictional or symbolic “mirror Earth,” often used to explore alternative histories or societies
definition.zh: （引申义）虚构或象征性的“镜像地球/对照地球”，常用于探讨不同历史走向或社会形态

examples.en: The novel sets its plot on an anti-Earth where small choices in history led to a very different culture.
examples.zh: 这部小说把故事设定在一个“镜像地球”上，历史中的小选择导致了截然不同的文化。

examples.en: In the film, anti-Earth is less a real planet and more a metaphor for facing yourself.
examples.zh: 在这部电影里，“反地球”与其说是真实行星，不如说是“直面自我”的隐喻。

extraExplanation: “anti-Earth”也常写作“Counter-Earth（对地球/反地球）”。这个设想与古希腊毕达哥拉斯学派提出的“Antichthon（反地球）”有关：他们认为在地球背面还有一颗与地球相对的天体。
从现代天文学角度看，这种“与地球同轨道且永远躲在太阳背后”的行星难以成立：它的引力效应以及与其他天体的动力学稳定性问题，通常会留下可观测线索。
在流行文化与科幻作品中，“anti-Earth”常被用作叙事装置：制造“隐藏的双生世界”、对照现实社会，或象征“另一个可能的自己/世界”。

summary.en: Anti-eavesdropping means intended to stop or detect secret listening and protect private conversations.
summary.zh: Anti-eavesdropping 指“反窃听的”，用于防止或侦测秘密偷听，保护私密交流。

definition.en: Designed to prevent, detect, or reduce secret listening or interception (for example, hidden microphones or wiretapping).
definition.zh: 用于防止、侦测或降低他人秘密偷听/窃听（例如隐藏麦克风或电话窃听）的。

examples.en: The embassy installed anti-eavesdropping equipment in meeting rooms.
examples.zh: 大使馆在会议室安装了反窃听设备。

examples.en: They used an anti-eavesdropping app to make calls more secure.
examples.zh: 他们使用反窃听应用来让通话更安全。

examples.en: Anti-eavesdropping measures are common during sensitive negotiations.
examples.zh: 在敏感谈判期间，采取反窃听措施很常见。

definition.en: Relating to technologies, policies, or actions that protect private conversations from being overheard.
definition.zh: 与保护私密对话不被旁听相关的技术、政策或措施。

examples.en: The company updated its anti-eavesdropping policy for remote meetings.
examples.zh: 公司更新了远程会议的反窃听政策。

examples.en: Anti-eavesdropping training teaches staff how to spot suspicious devices.
examples.zh: 反窃听培训会教员工如何识别可疑设备。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/防止”，而“eavesdropping”原指站在屋檐下偷听别人说话，后来泛指任何形式的秘密监听。
在现实语境中，它常见于安防与隐私领域：如“anti-eavesdropping device（反窃听设备）”“anti-eavesdropping measures（反窃听措施）”。有时也会写作“anti eavesdropping”或“anti-eavesdropping”。

summary.en: Anti-ecclesiastical means opposing the church as an institution, especially its power or influence in society and government.
summary.zh: Anti-ecclesiastical 指反对教会作为一种制度性机构（尤其其在社会与政治中的权力与影响）。

definition.en: Opposed to the church (especially the established Christian church) or to the power, influence, or privileges of clergy and church institutions.
definition.zh: 反教会的；反对（尤其是国教或基督教）教会机构、神职人员权力与影响力的。

examples.en: The new law was seen as anti-ecclesiastical because it reduced the church’s control over schools.
examples.zh: 这项新法律被视为反教会的，因为它削弱了教会对学校的控制。

examples.en: In some periods of European history, anti-ecclesiastical movements grew alongside calls for secular government.
examples.zh: 在欧洲历史的某些时期，反教会运动常与“建立世俗政府”的呼声一起兴起。

extraExplanation: “ecclesiastical”来自希腊语 *ekklesia*（集会、教会），常指与教会组织、教会法、神职人员相关的事物；加上前缀“anti-”就表示“反对”。
“anti-ecclesiastical”多用于历史、政治或社会评论语境，强调对教会作为一种制度性力量的反对；不一定等于“反宗教”（anti-religious）或“反基督教”（anti-Christian），而更偏向反对教会的政治/社会权力。
相关词可对比：secular（世俗的）、anticlerical（反教权的/反神职的，常更聚焦“神职人员”）、laicism/laïcité（强调政教分离的理念，常见于法语语境）。

summary.en: Anti-edema describes medicines or treatments that reduce or prevent swelling (edema).
summary.zh: anti-edema 指能减少或预防水肿（肿胀）的药物或治疗。

definition.en: (Medicine) reducing or preventing edema (swelling caused by extra fluid in body tissues).
definition.zh: （医学）消肿的；抗水肿的（能减少或预防因组织液体增多导致的肿胀）。

examples.en: The doctor prescribed an anti-edema drug to reduce the swelling in her legs.
examples.zh: 医生开了抗水肿药来减轻她腿部的肿胀。

examples.en: Anti-edema treatment is common after surgery to help control inflammation and fluid buildup.
examples.zh: 手术后常用消肿治疗来控制炎症和液体积聚。

examples.en: This compression stocking has an anti-edema effect for some patients.
examples.zh: 这种弹力袜对一些患者有消肿作用。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反、抗、预防”；“edema”指“水肿/组织积液引起的肿胀”。在临床语境里常搭配 drug/therapy/effect（抗水肿药/治疗/作用）。
更常见的日常表达是“to reduce swelling（消肿/减轻肿胀）”。医学写作里也可能看到同义的“anti-edematous”。

summary.en: “Anti-education” means opposition to education or something that discourages learning.
summary.zh: “anti-education”指反对教育，或指压制、贬低学习与受教育的做法或立场。

definition.en: Opposition to education, schooling, or the idea that people should be educated; attitudes, policies, or actions that discourage learning.
definition.zh: 反教育；反对教育（或反对人们接受教育）的态度、政策或行为；压制或贬低学习的倾向。

examples.en: The group’s anti-education rhetoric portrayed teachers as enemies.
examples.zh: 该团体的反教育言论把教师描绘成敌人。

examples.en: Cutting library funding was criticized as an anti-education move.
examples.zh: 削减图书馆经费被批评为一种反教育的举动。

examples.en: In the novel, the ruler’s anti-education policies kept ordinary people powerless.
examples.zh: 在小说中，统治者的反教育政策让普通人长期处于无力状态。

definition.en: Opposing education or promoting the rejection of learning; discouraging study or schooling.
definition.zh: 反教育的；反对受教育或鼓励拒绝学习的；抑制学习的。

examples.en: Some commentators called the proposal anti-education.
examples.zh: 一些评论员称该提案为反教育的。

examples.en: An anti-education message can spread quickly online.
examples.zh: 反教育的信息在网上可能传播得很快。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，常用于构成带批评意味的词（如 anti-war 反战）。因此 anti-education 往往带有强烈立场色彩，常见于新闻评论、政治讨论或社会批评语境。
写法上既可写作 anti-education（较常见、强调整体概念），也可能写作 anti education 或 anti–education（不同排版习惯）。作为形容词时，通常放在名词前：anti-education policy / anti-education rhetoric。

summary.en: “Anti-educationally” means “in a way that opposes or undermines education.”
summary.zh: “anti-educationally”指“以反对或削弱教育的方式”。

definition.en: In a way that opposes education, learning, or the value of schooling.
definition.zh: 以反教育的方式；以反对教育、学习或学校价值的方式。

examples.en: The policy was criticized for treating libraries and teachers anti-educationally.
examples.zh: 这项政策因以反教育的方式对待图书馆和教师而受到批评。

examples.en: He spoke anti-educationally, suggesting that reading was a waste of time.
examples.zh: 他以反教育的口吻发言，暗示阅读是在浪费时间。

definition.en: In a way that harms or undermines educational goals or outcomes.
definition.zh: 以损害或削弱教育目标与成效的方式。

examples.en: Cutting art classes may affect students anti-educationally by reducing creative practice.
examples.zh: 削减艺术课可能会以不利教育的方式影响学生，因为这会减少创造性练习。

examples.en: The constant interruptions shaped the discussion anti-educationally, leaving little time for learning.
examples.zh: 不断的打断以不利教育的方式影响了讨论，使学习时间所剩无几。

synonyms: in a way that undermines education
extraExplanation: “anti-educationally”由前缀 anti-（反对）+ educational（教育的）+ -ly（副词后缀）构成，意思是“以反教育/不利于教育的方式”。
这个词相对少见，更常见的表达是用短语：“in an anti-educational way”或“in a way that undermines education”。在正式评论（政策、社会议题、教育讨论）中更容易出现。
注意语气：它通常带批评色彩，用来评价言论、政策或做法对学习与教育价值的负面影响。

summary.en: “Anti-egalitarian” means opposing equality or egalitarian ideas.
summary.zh: “anti-egalitarian”指反对平等（平等主义）观念。

definition.en: Opposed to egalitarianism; against the idea that all people should have equal rights, status, or opportunities.
definition.zh: 反平等主义的；反对“人人应享有平等权利、地位或机会”的观念。

examples.en: Some critics call the policy anti-egalitarian because it widens the gap between rich and poor.
examples.zh: 一些批评者称该政策是反平等主义的，因为它扩大了贫富差距。

examples.en: An anti-egalitarian view may argue that society works best with clear hierarchies.
examples.zh: 反平等主义观点可能认为社会在明确的等级结构下运作得最好。

definition.en: A person who opposes egalitarian ideas.
definition.zh: 反平等主义者；反对平等主义的人。

examples.en: He was labeled an anti-egalitarian for rejecting equal access to education.
examples.zh: 由于反对教育平等机会，他被贴上“反平等主义者”的标签。

extraExplanation: “egalitarian”来自“equality（平等）”，指主张社会、政治或经济层面的平等；加上前缀“anti-”表示“反对”。在政治讨论或学术写作中更常见，日常口语里人们可能更常说“against equality / not in favor of equality”。
使用时要注意语气：把某人或某政策称为“anti-egalitarian”往往带有批评意味，暗示其立场会造成不平等或维护特权。也可更中性地用于描述某些强调等级、精英统治或差异化待遇的理论立场。

summary.en: Anti-egoism means opposition to egoism—the view that people should not act only for their own self-interest.
summary.zh: Anti-egoism 指反对利己主义：认为人不应只为自身利益而行动。

definition.en: Opposition to egoism; the belief that people should not act only for their own self-interest, especially in moral or philosophical discussions.
definition.zh: 反对利己主义；指一种（常见于伦理学/哲学讨论中的）观点：人不应只为自身利益而行动。

examples.en: Some moral philosophers defend anti-egoism by arguing that we have duties to help others.
examples.zh: 一些道德哲学家用“我们有帮助他人的义务”来为反利己主义辩护。

examples.en: In her essay, she contrasts egoism with anti-egoism and supports a more caring social ethic.
examples.zh: 在她的文章里，她把利己主义与反利己主义作对比，并支持一种更关怀他人的社会伦理。

examples.en: The group’s rules reflect anti-egoism: members are expected to share resources when others are in need.
examples.zh: 这个团体的规则体现了反利己主义：当他人有需要时，成员应当分享资源。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是表示“反对/对立”的前缀（如 anti-war 反战；anti-social 反社会的）。“egoism”指“利己主义/自我中心的思想”。合起来 anti-egoism 多用于学术或正式语境，日常英语里更常见的近义表达是 “altruism（利他主义）” 或 “opposition to egoism（反对利己主义）”。
在伦理学里，anti-egoism 常与“我们是否有对他人的道德义务”相关；它不一定要求“完全无私”，而是强调不能把自我利益当作唯一或最高的行动理由。

summary.en: Anti-egotism means opposing egotism and trying to avoid excessive self-importance.
summary.zh: anti-egotism 指反对自我中心与自大，强调避免过度看重自我。

definition.en: Opposition to egotism; the belief or practice of avoiding excessive self-focus and self-importance.
definition.zh: 反自我主义；反对自我中心与自我夸大的观念或做法。

examples.en: In their community, anti-egotism is valued as a way to keep leaders accountable.
examples.zh: 在他们的社群里，反自我主义被视为让领导者保持自律与负责的一种方式。

examples.en: Her writing shows a quiet anti-egotism, putting the story ahead of the author’s ego.
examples.zh: 她的写作呈现出一种安静的反自我主义，把故事放在作者自我之上。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，因此 anti-egotism 字面意思就是“反对 egotism（自我中心、自大）”。这个词在日常英语中不算常见，更常见的表达有 humility（谦逊）、selflessness（无私）、lack of ego（不太有架子/不那么自我）。
拼写上常见为 anti-egotism 或 anti-egotistic（形容词）。也可能看到 anti-egoism（更偏哲学/伦理语境的“反利己主义”）。
使用语境多出现在道德评价、组织文化、写作风格或精神修养等讨论中，强调“降低自我中心”而不是简单的“自我否定”。

summary.en: An anti-electron is a positron, the positively charged antimatter version of an electron.
summary.zh: anti-electron 指正电子，即带正电的电子反粒子。

definition.en: a positron; the antimatter partner of the electron, with the same mass but a positive electric charge.
definition.zh: 正电子；电子的反物质对应粒子，质量相同但带正电荷。

examples.en: In medical imaging, anti-electrons are produced indirectly in PET scans.
examples.zh: 在医学影像中，PET 扫描会间接产生正电子（反电子）。

examples.en: When an anti-electron meets an electron, they can annihilate and release energy.
examples.zh: 当正电子（反电子）遇到电子时，它们可能发生湮灭并释放能量。

extraExplanation: “Anti-electron”在日常英语里不如“positron”常见；科学写作更常用“positron（正电子）”。
正电子最早与“反物质（antimatter）”的概念相关：它是电子的“反粒子（antiparticle）”。在科普与影视作品里常出现“反物质”主题，但现实中正电子通常出现在高能物理与医学成像等领域。
PET（正电子发射断层扫描）利用某些放射性同位素的β⁺衰变产生正电子；正电子与电子湮灭后会产生伽马射线信号，用于成像。

summary.en: Anti-elite means opposing or criticizing elites and their influence; it can also refer to a person with that stance.
summary.zh: anti-elite 指反对或批评精英阶层及其影响；也可指持这种立场的人。

definition.en: Opposed to elites (powerful, wealthy, highly educated, or politically influential groups), or criticizing them as out of touch with ordinary people.
definition.zh: 反精英的；反对或批评“精英阶层”（有权势、有财富、高学历或在政治上有影响力的人群），认为他们脱离普通民众。

examples.en: The candidate ran on an anti-elite message, promising to ‘shake up’ the system.
examples.zh: 这位候选人以反精英的信息参选，承诺要“搅动/改革”体制。

examples.en: Her anti-elite comments resonated with voters who felt ignored.
examples.zh: 她的反精英言论引起了那些觉得被忽视的选民的共鸣。

examples.en: Some media outlets framed the protests as anti-elite anger.
examples.zh: 一些媒体把抗议描述为反精英的愤怒。

definition.en: A person who is strongly opposed to elites or elite influence in society and politics.
definition.zh: 反精英主义者；强烈反对精英阶层或其影响的人。

examples.en: He describes himself as an anti-elite who distrusts big institutions.
examples.zh: 他自称是反精英主义者，不信任大型机构。

examples.en: Anti-elites often argue that policy is made for insiders, not the public.
examples.zh: 反精英主义者常主张政策是为“圈内人”制定的，而不是为公众。

extraExplanation: “anti-elite”常用于政治与社会讨论，语气可能带批评或对立色彩；它不一定等同于“反智”（anti-intellectual）。“反精英”更多是针对权力结构与社会地位，而“反智”更针对知识与专家。
拼写上常见连字符 anti-elite（尤其作定语时：anti-elite rhetoric）；也可见写作 anti-elitist（更强调“反精英主义者/反精英立场”）或 anti-elitism（反精英主义，名词）。

summary.en: Anti-elitism means opposition to elites or to elite authority and “highbrow” culture, often emphasizing ordinary people’s interests.
summary.zh: Anti-elitism 指反对精英阶层或精英权威/高雅文化，常强调普通人的利益与声音。

definition.en: Opposition to elites (powerful, wealthy, highly educated, or socially privileged groups), often based on the belief that these groups are out of touch with ordinary people.
definition.zh: 反精英主义：反对“精英”（有权、有钱、受高等教育或拥有社会特权的人群/阶层），常基于一种看法：这些人脱离普通民众的生活与需求。

examples.en: Anti-elitism is common in populist campaigns that criticize political insiders.
examples.zh: 在批评政治圈内人的民粹主义竞选中，反精英主义很常见。

examples.en: Her speech used anti-elitism to argue that ordinary workers should have more influence.
examples.zh: 她的演讲运用反精英主义来主张普通工人应该有更大的影响力。

definition.en: A style or attitude that rejects “highbrow” tastes and expert authority, favoring what is seen as more ordinary, practical, or popular.
definition.zh: 一种态度或风格：反对“高雅/精英品味”和专家权威，偏好被认为更朴素、实用或大众化的东西。

examples.en: The show’s anti-elitism made it proud of being simple and accessible.
examples.zh: 这档节目带有反精英的取向，以“简单易懂”为荣。

examples.en: His anti-elitism sometimes sounded like distrust of any expert advice.
examples.zh: 他的反精英立场有时听起来像是不信任任何专家建议。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/对抗”。“elitism”指认为精英应当主导社会或拥有更高地位的观念；因此 anti-elitism 就是对这种观念或对精英群体的反感与反对。
语境提示：anti-elitism 在政治新闻中常与“populism（民粹主义）”一起出现，但两者不完全等同；反精英主义可以是民粹话语的一部分，也可能只是对特权阶层的不满。
使用时要注意语气：它既可中性描述一种立场，也可能带批评意味（暗示“情绪化地反专家/反知识”）。

summary.en: Anti-elitist describes ideas, actions, or attitudes that oppose elites and their perceived privilege or control.
summary.zh: Anti-elitist 用来形容反对精英阶层及其被认为拥有的特权或控制力的观点、做法或态度。

definition.en: Opposed to elites (especially powerful, wealthy, highly educated, or politically influential groups) and their perceived control or privilege.
definition.zh: 反精英的；反对精英阶层（尤指有权、有钱、受高等教育或在政治上有影响力的人）及其被认为的控制或特权。

examples.en: Her campaign used anti-elitist language to appeal to working-class voters.
examples.zh: 她的竞选用反精英的措辞来吸引工人阶层选民。

examples.en: The article criticizes the party’s anti-elitist attitude toward universities and experts.
examples.zh: 这篇文章批评该党对大学和专家的反精英态度。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，与“elitist（精英主义的/偏向精英的）”结合，常用于政治与社会评论。
“anti-elitist”不一定等于“反智（anti-intellectual）”。它更常针对“谁掌握资源与话语权”，而不是反对知识本身；不过在语境中两者有时会被混用。
相关表达：anti-establishment（反建制的）、populist（民粹主义的/迎合普通民众的）。使用时注意语气：可以是中性描述，也可能带批评意味。

summary.en: Anti-empiric means opposing empiricism or evidence-based, experimental ways of knowing (and less commonly, a person who opposes them).
summary.zh: anti-empiric 指反对经验主义或以证据与实验为基础的认识方式（也可较少见地指反对者本人）。

definition.en: Opposed to empiricism or to using observation, experiments, and evidence as the main way to gain knowledge.
definition.zh: 反对经验主义的；反对以观察、实验与证据作为主要求知方法的。

examples.en: His anti-empiric approach relied on pure logic instead of experiments.
examples.zh: 他的反经验主义做法依靠纯逻辑，而不是实验。

examples.en: The paper criticizes anti-empiric attitudes in scientific research.
examples.zh: 这篇论文批评科研中的反经验主义态度。

definition.en: (Less common) A person who opposes empiricism or empirical methods.
definition.zh: （较少见）反对经验主义或实证方法的人。

examples.en: In the debate, she was labeled an anti-empiric for dismissing data.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，她因为否定数据而被贴上“反经验主义者”的标签。

extraExplanation: “anti-empiric”常见于哲学、科学方法论的语境：empiricism（经验主义）强调知识来自感官经验与可检验的证据；anti-empiric则倾向强调先验推理、权威、直觉或纯理论等。
在日常英语里更常用的表达是“anti-empirical”（反实证的/反经验的）或“anti-empiricism”（反经验主义）。

summary.en: Anti-empirical means opposing or not relying on evidence from observation and experiment.
summary.zh: anti-empirical 指反对或不依赖观察与实验等实证证据。

definition.en: Opposed to, dismissive of, or skeptical about knowledge based on observation, experiment, or real-world evidence (the empirical method).
definition.zh: 反对、否定或怀疑以观察、实验和现实证据为基础的知识或方法（经验/实证方法）。

examples.en: His anti-empirical attitude made him reject data from experiments.
examples.zh: 他反实证的态度让他拒绝接受实验数据。

examples.en: The essay criticizes an anti-empirical approach to psychology that ignores measurable results.
examples.zh: 这篇文章批评一种忽视可测量结果的反实证心理学方法。

definition.en: Not based on evidence from experience or observation; more reliant on theory, intuition, or ideology than on data.
definition.zh: 不以经验或观察证据为依据；更依赖理论、直觉或意识形态而非数据。

examples.en: The claim sounds anti-empirical because it offers no testable evidence.
examples.zh: 这个说法听起来很反实证，因为它没有提供可检验的证据。

examples.en: Some debates become anti-empirical when people argue only from belief and not from facts.
examples.zh: 有些争论会变得反实证，因为人们只从信念出发而不是基于事实。

extraExplanation: “anti-empirical”常见于哲学、科学方法论与社会科学写作中，用来批评某种立场“忽视数据/不可检验”。它通常带有负面评价色彩。
empirical（实证的）强调“可观察、可测量、可重复验证”；anti-empirical 则暗示“拒绝或轻视这些标准”。
近义表达可包括：non-empirical（非实证的，较中性）、unscientific（不科学的，偏批评）、evidence-resistant（抗拒证据的）。

summary.en: Opposition to empiricism; the view that knowledge is not mainly grounded in sensory experience.
summary.zh: 反对经验主义的立场；认为知识不主要建立在感官经验之上。

definition.en: A philosophical view that rejects or strongly criticizes empiricism (the idea that knowledge mainly comes from sense experience and observation), emphasizing instead reason, innate ideas, intuition, or non-empirical methods.
definition.zh: 一种哲学立场，反对或强烈批评经验主义（认为知识主要来自感官经验与观察），转而强调理性、先天观念、直觉或非经验的方法。

examples.en: Kant is sometimes read as responding to empiricism with a form of anti-empiricism that gives the mind an active role in shaping experience.
examples.zh: 康德常被解读为在回应经验主义时采取某种反经验主义立场，强调心灵在塑造经验中的主动作用。

examples.en: The author’s anti-empiricism leads her to doubt that scientific measurement alone can explain consciousness.
examples.zh: 作者的反经验主义使她怀疑仅靠科学测量无法解释意识。

extraExplanation: “anti-empiricism”常见于哲学与认识论讨论中，用来概括对“知识必须以经验/观察为基础”的反对意见。它不一定是否定科学本身，而更常是否定“只有经验才算知识来源”的主张。
相关对立与邻近概念：empiricism（经验主义）是主要对立面；rationalism（理性主义）常被视为与之相近；a priori（先验/先天）知识、innate ideas（先天观念）也经常与反经验主义论证一起出现。
在学术写作中，这个词多用于给某位哲学家或某种理论“贴标签”进行归类；不同作者对其范围可能宽窄不一，阅读时要看具体语境。

summary.en: “Anti-empiricist” means opposing empiricism or a person who doubts that observation and experiment are the main sources of knowledge.
summary.zh: “anti-empiricist”指反对经验主义的人，或指一种反经验主义的立场：怀疑观察与实验是知识的主要来源。

definition.en: A person who rejects or strongly doubts empiricism—the view that knowledge should be based mainly on observation and experiment.
definition.zh: 反经验主义者：指拒绝或强烈怀疑“经验主义”的人；经验主义认为知识应主要建立在观察与实验之上。

examples.en: As an anti-empiricist, he argued that some truths can be known through reason alone.
examples.zh: 作为一名反经验主义者，他认为有些真理可以仅凭理性就被认识。

examples.en: The debate between empiricists and anti-empiricists shaped modern philosophy.
examples.zh: 经验主义者与反经验主义者之间的争论塑造了现代哲学。

definition.en: Opposed to empiricism; skeptical of the idea that observation and experiment are the main foundations of knowledge.
definition.zh: 反经验主义的：反对经验主义，或怀疑观察与实验是知识的主要基础。

examples.en: Her anti-empiricist approach emphasized logic and innate ideas.
examples.zh: 她的反经验主义方法强调逻辑与先天观念。

examples.en: Some critics call the theory anti-empiricist because it cannot be tested easily.
examples.zh: 一些批评者称该理论为反经验主义，因为它不容易被检验。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/对立”。“empiricism（经验主义）”在哲学中常与“rationalism（理性主义）”对比：经验主义强调通过感官经验获得知识；理性主义更强调推理、逻辑与先天结构。
在学术语境里，anti-empiricist 往往不是完全否定经验，而是反对“只有经验/主要靠经验”这一立场；具体观点会因领域（哲学、心理学、语言学等）而不同。

summary.en: Anti-endowment means opposing or criticizing institutional endowments; less commonly, it can describe the opposite of the endowment effect in behavioral economics.
summary.zh: Anti-endowment 指反对或批评机构捐赠基金；较少见时也可指行为经济学中与禀赋效应相反的现象。

definition.en: Opposed to (or criticizing) an endowment—especially a large, permanent fund held by an institution such as a university, charity, or foundation.
definition.zh: 反对（或批评）“捐赠基金/校友基金”等长期基金的；尤其指反对大学、慈善机构等持有的大额永久基金。

examples.en: Some lawmakers have proposed anti-endowment taxes on very large university funds.
examples.zh: 一些立法者提出对规模巨大的大学捐赠基金征收“反捐赠基金”性质的税。

examples.en: The article takes an anti-endowment stance, arguing that wealth should be spent now instead of stored indefinitely.
examples.zh: 这篇文章持反捐赠基金立场，认为财富应当用于当下，而不是无限期地储存。

definition.en: (Behavioral economics, less common) Describing an effect or pattern that goes against the “endowment effect,” where owning something does not make people value it more—and may even make them value it less.
definition.zh: （行为经济学，较少见）指与“禀赋效应”相反的现象：拥有某物并不会让人更重视它，甚至可能更不重视。

examples.en: In this experiment, participants showed an anti-endowment pattern: after receiving the mug, they were willing to sell it for less, not more.
examples.zh: 在这项实验中，参与者呈现出反禀赋效应：拿到杯子后，他们愿意以更低而非更高的价格卖出。

examples.en: Researchers debated whether the result was truly anti-endowment or just confusion about prices.
examples.zh: 研究者讨论该结果是否真是反禀赋效应，还是只是对价格的困惑。

extraExplanation: 在新闻与公共政策语境里，anti-endowment 常用于讨论“大学捐赠基金（university endowment）是否应被征税、是否应提高支出比例”等议题。它往往带有价值判断色彩：认为资金不应长期沉淀，而应更直接用于教育、奖学金或公共服务。
在行为经济学里更常见的说法是 anti-endowment effect（反禀赋效应）。经典的 endowment effect 指“拥有会让人更舍不得卖、要价更高”；而“反禀赋效应”则指出现相反方向的结果。

summary.en: “Anti-England” means opposed to England or hostile toward England (often in politics, culture, or sports contexts).
summary.zh: “anti-England”指反英格兰的、对英格兰抱有敌意或抵制的（常见于政治、文化或体育语境）。

definition.en: Opposed to England, its government, culture, or interests; showing hostility or resistance toward England.
definition.zh: 反英格兰的；反对英格兰（其政府、文化或利益）的；对英格兰抱有敌意或抵制的。

examples.en: Some newspapers described the protest as anti-England.
examples.zh: 一些报纸把这场抗议描述为“反英格兰”的。

examples.en: He rejected what he called anti-England stereotypes.
examples.zh: 他反对他所说的“反英格兰”刻板印象。

definition.en: Against an England sports team, especially in international competitions.
definition.zh: （体育语境）反对英格兰队的，尤其指国际比赛中“支持对手、反英格兰队”的。

examples.en: The crowd sounded anti-England during the match.
examples.zh: 比赛期间，观众听起来很“反英格兰队”。

examples.en: Online comments turned strongly anti-England after the loss.
examples.zh: 输球后，网上评论变得非常“反英格兰队”。

extraExplanation: “anti-England”并不是非常固定、常见的词条，更常见的写法是 **anti-English**（反英的/反英国人的）或 **anti-British**（反英/反英国的，涵盖英国整体）。具体用哪个取决于你要指“英格兰（England）”还是“英国（Britain/UK）”。
拼写上常用连字符 **anti-** + 名词/形容词（anti-England, anti-war）。在正式写作里，如果指的是政治立场或社会态度，作者通常会在上下文中明确“反对的对象是什么”（政府政策、文化现象、球迷情绪等），以避免被理解为对人群的偏见或歧视。

summary.en: “Anti-English” means opposed to or hostile toward English people/culture, or opposed to the English language/using English.
summary.zh: “Anti-English”指反英的：可能是反对/敌视英格兰或英国文化、英国人，也可能是反对英语（语言）或反对使用英语。

definition.en: opposed to, hostile toward, or prejudiced against English people, English culture, or England.
definition.zh: 反英的；仇视或偏见对待英格兰/英国文化或英国人的。

examples.en: The article criticized several anti-English stereotypes in the film.
examples.zh: 这篇文章批评了电影里一些反英的刻板印象。

examples.en: Anti-English feeling increased during the political dispute.
examples.zh: 在那次政治争端期间，反英情绪加剧了。

definition.en: opposed to the English language or to using English (for example, in schools or public life).
definition.zh: 反对英语（语言）或反对使用英语（例如在学校或公共场合）。

examples.en: Some parents worried that the policy sounded anti-English and would limit job opportunities.
examples.zh: 一些家长担心该政策听起来像是反对英语，会限制就业机会。

examples.en: The group is not anti-English; it just wants more support for local languages.
examples.zh: 这个团体并不是反对英语；它只是希望更多支持本地语言。

definition.en: anti-English attitudes or sentiment (used mainly in phrases like “anti-English sentiment”).
definition.zh: 反英态度；反英情绪（多用于“anti-English sentiment”等搭配）。

examples.en: The speech was blamed for spreading anti-English sentiment.
examples.zh: 那次演讲被指责在传播反英情绪。

extraExplanation: 拼写上常见两种：anti-English（更常见，带连字符）和 anti English（较少见）。连字符能更清楚地表明它是一个整体形容词。
语用上要注意敏感性：anti-English 可能指政治立场、文化偏见，或只是反对“英语作为主导语言”。写作或讨论时最好明确对象：anti-English policies（反对英语政策） vs. anti-English prejudice（反英偏见）。

summary.en: “Anti-English” means opposed to English people/culture or to the English language, often describing negative sentiment or resistance.
summary.zh: “Anti-English”指反对英国人/英国文化或反对英语（及其影响）的立场或情绪，常用于描述负面态度或抵制。

definition.en: opposed to English people, English culture, or the English language; showing dislike or prejudice toward them.
definition.zh: 反英的；反对英国人、英国文化或英语的；对其表现出反感或偏见的。

examples.en: The newspaper criticized what it called anti-English sentiment in the debate.
examples.zh: 这家报纸批评了辩论中所谓的“反英情绪”。

examples.en: Some students faced anti-English comments because they spoke English in public.
examples.zh: 一些学生因为在公共场合说英语而遭到反英言论。

definition.en: (less common) a person, group, or attitude that is against England/English people or the English language.
definition.zh: （不常用）反英者；反英团体；反英立场/态度。

examples.en: He was labeled an anti-English by his political opponents.
examples.zh: 他被政治对手贴上“反英者”的标签。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是表示“反对/抵制”的前缀，写成“anti-English”时通常用连字符，尤其在新闻、政治评论或社会议题中更常见；也可写作“anti English”（较少见）。
使用时要注意语境：它既可能指对“英国/英国人”的敌意，也可能指对“英语作为语言或其影响力”的反对（例如反对英语在教育或职场中过度主导）。为了更准确，可以说“anti-British”（更明确指英国人/英国）或“anti-English-language”/“anti-English education”（更明确指语言政策）。
这是带有情绪色彩的词，可能被用作指责或贴标签。写作或讨论时，建议说明“反对的对象是什么”（文化、政策、殖民历史影响等），避免把政策立场等同于对某个群体的偏见。

summary.en: Anti-enlistment means opposing joining the military or promoting the idea that people should not enlist.
summary.zh: anti-enlistment 指“反对参军（入伍）”或“主张人们不要参军”的立场、宣传或运动。

definition.en: Opposing joining the military (enlistment) or encouraging people not to join.
definition.zh: 反对参军（入伍）或主张人们不要参军的。

examples.en: The group organized an anti-enlistment campaign on campus.
examples.zh: 这个团体在校园里组织了一场反对参军的活动。

examples.en: Her anti-enlistment views came from a strong belief in pacifism.
examples.zh: 她反对参军的观点来自她对和平主义的坚定信念。

definition.en: The idea, movement, or message that opposes military enlistment.
definition.zh: 反对参军的观点、运动或宣传。

examples.en: Anti-enlistment was a common theme in some anti-war speeches.
examples.zh: 在一些反战演讲中，“反对参军”是常见主题。

examples.en: The newspaper printed anti-enlistment materials during the debate.
examples.zh: 在辩论期间，这家报纸刊登了反对参军的材料。

extraExplanation: “enlistment”指自愿入伍；如果是反对“征兵/征召”（draft/conscription），更常见的说法是“anti-draft”或“anti-conscription”。
该词常见于战争时期或征兵政策引发争议的社会语境中（如反战运动、校园倡议、政治演讲等）。

summary.en: Anti-Entente means opposed to the (Triple) Entente alliance, especially in pre–World War I European politics.
summary.zh: Anti-Entente 指“反协约的/反协约者”，多用于一战前欧洲政治语境，反对（三国）协约阵营。

definition.en: opposed to the (Triple) Entente—especially the alliance of Britain, France, and Russia before World War I.
definition.zh: 反对“（三国）协约”（尤其指一战前英国、法国、俄国的同盟）的；反协约的。

examples.en: Some newspapers took an anti-Entente position during the crisis.
examples.zh: 在危机期间，一些报纸采取了反协约的立场。

examples.en: The politician’s anti-Entente speeches criticized cooperation with Britain and France.
examples.zh: 这位政治家的反协约演讲批评与英国和法国合作。

definition.en: a person, group, or political position that opposes the Entente (often used in historical writing about early 20th-century Europe).
definition.zh: 反协约者；反协约立场（常见于描述20世纪初欧洲的历史语境）。

examples.en: He was known as an anti-Entente in parliament.
examples.zh: 他在议会中以反协约者著称。

examples.en: Anti-Ententes argued that the alliance threatened national interests.
examples.zh: 反协约派认为该同盟威胁国家利益。

extraExplanation: “Entente”来自法语，意为“谅解、协定”。在一战前的外交格局中，“Triple Entente（三国协约）”通常指英、法、俄的合作关系；因此“anti-Entente”多用于描述反对这一阵营、或主张与其对抗的舆论与政治力量。
该词主要属于历史写作/政治语境，现代日常英语中不常用；写作时常见连字符形式 anti-Entente，也可能写作 anti-entente。

summary.en: “Anti-entertainment” describes something that rejects entertainment values—serious, challenging, or deliberately not aimed at easy pleasure.
summary.zh: “anti-entertainment”指反娱乐的：拒绝娱乐化与取悦观众，偏严肃、挑战性强，或刻意不追求轻松快感。

definition.en: Opposed to entertainment or designed to avoid being entertaining; serious, demanding, or intentionally “not fun.”
definition.zh: 反娱乐的；刻意不取悦观众、强调严肃或艰深、避免“好看/好玩”的。

examples.en: The director’s anti-entertainment style focuses on slow pacing and uncomfortable silence.
examples.zh: 这位导演的反娱乐风格强调缓慢节奏和令人不适的沉默。

examples.en: Some viewers found the film anti-entertainment because it refuses to explain its message clearly.
examples.zh: 有些观众觉得这部电影很“反娱乐”，因为它拒绝把主题讲得明白易懂。

definition.en: A stance, work, or trend that rejects entertainment values (like spectacle, easy pleasure, or mass appeal), often to make a political, artistic, or ethical point.
definition.zh: 反娱乐立场/作品/潮流；拒绝娱乐化（如奇观、即时快感或大众迎合），常为表达政治、艺术或伦理诉求。

examples.en: The essay argues that anti-entertainment can be a form of protest against consumer culture.
examples.zh: 这篇文章认为，反娱乐可以是一种对消费文化的抗议方式。

examples.en: In the 1960s, some artists embraced anti-entertainment as a challenge to mainstream taste.
examples.zh: 在20世纪60年代，一些艺术家拥抱反娱乐，以挑战主流审美。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”。“anti-entertainment”多见于影评、艺术评论、媒体批评语境，带有价值判断：强调作品不追求“好看”“爽感”或商业化的娱乐功能，而追求思考、批判、实验性。
它常与“art-house（艺术电影）”“avant-garde（先锋）”“anti-commercial（反商业）”“anti-spectacle（反奇观）”等讨论相邻。用在日常口语时可能显得偏书面，可用“not very entertaining / deliberately unfun”更自然。

summary.en: “Anti-environment” describes people, policies, or actions that oppose environmental protection or that harm the environment.
summary.zh: “anti-environment”指反对环境保护（或对环境有害）的个人、政策或行为。

definition.en: Opposed to protecting the natural environment or against environmental policies and regulations.
definition.zh: 反对环境保护的；反对环保政策与法规的。

examples.en: Some critics called the proposal anti-environment because it weakened pollution limits.
examples.zh: 一些批评者称该提案“反环保”，因为它削弱了污染限制。

examples.en: The group’s anti-environment stance drew protests from local residents.
examples.zh: 该团体的反环保立场引发了当地居民的抗议。

definition.en: (Of an action, plan, or product) Likely to harm nature or increase pollution.
definition.zh: （指行为、计划或产品）可能伤害自然环境或增加污染的。

examples.en: Building the road through the wetland was seen as an anti-environment decision.
examples.zh: 把公路修进湿地被视为一种反环境的决定。

examples.en: Many people avoid anti-environment products that create lots of plastic waste.
examples.zh: 许多人会避免那些制造大量塑料垃圾的反环境产品。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”。英语里常见结构有 anti-war（反战）、anti-smoking（反吸烟）、anti-immigrant（反移民）。
写法上常用连字符 anti-environment（尤其在新闻标题或正式写作中），也可能写作 anti environment（较少见）或 anti-environmental（更常见，意思接近“反环保的”）。
语气上它常带有批评色彩，容易被当作“贴标签”。正式讨论时也可用更中性的说法，如 “opposed to environmental regulation”（反对环保监管）或 “prioritizing economic growth over environmental protection”（更重经济增长而非环境保护）。

summary.en: Anti-environmental describes people, actions, or policies that oppose environmental protection or cause environmental harm.
summary.zh: Anti-environmental 指反对环境保护、或会对环境造成伤害的人、行为或政策。

definition.en: Opposed to protecting the environment, or supporting actions/policies that harm the natural world (air, water, climate, wildlife).
definition.zh: 反环境保护的；反对环境保护的（或支持会伤害自然环境的行动/政策）。

examples.en: Many voters criticized the proposal as anti-environmental because it would increase pollution.
examples.zh: 许多选民批评这项提案反环境保护，因为它会增加污染。

examples.en: The journalist wrote about anti-environmental lobbying by certain industries.
examples.zh: 这位记者写到了某些行业的反环境保护游说。

extraExplanation: 这个词常用于政治与公共议题语境，带有明显的评价色彩（通常是负面的）。如果想更中性，可以说：“not environmentally friendly（不环保的）”“environmentally harmful（对环境有害的）”或“opposed to environmental regulations（反对环保法规的）”。
构词法：anti- 表示“反对”，environmental 表示“环境相关的”。连字符 anti-environmental 很常见，尤其在新闻报道或政策讨论中。

summary.en: Someone (or something) opposed to environmental protection or environmentalist ideas and policies.
summary.zh: 反对环境保护或环保主义理念与政策的人（或立场/做法）。

definition.en: A person who opposes environmental protection efforts or policies (for example, pollution controls or climate action).
definition.zh: 反对环境保护行动或政策的人（例如反对污染管制或气候行动）。

examples.en: Some voters labeled the candidate an anti-environmentalist because he wanted to weaken clean-air rules.
examples.zh: 有些选民称这位候选人是反环保人士，因为他想削弱清洁空气法规。

examples.en: She argues she is not an anti-environmentalist—she just disagrees with this specific policy.
examples.zh: 她说自己不是反环保人士——只是不同意这项具体政策。

definition.en: Opposed to environmentalism or environmental protection; against policies meant to protect nature or reduce pollution.
definition.zh: 反对环保主义或环境保护的；反对旨在保护自然或减少污染的政策的。

examples.en: The group took an anti-environmentalist stance on new limits for factory emissions.
examples.zh: 该团体在工厂排放新限制问题上持反环保立场。

examples.en: An anti-environmentalist message appeared in the ad campaign.
examples.zh: 广告宣传中出现了反环保的信息。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对……”。“environmentalist”原指“环保主义者/环保人士”。合在一起常用于政治、媒体与公共政策讨论，语气有时带评价色彩（可能暗示“不关心环境”）。在较中性的表达里，也可以说“opposed to certain environmental regulations（反对某些环保法规）”来更具体、避免贴标签。

summary.en: Anti-enzymatic means enzyme-inhibiting—reducing or blocking enzyme activity.
summary.zh: anti-enzymatic 指“抑酶的”，即降低或阻断酶活性。

definition.en: Preventing, reducing, or inhibiting the action of enzymes (often used to describe a substance or treatment).
definition.zh: 抑制酶作用的；防止或降低酶活性的（常用于描述某种物质或处理方式）。

examples.en: Some preservatives have anti-enzymatic effects that slow down food spoilage.
examples.zh: 有些防腐剂具有抗酶（抑酶）作用，可以减缓食物变质。

examples.en: The lab tested an anti-enzymatic compound to see whether it blocks digestive enzymes.
examples.zh: 实验室测试了一种抑酶化合物，看看它是否会阻断消化酶。

examples.en: Heat treatment can be used as an anti-enzymatic step in processing fruits.
examples.zh: 在水果加工中，加热处理可作为一种抑酶步骤。

extraExplanation: “anti-enzymatic”多见于食品科学、生物化学、药学等语境，常用来描述“抑制酶活性”的特性（例如防止褐变、抑制分解反应等）。
写作上也常见同义表达：“enzyme-inhibiting / anti-enzymic”。有些领域更偏好用“enzyme inhibitor（酶抑制剂）”来指具体物质。

summary.en: Anti-enzyme usually means a substance that inhibits an enzyme; less commonly, it can mean an antibody against an enzyme.
summary.zh: anti-enzyme 通常指抑制酶活性的物质（酶抑制剂）；较少情况下也可指针对酶的抗体。

definition.en: a substance that reduces or blocks the activity of an enzyme; an enzyme inhibitor (used in biology and medicine).
definition.zh: （生物/医学）抑制或阻断酶活性的物质；酶抑制剂。

examples.en: This drug acts as an anti-enzyme, slowing the enzyme that helps the virus replicate.
examples.zh: 这种药物充当抗酶（抑制剂），减缓了帮助病毒复制的酶的作用。

examples.en: Researchers tested several anti-enzymes to see which one could stop the pathway most effectively.
examples.zh: 研究人员测试了几种抗酶（抑制剂），看哪一种能最有效地阻断该通路。

definition.en: an antibody that works against a specific enzyme, decreasing its activity (less common; also written as “antienzyme”).
definition.zh: （较少见）针对某种特定酶的抗体，可降低该酶的活性（也可写作 antienzyme）。

examples.en: After repeated exposure, the body may produce an anti-enzyme that neutralizes the therapeutic enzyme.
examples.zh: 在反复接触后，人体可能产生抗酶抗体，从而中和治疗用酶。

examples.en: Clinicians monitored patients for anti-enzyme antibodies during treatment.
examples.zh: 临床医生在治疗期间监测患者是否产生抗酶抗体。

extraExplanation: “anti-”在这里表示“对抗/抑制”，不是“反酶”那种字面相反的意思。学术写作里更常用 enzyme inhibitor（酶抑制剂）；在免疫学语境中才更可能指“针对酶的抗体”。
拼写上有时会看到 antienzyme（不加连字符），但在现代科技英文中用 anti-enzyme 或直接用 inhibitor 更清楚。

summary.en: Anti-epidemic means ‘related to preventing or controlling an epidemic,’ and can also refer to people/teams doing epidemic control work.
summary.zh: anti-epidemic 指“与防控流行病有关的”，也可指从事防疫工作的人员或团队。

definition.en: Intended to prevent, control, or fight an epidemic (a widespread outbreak of disease).
definition.zh: 用于预防、控制或对抗流行病（大范围疾病暴发）的。

examples.en: The city set up anti-epidemic measures like mask rules and testing.
examples.zh: 这座城市采取了防疫措施，比如戴口罩规定和检测。

examples.en: Anti-epidemic teams disinfected public areas every day.
examples.zh: 防疫队伍每天对公共区域进行消毒。

definition.en: A person, team, or organization responsible for epidemic prevention and control (common in official or news contexts).
definition.zh: 负责疫情防控的人员、队伍或机构（多见于官方或新闻语境）。

examples.en: Anti-epidemic workers delivered food to people in quarantine.
examples.zh: 防疫人员给隔离中的人送去了食物。

examples.en: The hospital praised the anti-epidemic team for their dedication.
examples.zh: 医院表扬了防疫团队的奉献精神。

extraExplanation: “anti-epidemic”在英语里能用，但更常见、更自然的表达是：epidemic prevention（疫情防控）、disease control（疾病控制）、infection control（感染控制）、public health measures（公共卫生措施）。在新闻或正式文件中也常见：anti-epidemic campaign / anti-epidemic measures。
写作提示：作定语时可用连字符（anti-epidemic measures）；也可改用更地道的结构，比如 measures to prevent an epidemic / measures to control an outbreak。

summary.en: Anti-episcopacy means opposition to a bishop-led church system (episcopacy).
summary.zh: anti-episcopacy 指反对由主教领导与治理教会的主教制。

definition.en: Opposition to episcopacy (a church system governed by bishops), or the belief that churches should not be ruled by bishops.
definition.zh: 反对主教制（由主教治理教会的制度）；或主张教会不应由主教统治的观点。

examples.en: Some Puritan groups in the 1600s were known for their anti-episcopacy.
examples.zh: 一些17世纪的清教徒团体以反对主教制而闻名。

examples.en: The pamphlet argues for anti-episcopacy and supports church rule by elders instead.
examples.zh: 这本小册子主张反对主教制，并支持改由长老治理教会。

extraExplanation: “episcopacy”来自希腊语 *episkopos*（监督者、主教）。因此“anti-episcopacy”字面就是“反对主教统治/主教制度”。
这个词常见于宗教史与政治史语境，尤其与英格兰宗教改革、清教徒运动、英国内战时期关于教会治理结构（主教制 vs. 长老制/公理制）的争论有关。
学习提示：它多用于学术/历史写作，不太用于日常口语。相关词包括 *episcopal*（主教制的/圣公会的）、*anti-episcopal*（反主教制的）、*Presbyterian polity*（长老制）。

summary.en: Anti-Episcopal means opposed to the Episcopal Church or to the bishop-led church system (episcopacy).
summary.zh: anti-Episcopal 指反对美国圣公会，或更广义地指反对由主教领导的教会制度（主教制）。

definition.en: Opposed to the Episcopal Church (in the U.S.) or to Episcopalians.
definition.zh: 反对美国圣公会（Episcopal Church）或反对圣公会信徒的。

examples.en: The group published several anti-Episcopal pamphlets during the debate.
examples.zh: 在那场辩论期间，该团体发表了几本反圣公会的小册子。

examples.en: He grew up in a community with strong anti-Episcopal attitudes.
examples.zh: 他在一个强烈反圣公会情绪的社区中长大。

definition.en: Opposed to episcopacy (the system of church government led by bishops), especially in historical religious politics.
definition.zh: 反对主教制（由主教领导的教会治理制度）的；尤指历史上的宗教政治语境。

examples.en: Some anti-Episcopal writers argued that the church should not be ruled by bishops.
examples.zh: 一些反主教制的作者主张教会不应由主教统治。

examples.en: The movement was partly anti-Episcopal and favored local church leadership.
examples.zh: 该运动在一定程度上反对主教制，并倾向于地方教会领导。

extraExplanation: “Episcopal”来自希腊语词根 *episkopos*（监督者、主教），因此 anti-Episcopal 有时不仅是“反对某个宗派”，也可能更广泛地指“反对由主教治理的教会体制”。
在英美历史语境中，它常出现在宗教改革后关于“主教制 vs. 长老制/会众制”等教会治理方式的争论中。读历史材料时要结合具体国家与年代来判断指的是哪个教会或制度。

summary.en: Anti-episcopal means opposed to bishops or to a bishop-led church system.
summary.zh: anti-episcopal 指反对主教或反对由主教领导的教会制度。

definition.en: Opposed to bishops (episcopal church leadership) or to a church system governed by bishops.
definition.zh: 反对主教（episcopal）制度或反对由主教治理的教会体制的。

examples.en: Some groups in the Reformation period held strongly anti-episcopal views.
examples.zh: 宗教改革时期，一些团体持有强烈的反主教制观点。

examples.en: The pamphlet argues for a presbyterian model and takes an anti-episcopal stance.
examples.zh: 这本小册子主张长老制，并采取反主教制的立场。

extraExplanation: “Episcopal”源自希腊语 *episkopos*（监督者、主教）。因此 anti-episcopal 通常用于宗教史与教会政治语境，尤其与英国国教（Anglican Church）及其主教制相关。
该词多见于学术写作或历史讨论（如 16–17 世纪英国宗教争论），日常英语中较少使用。

summary.en: Against (or a person against) church governance by bishops.
summary.zh: 反对（或反对者）由主教治理教会的制度。

definition.en: Opposed to episcopal church government (a system led by bishops).
definition.zh: 反对主教制（由主教领导的教会治理体系）的。

examples.en: Some early Protestants were strongly anti-episcopalian and rejected rule by bishops.
examples.zh: 一些早期的新教徒非常反对主教制，拒绝由主教统治。

examples.en: The group’s anti-episcopalian beliefs shaped how they organized their churches.
examples.zh: 该团体反主教制的信念影响了他们组织教会的方式。

definition.en: A person who opposes episcopal church government (rule by bishops).
definition.zh: 反主教制者；反对由主教治理教会的人。

examples.en: He was an anti-episcopalian who argued for local church control.
examples.zh: 他是一位反主教制者，主张地方教会自治。

extraExplanation: “episcopal”来自希腊语，意思与“监督/主教”相关；“episcopalian”常指支持或属于主教制的传统（如英国国教/圣公会体系）。因此 anti-episcopalian 多用于宗教史、教会政治或神学讨论中。
注意：anti-episcopalian 不是指“反对 Episcopal Church（美国圣公会）”这一特定宗派的所有事情，而是更广义地反对“由主教领导的教会治理结构”。在语境中要看是在谈宗派还是在谈治理制度。

summary.en: Anti-epithelial means “against epithelial tissue,” often describing a medical or biological effect on epithelial cells.
summary.zh: anti-epithelial 意为“抗上皮的”，常用于医学/生物学中描述对上皮细胞的针对性作用。

definition.en: Against epithelial tissue; used to describe something (such as a drug, antibody, or action) that targets, damages, removes, or prevents the growth of epithelial cells.
definition.zh: 抗上皮的；指针对上皮组织的（如药物、抗体或作用），会攻击、破坏、清除或抑制上皮细胞生长。

examples.en: The treatment showed anti-epithelial activity in lab tests.
examples.zh: 该治疗在实验室测试中显示出抗上皮活性。

examples.en: Doctors avoided anti-epithelial effects because the corneal epithelium needs to heal quickly.
examples.zh: 医生避免出现抗上皮作用，因为角膜上皮需要快速修复。

extraExplanation: “epithelial”指“上皮的”，上皮组织覆盖身体表面并衬在器官、腺体内壁（如皮肤表面、呼吸道、肠道内壁）。因此“anti-epithelial”多见于医学/生物学语境，常搭配：anti-epithelial antibody（抗上皮抗体）、anti-epithelial activity/effect（抗上皮活性/作用）。
前缀“anti-”表示“反对、对抗、抑制”。在科技写作中，这类复合词通常加连字符（anti-epithelial），也可能写作 antiepithelial（较少见，依期刊风格而定）。

summary.en: Anti-equality means opposing equality or equal-rights principles; it can describe a stance (adj.) or the belief/movement itself (n.).
summary.zh: anti-equality 指“反对平等/平权原则”；既可作形容词描述立场，也可作名词指这种观念或运动。

definition.en: Opposed to the idea that people should have equal rights, opportunities, or social status; against equality (often used in political or social discussions).
definition.zh: 反对“人人平等”这一理念的；反对平等（常用于政治或社会议题语境）。

examples.en: The group’s anti-equality message drew strong criticism from the public.
examples.zh: 该团体的反平等言论遭到公众强烈批评。

examples.en: Some commentators described the policy as anti-equality because it benefits only a small elite.
examples.zh: 一些评论员认为该政策“反平等”，因为它只让少数精英受益。

definition.en: A belief, attitude, or movement that opposes equality or equal-rights principles.
definition.zh: 反对平等或平权原则的信念、态度或运动。

examples.en: Anti-equality can show up in arguments against equal pay or equal access to education.
examples.zh: 反平等可能体现在反对同工同酬或反对教育机会平等等论点中。

examples.en: The article analyzes how anti-equality spreads through misinformation.
examples.zh: 这篇文章分析了反平等如何通过错误信息传播。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制”。因此 anti-equality 字面意思就是“反对平等”。
该词并非固定的中性学术术语，更常见于评论性写作、社论或网络讨论中，带有较强价值判断色彩；正式写作里也常用更具体的表达，如 anti-egalitarian（反平等主义的）或 opposition to equality policies（反对平等政策）。
语境很关键：有时说某项政策“anti-equality”并不等于反对平等这个理念，而是批评它造成了不平等的结果（例如资源更向少数人集中）。

summary.en: “Anti-equalizing” describes something that works against making outcomes more equal or balanced, often in social or economic contexts.
summary.zh: “Anti-equalizing”指某事物反对或阻碍“均衡/拉平”，常用于社会或经济语境，强调会让结果更不平等。

definition.en: Opposed to making things equal or more balanced; against policies or actions meant to reduce differences (such as income, opportunity, or power).
definition.zh: 反对“拉平/均衡”的；反对通过政策或行动减少差异（如收入、机会或权力差距）的。

examples.en: Some critics call the new tax plan anti-equalizing because it benefits high earners more than low earners.
examples.zh: 一些批评者称这项新税收方案是反均衡的，因为它让高收入者受益更多，而低收入者受益更少。

examples.en: An anti-equalizing rule can widen the gap between strong and weak students.
examples.zh: 一条反均衡的规则可能会扩大优秀学生与薄弱学生之间的差距。

extraExplanation: “equalizing（均衡/拉平）”常用于经济与社会政策语境，指减少差距（如通过税收、补贴、教育资源分配等）。因此“anti-equalizing”多用于评论或批评，强调某措施会让差距变大或阻碍机会更公平。
该词在日常口语中不算常见，更常见的表达有“anti-redistribution（反对再分配）”“inequality-increasing（加剧不平等的）”或“regressive（累退的/对低收入者更不利的，常用于税制）”。

summary.en: “Anti-erosion” means designed to prevent or reduce erosion, especially in environmental and construction contexts.
summary.zh: “anti-erosion”指用于防止或减少侵蚀的（或防侵蚀措施），常用于环保与工程语境。

definition.en: (of methods, materials, or design) intended to prevent or reduce erosion (the gradual wearing away of soil, rock, or other surfaces by wind, water, etc.).
definition.zh: （指方法、材料或设计）用于防止或减少侵蚀（风、水等导致土壤、岩石等表面逐渐被磨损、冲走）。

examples.en: The engineers added anti-erosion mats to protect the riverbank during the rainy season.
examples.zh: 工程师加铺了防侵蚀垫，保护河岸在雨季不被冲刷。

examples.en: Anti-erosion planting, such as grass and ground cover, helps hold the soil in place.
examples.zh: 防侵蚀种植（如种草和地被植物）有助于固定土壤。

definition.en: Anti-erosion measures or protection (often used before a noun, e.g., “anti-erosion work/plan”).
definition.zh: 防侵蚀措施或防护（常作名词前置定语，如“防侵蚀工程/方案”）。

examples.en: The project includes anti-erosion along the slope and improved drainage.
examples.zh: 该项目包括边坡的防侵蚀处理以及排水改善。

examples.en: Local officials funded anti-erosion to reduce landslide risk.
examples.zh: 当地官员拨款做防侵蚀，以降低滑坡风险。

extraExplanation: “anti-erosion”多见于工程、环保与农业语境（如河岸护坡、道路边坡、梯田、水土保持）。在日常英语里也常写作“erosion control”（侵蚀控制）或“anti-erosion measures”（防侵蚀措施）。
连字符（anti-erosion）常用于作定语时：anti-erosion mats/plan/works；若作表语或更一般表达，也可写成“anti erosion”（较少见）或改用“erosion-control”。

summary.en: “Anti-erysipelas” means intended to prevent or treat erysipelas.
summary.zh: “anti-erysipelas”指用于预防或治疗丹毒的（多用于较旧或较笼统的医学表述）。

definition.en: Used to prevent or treat erysipelas (a serious bacterial skin infection).
definition.zh: 用于预防或治疗丹毒（由细菌引起的较严重皮肤感染）。

examples.en: The old textbook mentions an anti-erysipelas ointment.
examples.zh: 那本旧教材提到一种抗丹毒的药膏。

examples.en: The clinic no longer uses “anti-erysipelas” as a label; it lists the specific antibiotic instead.
examples.zh: 诊所现在不再用“抗丹毒”作标签；而是直接标注具体抗生素名称。

extraExplanation: “anti-erysipelas”多见于较旧的医学英语或药品/疗法的描述，用来笼统表示“针对丹毒的”。现代医学写作更常直接写明病原体（如链球菌）或具体治疗（如某种抗生素）。
丹毒（erysipelas）是一种急性皮肤感染，常出现红、肿、热、痛，边界相对清楚；如出现疑似症状，应及时就医。

summary.en: Anti-esoteric describes something that rejects overly specialized, hard-to-understand language and aims to be clear and accessible.
summary.zh: Anti-esoteric 指反对过于专业深奥、难懂的表达，强调清晰易懂、面向大众。

definition.en: Opposed to esoteric ideas or language; preferring explanations that are clear and accessible to most people.
definition.zh: 反对深奥难懂（只有少数人懂）的思想或语言；偏好清晰、人人易懂的表达。

examples.en: Her teaching style is anti-esoteric: she explains big ideas in simple words.
examples.zh: 她的教学风格很“反深奥”：她用简单的词解释重要的概念。

examples.en: The editor asked for an anti-esoteric introduction so general readers wouldn’t feel lost.
examples.zh: 编辑要求写一段更“反深奥”的导言，这样普通读者就不会看不懂。

extraExplanation: “esoteric”常指“深奥的、少数人才能理解的（尤其是学术、哲学、宗教或某个圈子内部的知识）”。“anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制”。因此“anti-esoteric”多用于评价表达方式：强调通俗、可理解、非小圈子化。
这个词不算高频，写作中也可以用更常见的表达替换，如：“non-technical”“plain-language”“accessible”“not jargon-heavy”。

summary.en: Anti-espionage refers to laws, measures, or work that prevent or fight spying/espionage.
summary.zh: anti-espionage 指用于防范或打击间谍活动的法律、措施或工作。

definition.en: Opposed to spying; intended to prevent, detect, or punish espionage (secret intelligence gathering).
definition.zh: 反间谍的；旨在防止、侦查或惩治间谍活动（秘密情报搜集）的。

examples.en: The company tightened its anti-espionage measures after a data leak.
examples.zh: 数据泄露后，公司加强了反间谍措施。

examples.en: The government passed anti-espionage laws to protect national security.
examples.zh: 政府通过反间谍法以保护国家安全。

definition.en: Actions, policies, or work aimed at stopping espionage.
definition.zh: 反间谍行动；用于阻止间谍活动的政策或工作。

examples.en: He worked in anti-espionage for the military.
examples.zh: 他在军方从事反间谍工作。

examples.en: Anti-espionage became a major priority during the Cold War.
examples.zh: 冷战时期，反间谍成为重要优先事项。

extraExplanation: “espionage”常指国家层面的“间谍活动”，语气比“spying”更正式、更偏政治与安全领域。
作为复合词/连字符词（anti-espionage），常见搭配有：anti-espionage law（反间谍法）、anti-espionage unit（反间谍部门/单位）、anti-espionage measures（反间谍措施）。

summary.en: Anti-essentialism is the idea that categories (especially social ones) don’t have a fixed, natural essence and shouldn’t be explained as if they do.
summary.zh: 反本质主义认为（尤其是社会类别）没有固定的天然本质，不应把它们当作天生不变来解释。

definition.en: (In philosophy and social theory) the view that things—especially people and social categories like gender, race, or culture—do not have a fixed, unchanging “essence,” and should not be explained as if they do.
definition.zh: （哲学与社会理论中）反本质主义：认为事物——尤其是人及“性别、种族、文化”等社会类别——不存在固定不变的“本质”，不应把它们当作天生如此来解释。

examples.en: An anti-essentialist view of culture treats it as changing and diverse, not as one single “true” tradition.
examples.zh: 反本质主义的文化观把文化看作不断变化且多元的，而不是唯一“真正的”传统。

examples.en: In gender studies, anti-essentialism argues that “women” are not all the same and cannot be defined by one universal set of traits.
examples.zh: 在性别研究中，反本质主义认为“女性”并非都一样，也不能用一套普遍特质来定义。

extraExplanation: “本质主义（essentialism）”常被理解为：某一类事物天生就有一组核心特征（比如“某民族就是……”“女人天生…… ”）。反本质主义则提醒我们：这些类别往往是历史、语言、权力关系与社会实践共同塑造的，因此内部差异很大、也会随时代改变。
它并不一定等于“什么都不真实”或“没有任何共同点”。更常见的立场是：即使为了沟通或政治行动需要使用某个类别（如“女性”“亚裔”），也要意识到该类别是概括性的、可能排除某些人的经验。相关讨论中常出现的概念包括：社会建构（social construction）与交叉性（intersectionality）。

summary.en: Anti-essentialist describes a view that rejects fixed, inborn “essences,” emphasizing that identities and categories are shaped by context and change over time.
summary.zh: Anti-essentialist 指反本质主义立场，反对把身份或类别看成固定、天生不变的“本质”，强调它们会随情境与历史而变化。

definition.en: (in philosophy, social science, or cultural studies) opposing essentialism—the idea that a group or thing has a fixed, natural, unchanging “essence.”
definition.zh: （哲学/社会科学/文化研究中）反本质主义的；反对“本质主义”（认为某一类人或事物有固定、天生且不变的“本质”）的观点。

examples.en: Many gender scholars take an anti-essentialist approach and emphasize how identities are shaped by culture and history.
examples.zh: 许多性别研究学者采取反本质主义立场，强调身份如何被文化与历史塑造。

examples.en: An anti-essentialist view argues that “woman” is not a single, universal experience.
examples.zh: 反本质主义观点认为，“女性”并不是一种单一、普遍的经验。

extraExplanation: “anti-essentialist”常见于学术语境（如性别研究、种族与民族研究、后结构主义、文化研究）。它并不一定否认生物差异或客观特征的存在，而更常用来批评把复杂多样的人群/身份简化成“天生如此、永远如此”的刻板说法。
在写作中，它常与“constructed（建构的）”“context-dependent（依情境而变的）”“multiple/diverse（多元的）”等词搭配。也常见名词形式：anti-essentialism（反本质主义）。

summary.en: Anti-establishment describes people or ideas that oppose the existing system or those in power.
summary.zh: anti-establishment 指反对既有体制或当权者的思想、立场或群体。

definition.en: Opposed to the established political, social, or cultural system; critical of the people or institutions in power.
definition.zh: 反建制的；反对既有政治、社会或文化体制的；批判当权者或主流机构的。

examples.en: She became famous for her anti-establishment songs.
examples.zh: 她因反建制的歌曲而出名。

examples.en: The party has an anti-establishment message that appeals to young voters.
examples.zh: 该政党的反建制讯息吸引了年轻选民。

examples.en: His anti-establishment attitude sometimes creates tension at work.
examples.zh: 他的反建制态度有时会在工作中造成紧张。

definition.en: A person, group, or movement that opposes the established system.
definition.zh: 反建制的人（或团体、运动）；反对既有体制的一方。

examples.en: Many anti-establishments joined the protest.
examples.zh: 许多反建制人士参加了抗议活动。

examples.en: The movement brought together artists, students, and other anti-establishments.
examples.zh: 这场运动汇聚了艺术家、学生以及其他反建制者。

extraExplanation: “establishment”在英语里常指“既得利益集团/主流权力结构”（如政府高层、主流媒体、传统精英圈）。因此“anti-establishment”不一定等于“反政府”，也可能是反对主流文化规范、商业巨头或传统权威。
这个词常用于政治新闻与文化评论中（如形容某位候选人、摇滚/朋克文化、反主流艺术）。写作时注意语气：它通常带有“挑战权威、质疑主流”的色彩，但在不同语境中可能被赞赏（独立、敢言）或被批评（煽动、不负责任）。

summary.en: Anti-estrogen refers to a drug or effect that blocks or reduces estrogen activity.
summary.zh: Anti-estrogen 指阻断或降低雌激素作用的药物或作用。

definition.en: a substance or drug that blocks or reduces the effects of estrogen (a female sex hormone), used especially in some breast cancer treatments and in hormone therapy contexts
definition.zh: 抗雌激素；一种阻断或减弱雌激素（女性性激素）作用的物质或药物，常用于某些乳腺癌治疗及相关激素治疗情境

examples.en: Tamoxifen is a well-known anti-estrogen used in some types of breast cancer treatment.
examples.zh: 他莫昔芬是一种常见的抗雌激素药物，用于某些类型的乳腺癌治疗。

examples.en: Her doctor discussed the benefits and side effects of an anti-estrogen before starting therapy.
examples.zh: 在开始治疗前，她的医生讨论了使用抗雌激素的益处和副作用。

definition.en: opposed to estrogen or reducing estrogen activity
definition.zh: 抗雌激素的；反雌激素作用的；降低雌激素活性的

examples.en: The patient began an anti-estrogen regimen after surgery.
examples.zh: 手术后，患者开始了抗雌激素治疗方案。

examples.en: Researchers are studying anti-estrogen effects in different tissues.
examples.zh: 研究人员正在研究不同组织中的抗雌激素效应。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反、抗、对抗”，如 anti-inflammatory（抗炎的）、antibiotic（抗生素）。因此 anti-estrogen 直译就是“对抗雌激素的”。
在医学语境里，anti-estrogen 常和 “therapy / treatment / drug / regimen（治疗/药物/方案）”搭配使用；也常见近义表达：antiestrogen（不加连字符的写法）、anti-estrogen therapy（抗雌激素治疗）、estrogen blocker（阻断雌激素的药物，较口语）。
