examples.zh: 他说这项政策让人感觉“反男性”，但也有人认为它是为了解决安全问题。

definition.en: Against the interests or participation of men in a particular setting (e.g., a rule, attitude, or environment).
definition.zh: 在某个特定场合中不利于男性的（如规定、氛围或态度）。

examples.en: He worried the workplace culture had become anti-male and discouraged men from speaking up.
examples.zh: 他担心职场文化变得不利于男性，让男性不敢发声。

examples.en: The club is not anti-male; it simply focuses on women’s experiences.
examples.zh: 这个社团并不是反男性；它只是专注于女性的经验。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是英语中常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制/与……相反”。“anti-male”多用于评论观点、政策或文化现象，语气往往较强，带有指责意味。
在讨论性别议题时，这个词容易引发对立；更中性的表达有时会用“biased against men（对男性有偏见）”“unfair to men（对男性不公平）”“male-negative（对男性负面）”。

summary.en: Anti-malthusian describes ideas (or people) that reject Malthus’s claim that population growth will inevitably outstrip resources and cause unavoidable crisis.
summary.zh: Anti-malthusian 指反对马尔萨斯“人口必然超过资源、导致不可避免危机”的观点（或持这种立场的人）。

definition.en: Opposed to Malthusian ideas—especially the belief that population growth will inevitably outpace food supply and cause widespread poverty or famine unless checked.
definition.zh: 反对马尔萨斯主义的——尤其反对“人口增长必然超过粮食增长、从而导致贫困或饥荒，必须通过限制来避免”的观点。

examples.en: Many economists take an anti-Malthusian view, arguing that technology can raise food production faster than population growth.
examples.zh: 许多经济学家持反马尔萨斯观点，认为技术可以让粮食产量增长快于人口增长。

examples.en: The report was criticized for being too Malthusian; the authors replied that their approach was anti-Malthusian and focused on innovation.
examples.zh: 该报告被批评过于马尔萨斯式；作者回应说他们的方法是反马尔萨斯的，强调创新。

definition.en: A person who rejects Malthusian theory or population-doom arguments.
definition.zh: 反马尔萨斯主义者；不认同马尔萨斯理论或“人口必然带来灾难”论的人。

examples.en: As an anti-Malthusian, she believes human creativity can solve resource shortages.
examples.zh: 作为反马尔萨斯主义者，她相信人类的创造力能解决资源短缺问题。

extraExplanation: “Malthusian”来自英国学者托马斯·马尔萨斯（Thomas Malthus, 1766–1834）。他在1798年的《人口原理》中提出：人口倾向于几何级数增长，而粮食等资源只能算术级数增长，因此若无“抑制”，贫困与饥荒难以避免。
“反马尔萨斯主义”常见于主张技术进步与制度改良能扩大资源供给的人群（例如强调农业增产、绿色革命、市场机制或教育与经济发展带来的自愿生育率下降）。在现代公共讨论中，也常用于与“资源即将耗尽/人口必然崩溃”的论调作对比。
使用时注意：它不一定等于“支持人口无限增长”，更多是反对“必然灾难论”，强调人类适应与创新能力。

summary.en: Anti-Malthusian means opposing the idea that population growth will inevitably outstrip food/resources; it can also refer to a person who holds that view.
summary.zh: anti-Malthusian 指反对“人口增长必然超过粮食/资源供给”的马尔萨斯观点；也可指持这种观点的人。

definition.en: opposed to Malthusian ideas (the belief that population tends to grow faster than food supply), often arguing that technology, better farming, and social progress can prevent widespread shortages.
definition.zh: 反对马尔萨斯主义的（马尔萨斯认为人口增长往往快于粮食增长），通常主张科技进步、农业改良与社会发展能避免大规模匮乏。

examples.en: Many economists take an anti-Malthusian view, saying innovation can raise living standards even as populations grow.
examples.zh: 许多经济学家持反马尔萨斯主义观点，认为即使人口增长，创新也能提高生活水平。

examples.en: The report is anti-Malthusian: it expects food production to keep up with demand through new methods.
examples.zh: 这份报告是反马尔萨斯主义的：它认为通过新方法，粮食产量能跟上需求。

definition.en: a person who holds anti-Malthusian views.
definition.zh: 反马尔萨斯主义者；持反马尔萨斯观点的人。

examples.en: As an anti-Malthusian, she argues that scarcity is not inevitable.
examples.zh: 作为反马尔萨斯主义者，她认为匮乏并非不可避免。

extraExplanation: “马尔萨斯主义”(Malthusian) 来自英国学者托马斯·马尔萨斯（Thomas Malthus, 1766–1834）。他在《人口论》(An Essay on the Principle of Population) 中提出：人口若不受限制会呈几何级数增长，而食物供给增长较慢，因此可能导致贫困与饥荒。
“反马尔萨斯主义”常见于讨论人口、资源、环境与经济发展时，强调技术进步（如化肥、灌溉、育种、绿色革命）与制度改良可以提升供给、降低资源压力。
在当代语境中，anti-Malthusian 有时也与“技术乐观主义/增长乐观主义”相关，但并不等于否认环境问题；它更强调人类有能力通过创新与政策应对压力。

summary.en: Anti-malware refers to software (or the capability) that protects devices by detecting and removing malware.
summary.zh: Anti-malware 指用于检测、阻止并清除恶意软件的防护软件（或防护能力）。

definition.en: software designed to detect, prevent, and remove malicious software (malware) such as viruses, spyware, ransomware, and trojans.
definition.zh: 用于检测、预防并清除恶意软件（malware）的软件，例如病毒、间谍软件、勒索软件和木马。

examples.en: Install anti-malware to protect your computer from ransomware.
examples.zh: 安装反恶意软件来保护你的电脑免受勒索软件攻击。

examples.en: Our IT team updated the anti-malware tools on every laptop.
examples.zh: 我们的 IT 团队更新了每台笔记本电脑上的反恶意软件工具。

definition.en: a program or app that provides protection against malware.
definition.zh: 反恶意软件程序；用于防护恶意软件的应用或软件。

examples.en: This anti-malware runs in the background and scans files automatically.
examples.zh: 这款反恶意软件在后台运行，并自动扫描文件。

examples.en: Which anti-malware do you recommend for Windows?
examples.zh: 你推荐哪款适用于 Windows 的反恶意软件？

extraExplanation: “Anti-malware”常作为总称，范围通常比“antivirus（杀毒软件）”更广：antivirus 传统上主要针对病毒，而 anti-malware 往往也涵盖间谍软件、广告软件、勒索软件等。现代产品常把两者功能合并。
写法上常见 anti-malware（带连字符），也有人写成 antimalware（不带连字符）；两种都能见到，正式写作里带连字符更清晰。

summary.en: Anti-man means ‘against men’ or ‘unfriendly toward men/masculinity,’ used as an adjective or a noun.
summary.zh: anti-man 指“反男性/对男性（或男性气质）不友好”，可作形容词或名词使用。

definition.en: Opposed to men (or to traditionally masculine roles/values); sometimes used to describe attitudes, comments, or policies seen as unfriendly toward men.
definition.zh: 反对男性的；对男性（或传统男性角色/价值观）不友好的。常用来形容被认为“对男性不利”的态度、言论或政策。

examples.en: Some viewers criticized the movie as anti-man because most male characters were shown as irresponsible.
examples.zh: 一些观众批评这部电影“anti-man”，因为大多数男性角色都被刻画得不负责任。

examples.en: He argued that the rule wasn’t anti-man; it applied to everyone equally.
examples.zh: 他认为这条规定并不是“anti-man”，因为它对所有人一视同仁。

definition.en: A person, idea, or force that is strongly against men or masculinity.
definition.zh: 反男性的人；反男性/反男性气质的观念或力量。

examples.en: In online debates, people sometimes label critics as anti-men without listening to their actual points.
examples.zh: 在网络争论中，人们有时会不听对方具体观点就给批评者贴上“anti-man”的标签。

examples.en: The article warned against turning gender issues into an ‘anti-man’ vs. ‘anti-woman’ fight.
examples.zh: 这篇文章提醒不要把性别议题变成“anti-man”对“anti-woman”的对立。

extraExplanation: “anti-man”不是非常固定、正式的词条，更常见的表达是 anti-male、misandrist（指厌男/仇男者）。它经常带有强烈立场或指责意味，容易成为贴标签的说法；在严肃写作中建议更具体地说明“反对的是什么”（例如某种刻板印象、某项政策影响等），避免泛化到所有男性。

summary.en: Anti-management describes opposition to managers or management systems, or an attitude/movement against them.
summary.zh: anti-management 指“反管理”的：反对管理层或管理制度，也可指这种反对的态度/倾向。

definition.en: opposed to management or to the decisions, authority, or style of managers (often used to describe attitudes, policies, or culture in a workplace).
definition.zh: 反管理的；反对管理层或管理方式的（常用来形容职场中的态度、政策或文化）。

examples.en: Some employees felt the new policy was anti-management and would hurt teamwork.
examples.zh: 一些员工觉得新政策带有反管理倾向，会伤害团队合作。

examples.en: The discussion became tense when it turned into anti-management talk.
examples.zh: 当讨论变成反管理言论时，气氛变得紧张起来。

definition.en: an anti-management attitude or movement; opposition to managers or management systems (used in writing about organizations, unions, or politics).
definition.zh: 反管理的态度或运动；对管理者或管理制度的反对（常见于组织、工会或政治相关写作）。

examples.en: The article analyzes anti-management in the industry after years of layoffs.
examples.zh: 这篇文章分析了多年裁员后该行业出现的反管理情绪。

examples.en: Leaders tried to address anti-management by improving communication and trust.
examples.zh: 领导层试图通过改善沟通与信任来应对反管理情绪。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对、抵制”。“anti-management”多见于职场/组织语境，语气通常较强，暗示对管理层不信任或对管理方式不满。
写法上常用连字符（anti-management），也可写作不连字符（antimanagement），但前者更常见、更清晰。
注意与“pro-worker（亲员工）”“anti-authority（反权威）”区分：anti-management针对的是“管理层/管理制度”，不一定等同于“支持员工”。

summary.en: Anti-manic means used to prevent or treat mania, especially in bipolar disorder.
summary.zh: anti-manic 指用于预防或治疗躁狂的（多见于双相情感障碍的医疗语境）。

definition.en: (Medicine) Intended to prevent or treat mania (an abnormally elevated or irritable mood), especially in bipolar disorder.
definition.zh: （医学）用于预防或治疗躁狂（情绪异常高涨或易怒），尤其常见于双相情感障碍的。

examples.en: Lithium is a classic anti-manic medication used in bipolar disorder.
examples.zh: 锂盐是用于双相情感障碍的经典抗躁狂药物。

examples.en: The doctor adjusted her anti-manic treatment after her sleep dropped to two hours a night.
examples.zh: 当她每晚睡眠降到两小时后，医生调整了她的抗躁狂治疗方案。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反/抗”，因此 anti-manic 直译为“抗躁狂的”。在医疗语境中更常见的说法是 “antimanic”（不加连字符）或 “mood-stabilizing / mood stabilizer（情绪稳定的/情绪稳定剂）”。
它通常用于描述药物或治疗方案（anti-manic medication/treatment），而不是描述人本身。日常沟通中避免随意给他人贴“躁狂”标签，涉及心理健康时用更中性、尊重的表述会更合适。

summary.en: Anti-Marian means opposed to religious devotion or teachings focused on Mary; it can also refer to a person with those views.
summary.zh: anti-Marian 指反对对圣母玛利亚的敬礼或相关教义；也可指持这种观点的人。

definition.en: opposed to Mary (the mother of Jesus) being given special religious honor or devotion, or opposed to teachings and practices centered on Mary
definition.zh: 反对对圣母玛利亚（耶稣之母）的特殊敬礼/崇敬，或反对以玛利亚为中心的教义与宗教实践

examples.en: Some Protestant groups have an anti-Marian view of certain Catholic devotions.
examples.zh: 一些新教团体对某些天主教敬礼持反玛利亚（反圣母）立场。

examples.en: The author criticized what he saw as anti-Marian rhetoric in the debate.
examples.zh: 作者批评辩论中他认为带有反玛利亚色彩的言论。

definition.en: a person who holds anti-Marian beliefs
definition.zh: 持反玛利亚（反圣母）观点的人

examples.en: In the discussion, he was labeled an anti-Marian by his opponents.
examples.zh: 在讨论中，他被反对者贴上了“反玛利亚者”的标签。

extraExplanation: “Marian”来自 Mary（玛利亚）+ -an，指“与圣母玛利亚有关的”。因此 anti-Marian 常见于基督宗教语境（尤其是新教与天主教传统差异的讨论）中，用来描述对“圣母敬礼、圣母教义（如某些教会对玛利亚的称号、祈祷方式）”的反对或批评。
书写上常见 anti-Marian（带连字符），也可能写作 anti Marian。通常 Marian 会大写，因为它来自专有名词 Mary。
语气提示：在宗教讨论中该词可能带评价色彩；学术写作中更中性的表达可用 “non-Marian” 或 “critical of Marian devotion”（视语境而定）。

summary.en: Opposition to devotion to and doctrines about the Virgin Mary in Christianity.
summary.zh: 在基督教语境中，反对对童贞玛利亚（圣母）的崇敬及相关教义的立场。

definition.en: Opposition to (or criticism of) Marian devotion and Marian doctrines in Christianity—especially the veneration of the Virgin Mary and teachings about her role in salvation history.
definition.zh: （基督教语境中）反对或批评“圣母敬礼”与相关圣母论教义的立场，尤其指反对对童贞玛利亚的崇敬，以及她在救恩历史中角色的相关教导。

examples.en: Some Protestant writers argue from an anti-Marianism perspective that prayer should be directed to God alone.
examples.zh: 一些新教作者从反圣母论的立场主张，祷告应只向上帝而非向圣徒或圣母。

examples.en: The debate over anti-Marianism often centers on whether Marian devotion is biblical or a later tradition.
examples.zh: 关于反圣母论的争论常聚焦于：圣母敬礼是否有圣经依据，还是后期传统的发展。

examples.en: In the class on church history, we compared Catholic Mariology with anti-Marianism in parts of the Reformation.
examples.zh: 在教会史课程中，我们比较了天主教的圣母论与宗教改革时期部分地区的反圣母论。

extraExplanation: “Marianism”来自“Mary（玛利亚）”的形容词形式“Marian（圣母的/与玛利亚相关的）”，anti- 表示“反对”。因此 anti-Marianism 指对圣母敬礼或圣母论的反对立场。
这一词多用于神学、教会史与宗派对话语境；在宗教改革及其后的一些新教传统中较常见。使用时要注意语气：它描述立场，不必然等于对信徒的个人攻击。

summary.en: Anti-Marianist means opposing Marian devotion or doctrines about the Virgin Mary; it can also refer to a person who holds that view.
summary.zh: anti-Marianist 指反对对圣母玛利亚的崇敬或相关教义；也可指持此观点的人。

definition.en: opposed to Marianism (beliefs or practices that give special devotion or doctrinal emphasis to the Virgin Mary in Christianity).
definition.zh: 反对“圣母崇敬/圣母论”（在基督宗教中对圣母玛利亚给予特殊敬礼或教义强调的信仰与做法）的。

examples.en: Some anti-Marianist writers argue that devotion to Mary distracts from worship of God.
examples.zh: 一些反圣母崇敬的作者认为，对玛利亚的敬礼会分散对上帝的敬拜。

examples.en: The pamphlet takes an anti-Marianist tone when discussing prayers to Mary.
examples.zh: 这本小册子在讨论向圣母祈祷时带有反圣母崇敬的语气。

definition.en: a person who opposes Marianism or strong devotion to the Virgin Mary.
definition.zh: 反对圣母崇敬（或反对对圣母玛利亚强烈敬礼）的人。

examples.en: He described himself as an anti-Marianist within his denomination.
examples.zh: 他在自己的教派中把自己描述为一名反圣母崇敬者。

examples.en: The debate included Catholics, Protestants, and a few outspoken anti-Marianists.
examples.zh: 这场辩论包括天主教徒、新教徒，以及少数直言不讳的反圣母崇敬者。

extraExplanation: “Marianism/Marian devotion”常见于天主教与东正教传统；部分新教传统会批评某些“对圣母的敬礼”可能接近或构成对圣母的崇拜（worship），因此会出现“anti-Marianist”这类标签。使用时语气可能偏争论性，写作中可用更中性表达如 “critical of Marian devotion（对圣母敬礼持批评态度）”。

summary.en: Anti-Marist means opposed to the Marists (a Catholic religious order/group) or their influence; it can also refer to a person who opposes them.
summary.zh: anti-Marist 指“反马利会（天主教修会/团体）或反对其影响的”，也可指“反马利会人士”。

definition.en: opposed to the Marists (a Catholic religious group, including the Marist Brothers and the Society of Mary), or against their ideas or influence
definition.zh: 反对马利会（天主教团体，包括马利会弟兄/玛利士修会、圣母会等）或反对其思想与影响的

examples.en: The newspaper published an anti-Marist editorial criticizing the schools run by the order.
examples.zh: 这家报纸发表了一篇反马利会的社论，批评该修会开办的学校。

examples.en: In some regions, anti-Marist protests targeted Catholic missions.
examples.zh: 在某些地区，反马利会的抗议活动把矛头指向天主教传教机构。

definition.en: a person who opposes the Marists or their influence
definition.zh: 反对马利会或其影响的人

examples.en: He was known locally as an anti-Marist after campaigning against the order’s presence.
examples.zh: 他因发起反对该修会进驻的运动而在当地被视为“反马利会人士”。

extraExplanation: “anti-Marist”比较少见，很多人其实想写的是“anti-Marxist（反马克思主义的）”。如果你的语境是政治思想（社会主义、阶级斗争、资本主义批判等），更可能是 anti-Marxist。
“Marist”在英语里最常见的指向是天主教的马利会相关团体（如 Marist Brothers、Society of Mary）。在历史或殖民与教育的语境中，可能会谈到对其学校、传教活动或社会影响的支持/反对。

summary.en: Anti-market describes ideas or actions that oppose free markets or market-based policies, or that avoid appealing to what sells well.
summary.zh: anti-market 指反对自由市场/市场化政策，或指不迎合市场、难以畅销的做法或风格。

definition.en: Opposing free markets, market competition, or market-based policies (such as privatization, deregulation, or free trade).
definition.zh: 反对自由市场、市场竞争或以市场为基础的政策（如私有化、放松监管、自由贸易）。

examples.en: Some voters see the proposal as anti-market because it adds strict price controls.
examples.zh: 一些选民认为该提案是反市场的，因为它增加了严格的价格管制。

examples.en: The party’s platform is often described as anti-market and pro-state.
examples.zh: 该政党的纲领常被形容为反市场、亲国家干预。

definition.en: Not suitable for selling or for a market audience; unlikely to sell well.
definition.zh: 不适合销售或不迎合市场；不太可能卖得好。

examples.en: The publisher worried the novel was too experimental and therefore anti-market.
examples.zh: 出版社担心这部小说太实验性，因此不符合市场口味。

examples.en: The director chose an anti-market approach and avoided popular clichés.
examples.zh: 导演选择了不迎合市场的做法，避免使用流行套路。

extraExplanation: “anti-market”常用于政治与经济讨论中，语气有时带评价色彩：支持者可能称其为“保护弱势/反垄断”，反对者可能称其为“抑制竞争/效率低”。理解时要看说话者立场与语境。
也常与“pro-market（亲市场）”“market-friendly（对市场友好）”“anti-capitalist（反资本主义）”区分：anti-market不一定等同于反资本主义，可能只是反对某些市场化政策。

summary.en: Anti-marketing is a way of promoting something by avoiding traditional “salesy” advertising and using a more honest, low-hype style.
summary.zh: Anti-marketing（反营销）指用不“推销感”的方式做推广，避开传统广告套路，以更坦诚、低炒作的表达来赢得信任。

definition.en: A strategy or style of promoting a product, brand, or idea by rejecting traditional advertising techniques—often using honesty, minimal hype, or even criticism of marketing itself to build trust and interest.
definition.zh: 一种通过“反其道而行”来推广产品/品牌/理念的方式：刻意避开传统广告套路，常用坦诚、低炒作，甚至吐槽营销本身来获得信任与关注。

examples.en: The brand’s anti-marketing campaign used plain packaging and no slogans to seem more trustworthy.
examples.zh: 这个品牌的反营销活动用朴素包装、没有口号，让人感觉更可信。

examples.en: Instead of flashy ads, they relied on anti-marketing: candid customer stories and transparent pricing.
examples.zh: 他们不做炫目的广告，而是用反营销：真实的顾客故事和透明定价。

definition.en: Describing a message, tone, or campaign that avoids or resists conventional marketing language and tactics.
definition.zh: 形容一种信息/语气/活动风格：刻意不使用传统营销话术与手段，甚至带有抵触营销的态度。

examples.en: Their website copy is very anti-marketing—simple, direct, and low-key.
examples.zh: 他们网站文案很“反营销”——简单、直接、不过度渲染。

examples.en: She took an anti-marketing tone, admitting the product isn’t for everyone.
examples.zh: 她用了反营销的语气，坦白说这个产品并不适合所有人。

extraExplanation: “anti-marketing”常见于品牌策略与互联网语境，核心不是“不营销”，而是用“反广告感”的表达来降低防备：比如不夸大、讲缺点、强调限制条件（‘不适合所有人’）、让用户口碑自然扩散。
它和“anti-advertising（反广告）/de-marketing（逆向营销、减少需求）”有区别：anti-marketing更偏风格与话术；de-marketing更偏主动降低或筛选需求（如限量、涨价、劝退不合适客户）。
常见搭配：anti-marketing campaign（反营销活动）、anti-marketing tone（反营销语气）、anti-marketing approach（反营销做法）。

summary.en: “Anti-marriage” describes a person, idea, or position that is against marriage or the institution of marriage.
summary.zh: “Anti-marriage”用于描述反对婚姻或婚姻制度的人、观点或立场。

definition.en: opposed to marriage or to the institution of marriage; not supporting marriage as a good or desirable thing
definition.zh: 反对婚姻或婚姻制度的；不支持婚姻是好或值得追求的事

examples.en: He isn’t anti-marriage, but he doesn’t want to get married right now.
examples.zh: 他并不反对婚姻，只是现在不想结婚。

examples.en: Some people read her essay as anti-marriage, even though she was mainly criticizing unfair laws.
examples.zh: 有些人把她的文章解读为反婚姻，尽管她主要是在批评不公平的法律。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制/与……相对”。“anti-marriage”多用于观点或立场的描述，语气有时比较强，容易被理解为对婚姻本身的否定。更中性的表达可以用“not interested in marriage”“skeptical about marriage（对婚姻持怀疑态度）”。
在公共讨论中，这个词常出现在对社会制度、法律权利、家庭观念的争论里；也可能指反对特定形式的婚姻（如“anti-same-sex marriage”），因此上下文很重要。

summary.en: Anti-martyrdom means opposing or criticizing martyrdom and the glorification of dying or suffering for a cause.
summary.zh: Anti-martyrdom 指反对殉道/烈士式牺牲，以及反对美化、赞颂为事业而死或受苦的观念。

definition.en: Opposition to the idea or practice of martyrdom (dying or suffering for a cause) or to praising martyrdom as something admirable.
definition.zh: 反对“殉道/烈士式牺牲”这一观念或做法；也指反对把殉道浪漫化、赞美为崇高之举。

examples.en: The author’s anti-martyrdom message urges activists to stay alive and keep helping others.
examples.zh: 作者的反殉道信息敦促行动者要活下去，继续帮助他人。

examples.en: Her speech was strongly anti-martyrdom: she argued that safety and long-term impact matter more than heroic sacrifice.
examples.zh: 她的演讲立场鲜明地反殉道：她认为安全和长期影响比英雄式牺牲更重要。

definition.en: Describing ideas, language, or attitudes that discourage martyrdom or criticize “martyr” narratives.
definition.zh: （作定语）形容反对殉道、批评“烈士叙事/殉道叙事”的。

examples.en: He wrote an anti-martyrdom essay about how movements can avoid needless loss.
examples.zh: 他写了一篇反殉道的文章，讨论社会运动如何避免不必要的伤亡。

examples.en: The campaign’s anti-martyrdom tone focused on prevention and community care.
examples.zh: 该活动带有反殉道的基调，重点强调预防与社区照护。

extraExplanation: 这个词不算常见，更多见于学术写作、评论或政治/宗教语境中，用来批评“把牺牲当成最高美德”的价值观。
拼写上常用连字符 anti-martyrdom 来突出“反对殉道”这一复合概念；在实际写作中也可能改写为 opposition to martyrdom / anti-martyrdom stance。

summary.en: Anti-Marxist means opposed to Marxism or against Marxist ideas or movements.
summary.zh: anti-Marxist 指反对马克思主义或反对马克思主义思想与运动的。

definition.en: strongly opposed to Marxism (the political and economic ideas associated with Karl Marx), or aimed at criticizing or resisting Marxist policies or groups.
definition.zh: 反马克思主义的；强烈反对马克思主义（卡尔·马克思相关的政治与经济思想）的；用于批判或抵制马克思主义政策或团体的。

examples.en: The newspaper took an openly anti-Marxist stance during the election.
examples.zh: 这家报纸在选举期间公开采取反马克思主义立场。

examples.en: Some governments promoted anti-Marxist education during the Cold War.
examples.zh: 在冷战时期，一些政府推动反马克思主义教育。

examples.en: He wrote an anti-Marxist essay criticizing class struggle as a political strategy.
examples.zh: 他写了一篇反马克思主义的文章，批评把阶级斗争当作政治策略。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，意思是“反对、抵制”。因此 anti-Marxist 常用于政治、历史与学术语境，尤其与20世纪的意识形态对立（如冷战）相关。
写作中它可能既是描述立场（anti-Marxist politician），也可能描述政策/行动（anti-Marxist campaign）。注意在中立场合可用更客观的表达，如 “critical of Marxism”（对马克思主义持批评态度）。

summary.en: Anti-mask means opposed to wearing masks or to mask mandates; it can also refer to a person with that view.
summary.zh: anti-mask 指反对戴口罩或反对口罩强制规定；也可指持这种观点的人。

definition.en: Opposed to wearing face masks (especially during a disease outbreak) or against mask requirements.
definition.zh: 反对戴口罩的；反对口罩规定的（尤其在疫情期间）。

examples.en: Some anti-mask protesters gathered outside the city hall.
examples.zh: 一些反对戴口罩的抗议者聚集在市政厅外。

examples.en: The store posted a sign saying it would not serve anti-mask customers who refuse to follow the rules.
examples.zh: 商店贴出告示：不为拒绝遵守规定的反口罩顾客提供服务。

definition.en: A person who is opposed to wearing face masks or to mask mandates.
definition.zh: 反对戴口罩或反对口罩强制规定的人。

examples.en: On social media, anti-masks argued that masks don’t help.
examples.zh: 在社交媒体上，反口罩者声称口罩没有用。

examples.en: The debate became heated between anti-masks and people supporting public health measures.
examples.zh: 反口罩者与支持公共卫生措施的人之间的争论变得激烈。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是英语中表示“反对、抵制”的前缀（如 antiwar 反战、antivirus 杀毒）。因此 anti-mask 多用于新闻与社交媒体语境，带有一定立场色彩。
写作时常见搭配有 anti-mask protest（反口罩抗议）、anti-mask sentiment（反口罩情绪）、anti-mask mandate（反对口罩强制令）。更中性的说法可以用 opposed to mask mandates（反对口罩强制令）或 against mask requirements（反对口罩规定）。
拼写上常见 anti-mask（带连字符）；也会看到 antimask 或 anti mask，但以 anti-mask 更常见、也更易读。

summary.en: Anti-maskers are people who oppose wearing face masks or mask requirements.
summary.zh: Anti-maskers 指反对戴口罩或反对口罩规定的人。

definition.en: people who oppose wearing face masks (especially for public health reasons)
definition.zh: 反对戴口罩的人（尤指反对公共卫生原因下的口罩规定）

examples.en: During the pandemic, anti-maskers protested outside the city hall.
examples.zh: 在疫情期间，反口罩者在市政厅外抗议。

examples.en: Some anti-maskers said mask rules violated personal freedom.
examples.zh: 一些反口罩者说口罩规定侵犯了个人自由。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/对抗”；“masker”原本可指“戴面具的人”，在疫情语境里更常指“戴口罩的人”。“anti-maskers”多用于新闻与社交媒体，语气常带批评或对立色彩，因此在正式写作中也可用更中性的说法，如“people opposed to mask mandates（反对口罩强制令的人）”。
相关词：anti-vaxxer（反疫苗者）、mask mandate（口罩强制令）、public health measures（公共卫生措施）。

summary.en: Anti-Mason means a person (or viewpoint) opposed to Freemasons/Freemasonry; it can also refer to the Anti-Masonic movement/party in early U.S. history.
summary.zh: Anti-Mason指反对共济会（共济会成员/共济会主义）的人或立场；也可指美国早期的反共济会运动/政党。

definition.en: someone who is opposed to Freemasons or to Freemasonry
definition.zh: 反共济会者；反对共济会（共济会组织）的人

examples.en: He was known as an Anti-Mason who distrusted secret societies.
examples.zh: 他以反共济会者闻名，不信任秘密社团。

examples.en: The newspaper printed Anti-Mason articles criticizing the influence of Freemasonry.
examples.zh: 那家报纸刊登了反共济会的文章，批评共济会的影响。

definition.en: related to political or social opposition to Freemasons, especially in early U.S. history
definition.zh: 与反对共济会的政治或社会运动有关的（尤指美国早期历史）

examples.en: The town held an Anti-Mason meeting during the election season.
examples.zh: 选举季期间，这个镇举行了一场反共济会集会。

examples.en: He studied Anti-Mason politics in the 1830s.
examples.zh: 他研究19世纪30年代的反共济会政治。

extraExplanation: “Anti-Mason”常与美国历史上的“反共济会党（Anti-Masonic Party）”相关。这是美国最早的第三党之一，兴起于19世纪20—30年代，源于社会对共济会被视为“秘密结社、影响政治与司法”的担忧。
在现代语境里，这个词更多是一般性的“反对共济会的人/立场”，不一定指某个具体政党。写作中也常见形容词形式“Anti-Masonic”。

summary.en: Anti-Masonic means opposed to the Freemasons, or relating to movements that criticized their secrecy and influence.
summary.zh: Anti-Masonic 指“反共济会的”，或与反对/批评共济会的运动相关。

definition.en: opposed to the Freemasons (a fraternal organization), or criticizing their influence, secrecy, or political power
definition.zh: 反共济会的；反对或批评共济会（一个兄弟会组织）及其影响力、保密性或政治力量的

examples.en: In the 1830s, anti-Masonic newspapers accused the Freemasons of secretly controlling politics.
examples.zh: 在19世纪30年代，反共济会的报纸指责共济会秘密操控政治。

examples.en: The candidate used anti-Masonic rhetoric to appeal to voters who feared secret societies.
examples.zh: 这位候选人用反共济会的言论来吸引那些害怕秘密社团的选民。

definition.en: a person, group, or movement that opposes the Freemasons
definition.zh: 反共济会者；反共济会的团体或运动

examples.en: The Anti-Masonic Party became an early third party in U.S. politics.
examples.zh: 反共济会党成为美国政治中较早出现的第三党。

examples.en: Some anti-Masonics organized meetings to demand more transparency from public officials.
examples.zh: 一些反共济会人士组织集会，要求公职人员更加透明。

extraExplanation: “Anti-Masonic”最常见的历史背景在美国：1826年纽约州发生“威廉·摩根事件”（William Morgan Affair）后，社会上出现强烈的反共济会情绪，认为共济会以“秘密誓言”包庇成员。由此催生了美国历史上第一个以“单一议题”动员的政党之一——反共济会党（Anti-Masonic Party）。
用法提示：这个词常出现在历史、政治与阴谋论相关语境中。现代语境里使用时，语气可能带有强烈指控或争议色彩，写作时建议说明具体指的观点或历史背景。

summary.en: Anti-Masonic means opposed to Freemasons or connected to movements against Freemasonry, especially in historical politics.
summary.zh: anti-Masonic 指“反共济会的”，也可指与反对共济会的运动（尤指历史政治）有关的。

definition.en: opposed to the Freemasons (a fraternal organization) or to their influence; critical of Freemasonry.
definition.zh: 反共济会的；反对共济会（一个兄弟会组织）或反对其影响的；批评共济会的。

examples.en: In the 1800s, some newspapers published anti-Masonic articles.
examples.zh: 在19世纪，一些报纸发表过反共济会的文章。

examples.en: The candidate gained support from anti-Masonic voters who distrusted secret societies.
examples.zh: 这位候选人赢得了一些反共济会选民的支持，他们不信任秘密社团。

definition.en: relating to political movements or actions that oppose Freemasonry (especially in U.S. history).
definition.zh: 与反对共济会的政治运动或行动有关的（尤指美国历史语境）。

examples.en: The Anti-Masonic Party was one of the first third parties in the United States.
examples.zh: 反共济会党是美国最早的第三党之一。

examples.en: He wrote a book about anti-Masonic politics in early American elections.
examples.zh: 他写了一本关于美国早期选举中反共济会政治的书。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制”。“Masonic”来自“mason（石匠）”，共济会（Freemasons）最早与石匠行会传统有关，后来发展为带有仪式与象征的友爱组织。
“anti-Masonic”在美国历史中常与19世纪的反共济会运动有关，该运动部分源于人们对“秘密结社影响政治”的担忧，因此在历史文本与政治讨论中出现频率较高。
写作时注意语气：该词常用于描述立场或历史现象（anti-Masonic sentiment / movement），不一定等同于对某个群体的偏见，但在当代语境中也可能带有强烈批评意味。

summary.en: Anti-Masonry means opposition to the Freemasons, especially as a historical political/social movement; it can also describe ideas or actions against Freemasonry.
summary.zh: Anti-Masonry 指反对共济会的思想或行动，尤其常指历史上的反共济会政治/社会运动（如美国19世纪的反共济会党）。

definition.en: Opposition to the Freemasons (a fraternal organization), especially as a political or social movement that argues the group has too much secret influence.
definition.zh: 反共济会思想/运动：反对共济会（一个兄弟会组织），尤其指一种政治或社会运动，认为共济会在暗中拥有过大的影响力。

examples.en: In the 1830s, Anti-Masonry became a major force in American politics.
examples.zh: 在19世纪30年代，反共济会运动成为美国政治中的一股重要力量。

examples.en: The newspaper printed articles supporting Anti-Masonry and criticizing secret societies.
examples.zh: 这家报纸刊登文章支持反共济会立场，并批评秘密社团。

definition.en: Relating to or expressing opposition to the Freemasons or to secret fraternal organizations seen as powerful or exclusive.
definition.zh: 反共济会的：与反对共济会（或被认为强大、排他的秘密结社）有关的，或表达这种反对态度的。

examples.en: He gave an anti-Masonry speech during the campaign.
examples.zh: 他在竞选期间发表了一场反共济会的演讲。

examples.en: Anti-Masonry pamphlets warned voters about secret influence.
examples.zh: 反共济会的小册子警告选民提防“秘密势力”的影响。

extraExplanation: “Anti-Masonry”在美国历史上最常见的指向是19世纪20—30年代的“反共济会运动/反共济会党（Anti-Masonic Party）”。它在1826年威廉·摩根（William Morgan）失踪事件后迅速扩张；摩根据称要出版揭露共济会仪式的书，引发公众对“秘密结社干预司法与政治”的担忧。
反共济会党常被认为是美国早期的“第三党”，也推动了一些政治做法（如更系统的全国党代表大会）。在阅读历史材料时，常见搭配有 Anti-Masonic Party（反共济会党）、anti-Masonic movement（反共济会运动）。

summary.en: Anti-masquerade means opposing or restricting masquerades (masked events), and can describe a rule/movement that tries to stop them.
summary.zh: anti-masquerade 指“反对或限制化装舞会/假面活动”，也可指试图禁止这类活动的规定或运动。

definition.en: opposed to masquerades (masked balls or events where people hide their identity).
definition.zh: 反对化装舞会（戴面具、隐藏身份的活动）的。

examples.en: The city passed an anti-masquerade rule that banned masks at late-night parties.
examples.zh: 这座城市通过了一项反化装舞会的规定，禁止深夜聚会戴面具。

examples.en: Her essay takes an anti-masquerade stance, arguing that masks encourage bad behavior.
examples.zh: 她的文章持反化装舞会立场，认为面具会助长不良行为。

definition.en: a policy, law, campaign, or attitude that tries to restrict or stop masquerades.
definition.zh: （限制或禁止化装舞会的）政策、法律、运动或立场。

examples.en: The play mentions an anti-masquerade movement in the town.
examples.zh: 这部戏提到了镇上的一场反化装舞会运动。

examples.en: Newspapers criticized the anti-masquerade as an attack on public entertainment.
examples.zh: 报纸批评这种反化装舞会措施是在打击公众娱乐。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对……”，masquerade 指“化装舞会/假面活动”。因此 anti-masquerade 常用于描述“反对戴面具聚会”的法规或舆论。
在英语文化史中，18—19 世纪一些城市里确实出现过反对化装舞会的声音：他们担心匿名会带来治安问题、性别与阶层界限被打破，或被认为“不道德”。因此你可能会在历史文章里看到 anti-masquerade campaign / law 之类的搭配。

summary.en: Anti-material describes weapons or actions aimed at destroying equipment rather than personnel.
summary.zh: anti-material（多指反器材）形容以摧毁装备为目标、而非以杀伤人员为主的武器或行动。

definition.en: (Military) Designed to damage or destroy equipment, vehicles, or other physical objects rather than people.
definition.zh: （军事）用于破坏或摧毁装备、车辆或其他实体目标，而非以杀伤人员为主要目的。

examples.en: The unit used an anti-material rifle to disable the enemy vehicle from a long distance.
examples.zh: 该小队使用反器材步枪在远距离瘫痪敌方车辆。

examples.en: Anti-material weapons can target radar systems, fuel trucks, or light armored vehicles.
examples.zh: 反器材武器可针对雷达系统、油料车或轻型装甲车辆等目标。

extraExplanation: “anti-material”在军事语境里常见的标准写法是 **anti-materiel**（尤其在美式英语中，*materiel* 指“军需品/军事装备”）。很多人会把它误写成 *material*（材料）。两者读音相近，但含义不同：*material* 更偏“材料、物质”；*materiel* 更偏“装备、军用物资”。

summary.en: Anti-materialism is opposition to prioritizing money and possessions; in philosophy, it can also mean rejecting the idea that only physical matter is real.
summary.zh: Anti-materialism 指反对把金钱与财物看得最重要；在哲学中也可指反对“只有物质才是真实”的唯物主义观点。

definition.en: Opposition to materialism—the belief that money, possessions, and physical comfort are the most important goals in life.
definition.zh: 反物质主义；反对“把金钱、财物与物质享受视为人生最重要目标”的价值观。

examples.en: Her anti-materialism shows in how she chooses experiences over expensive things.
examples.zh: 她的反物质主义体现在：比起昂贵的物品，她更重视体验。

examples.en: The film has a strong anti-materialism message, criticizing consumer culture.
examples.zh: 这部电影有强烈的反物质主义主题，批评消费文化。

definition.en: (In philosophy) The view that reality is not only physical matter; mind, ideas, or spirit are considered fundamental.
definition.zh: （哲学）反对“唯物主义”的观点；认为现实不只由物质构成，心灵、观念或精神也具有根本性。

examples.en: Some religious thinkers argue for anti-materialism, saying consciousness cannot be reduced to the brain alone.
examples.zh: 一些宗教思想家主张反唯物主义，认为意识不能被简化为纯粹的大脑活动。

examples.en: In class, we compared materialism and anti-materialism in theories of the mind.
examples.zh: 课堂上，我们比较了关于心灵的唯物主义与反唯物主义理论。

extraExplanation: “anti-materialism”在日常语境里通常谈的是价值观：反对消费主义、炫富与“拥有越多越幸福”的观念；常和simple living（简朴生活）、minimalism（极简主义）、anti-consumerism（反消费主义）一起出现。
在哲学语境里，它更接近“anti-physicalism/anti-reductionism（反物理主义/反还原论）”的讨论，常见于mind-body（身心关系）与consciousness（意识）议题。根据语境判断更自然。

summary.en: Anti-materialist describes a person or idea that rejects materialism—either consumer-focused values or, in philosophy, the view that only matter is real.
summary.zh: anti-materialist 指反对物质主义的（可指反消费至上的价值观；也可指哲学上反对“只有物质真实存在”的立场）。

definition.en: Opposed to materialism—especially the belief that happiness or success mainly comes from money, possessions, or consumer goods.
definition.zh: 反对物质主义的（尤其反对把幸福或成功主要建立在金钱、财产或消费品上的观念）。

examples.en: She grew up in an anti-materialist household where gifts were usually handmade.
examples.zh: 她在一个反对物质主义的家庭长大，礼物通常是手工做的。

examples.en: The film has an anti-materialist message: relationships matter more than luxury.
examples.zh: 这部电影传达了反物质主义的信息：关系比奢侈更重要。

definition.en: In philosophy, rejecting the view that reality is only physical matter (a stance closer to idealism or spiritual views).
definition.zh: （哲学）反对“世界只由物质构成”的观点（更接近唯心论或精神性观点）。

examples.en: Some readers interpret the novel as anti-materialist because it treats consciousness as primary.
examples.zh: 一些读者认为这部小说带有反唯物主义倾向，因为它把意识看得更重要。

examples.en: His writing combines science with an anti-materialist view of the mind.
examples.zh: 他的写作把科学与一种反唯物主义的心灵观结合在一起。

extraExplanation: 这个词常见于社会文化讨论（“反消费主义/反攀比”）与哲学语境（“反唯物主义”）两种用法；中文翻译要根据上下文选“反物质主义”或“反唯物主义”。
拼写上常用连字符 anti-materialist；也可写作 antimaterialist（较少见）。

summary.en: Anti-materialistic describes someone or something that rejects a focus on money and possessions as life’s main goal.
summary.zh: anti-materialistic 指反对把金钱与财物当作人生主要目标的价值观或态度。

definition.en: Opposed to materialism; believing that money, possessions, and physical comfort are not the most important goals in life.
definition.zh: 反物质主义的；认为金钱、财物与物质享受并非人生最重要目标的。

examples.en: She was raised with an anti-materialistic attitude, so she prefers simple living.
examples.zh: 她从小被培养出反物质主义的态度，所以更喜欢简朴生活。

examples.en: The novel has an anti-materialistic message: relationships matter more than luxury.
examples.zh: 这部小说传达了反物质主义的信息：关系比奢华更重要。

examples.en: Their anti-materialistic values led them to donate most of their income to charity.
examples.zh: 他们的反物质主义价值观让他们把大部分收入捐给了慈善机构。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，materialistic 指“物质至上、看重金钱与财物的”。合起来 anti-materialistic 常用于描述一种价值观或生活态度。
拼写上常见两种形式：anti-materialistic（带连字符）和 antimaterialistic（不带连字符）。两者意思相同，带连字符更清晰、也更常见于一般写作。
语境上它通常不是“反对物质本身”，而是“反对把物质当作人生首要追求”。常与 simple living（简朴生活）、consumerism（消费主义）等话题一起出现。

summary.en: Anti-matrimonial means “against marriage or marrying,” often used in formal or critical writing.
summary.zh: anti-matrimonial 指“反对结婚或婚姻（制度）”，多见于较正式或评论性写作。

definition.en: opposed to marriage, marrying, or the institution of marriage; not supportive of getting married.
definition.zh: 反对结婚或婚姻制度的；不支持结婚的。

examples.en: He has an anti-matrimonial attitude and says he never wants to get married.
examples.zh: 他有一种反婚姻的态度，说自己永远不想结婚。

examples.en: Some critics called the film anti-matrimonial because it portrays marriage as unhappy.
examples.zh: 一些评论家称这部电影“反婚姻”，因为它把婚姻描写得很不幸福。

examples.en: The article takes an anti-matrimonial view, focusing on the benefits of staying single.
examples.zh: 这篇文章持反婚姻观点，强调单身的好处。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制”（如 anti-war 反战、anti-smoking 反吸烟）。
“matrimonial”来自“matrimony”（婚姻），多用于较正式语境（如 matrimonial home“婚房/夫妻共同住所”、matrimonial law“婚姻法”）。因此 anti-matrimonial 也偏书面、评论性用法。
在日常口语里，人们更常说“anti-marriage”或“against marriage”。

summary.en: “Anti-matrimony” means opposed to marriage, or a message/viewpoint that rejects marriage.
summary.zh: “anti-matrimony”指反对婚姻的，或指反婚姻的观点/主张。

definition.en: Opposed to marriage (matrimony), or expressing the idea that marriage is undesirable or should be rejected.
definition.zh: 反对婚姻的；主张婚姻不必要或不应被接受的。

examples.en: She wrote an anti-matrimony essay arguing that people can build committed lives without getting married.
examples.zh: 她写了一篇反婚姻的文章，主张人们不结婚也能建立稳定的承诺关系。

examples.en: The film’s anti-matrimony tone challenges the traditional “happily ever after” ending.
examples.zh: 这部电影的反婚姻基调挑战了传统的“从此幸福快乐”的结局。

definition.en: A viewpoint, message, or movement that opposes marriage.
definition.zh: 反婚姻的观点、主张或运动。

examples.en: In the debate, his speech was dismissed as anti-matrimony rather than a critique of unfair divorce laws.
examples.zh: 在辩论中，他的发言被认为是反婚姻，而不是对不公平离婚法律的批评。

examples.en: Some critics labeled the novel’s theme as anti-matrimony.
examples.zh: 一些评论家把这部小说的主题称为反婚姻。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是英语里很常见的前缀，意思是“反对/对抗”。把它加在“matrimony（婚姻）”前面，就形成“anti-matrimony（反婚姻）”。这种带连字符的写法常用于强调立场或观点（尤其在标题、评论、政治/社会议题中）。
在表达时要注意语气：anti-matrimony 往往带有比较强的价值判断（“反对婚姻本身”）。如果你只是想说“不想结婚/偏好不结婚”，更中性、常见的说法有 “doesn’t want to get married / not interested in marriage”。

summary.en: Antimatter is matter made of particles with opposite charge to normal matter; when it meets matter, they can annihilate and release energy.
summary.zh: 反物质由与普通物质电荷相反的反粒子组成；与物质相遇时可能发生湮灭并释放能量。

definition.en: A type of substance made of particles that have the same mass as ordinary matter but opposite electric charge (e.g., a positron is the antimatter version of an electron). When antimatter meets matter, they can destroy each other and release a lot of energy.
definition.zh: 一种由“反粒子”组成的物质：这些粒子的质量与普通物质相同，但电荷相反（例如正电子是电子的反物质对应物）。反物质与物质相遇时可能相互湮灭，并释放大量能量。

examples.en: Scientists study antimatter to understand the laws of the universe.
examples.zh: 科学家研究反物质来理解宇宙的规律。

examples.en: When antimatter touches matter, both can be destroyed in a process called annihilation.
examples.zh: 当反物质接触物质时，二者可能在一种叫“湮灭”的过程中被毁灭。

definition.en: (In science fiction or informal use) A powerful energy source or dangerous substance imagined to fuel engines, weapons, or dramatic events.
definition.zh: （科幻或非正式用法）一种被想象成能为引擎、武器或戏剧性事件提供动力的强大能源或危险物质。

examples.en: In the movie, the ship runs on antimatter.
examples.zh: 在电影里，这艘飞船用反物质作为动力。

examples.en: The story’s villain threatens the city with an antimatter bomb.
examples.zh: 故事里的反派用“反物质炸弹”威胁城市。

extraExplanation: “antimatter”常写作一个词；“anti-matter”带连字符也能见到，但在现代英语科学写作中较少。
词源：anti-（反、对立）+ matter（物质）。
注意区分：反物质不是“反对物质的东西”，而是物理学里与普通物质对应、性质相反的粒子体系。
文学/流行文化中常被夸张为“几乎无限能量”，但现实中制造与保存反物质非常困难且成本极高。

summary.en: “Anti-meat” describes attitudes or actions against eating meat or against the meat industry.
summary.zh: “Anti-meat”用于描述反对吃肉或反对肉类产业的态度与行动。

definition.en: opposed to eating meat, or against the meat industry (often for ethical, environmental, or health reasons).
definition.zh: 反对吃肉的；反对肉类产业的（常因伦理、环保或健康原因）。

examples.en: She’s vegan and has strong anti-meat views.
examples.zh: 她是纯素者，并且有很强烈的反肉立场。

examples.en: The group ran an anti-meat campaign to promote plant-based diets.
examples.zh: 该团体发起了反肉宣传活动，推广植物性饮食。

examples.en: Some people see the new documentary as anti-meat propaganda.
examples.zh: 有些人认为这部新纪录片是反肉宣传。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制”。“anti-meat”多用于修饰观点、态度、宣传（anti-meat views/campaign/sentiment）。
写作上常见加连字符（anti-meat）以避免误读；也可写作“anti meat”（较不正式）或更明确的“anti–meat-eating”（反对吃肉这种行为）。
注意语气：在公共讨论中，“anti-meat”有时带评价色彩，可能暗示“偏激/宣传”；若想更中性，可用“plant-based”或“meat-reducing”。

summary.en: Anti-mechanistic describes ideas or approaches that reject purely machine-like, part-by-part explanations, especially in philosophy and science.
summary.zh: Anti-mechanistic 指反对纯粹“像机器一样”分解与因果化解释的观点或方法，常用于哲学与科学语境。

definition.en: Opposed to mechanistic explanations (the idea that something can be fully explained as a machine-like system of parts and causes).
definition.zh: 反对机械论解释的；反对把事物完全当作“机器系统”来解释的。

examples.en: Some philosophers take an anti-mechanistic view of the mind, arguing that consciousness cannot be reduced to brain mechanics.
examples.zh: 一些哲学家对心灵持反机械论观点，认为意识不能被简化为大脑的机械运作。

examples.en: Her anti-mechanistic approach to biology emphasizes the organism as a whole, not just its individual parts.
examples.zh: 她在生物学上采取反机械论方法，强调有机体整体，而不只是各个部分。

definition.en: (Less common) Resisting overly rigid, machine-like methods in practice or art; favoring creativity, meaning, or human judgment.
definition.zh: （较少见）反对过于僵硬、像机器一样的做法；强调创造力、意义或人的判断。

examples.en: The director’s anti-mechanistic style keeps performances natural instead of perfectly timed.
examples.zh: 导演的反机械论风格让表演更自然，而不是分秒不差地卡点。

examples.en: Teachers with an anti-mechanistic attitude avoid treating learning as a simple input-output process.
examples.zh: 持反机械论态度的老师不会把学习当作简单的“输入—输出”过程。

extraExplanation: “Mechanistic（机械论的）”常见于哲学、科学史与心灵哲学/生命科学讨论：它强调用物理因果与可分解的部件来解释复杂现象。前缀 anti- 表示“反对”。
在学术语境中，它常与 holism（整体论）、organicism（有机论）、vitalism（生命力论，现多为历史概念）等观点形成对比。
使用时多带“立场/方法论”色彩：anti-mechanistic view/approach/account（反机械论的观点/方法/解释）。

summary.en: Anti-mechanistically means “in a way that rejects mechanistic (machine-like, purely cause-and-effect) explanations.”
summary.zh: anti-mechanistically 指“以反对机械论（把事物当作机器式、纯因果解释）的方式”。

definition.en: In a way that opposes or rejects a mechanistic explanation (the idea that something can be fully explained as a machine-like system of parts and causes).
definition.zh: 以反对或否定“机械论”解释的方式（认为事物不应被完全当作像机器一样由零件与因果机制构成来解释）。

examples.en: Some philosophers argue anti-mechanistically that consciousness cannot be reduced to brain processes alone.
examples.zh: 一些哲学家以反机械论的方式主张：意识不能只被还原为大脑过程。

examples.en: The author writes anti-mechanistically, emphasizing purpose and meaning rather than mere cause and effect.
examples.zh: 作者以反机械论的方式写作，强调目的与意义，而不仅是单纯的因果关系。

examples.en: In biology, a few thinkers speak anti-mechanistically when they stress the organism as a whole.
examples.zh: 在生物学中，有些思想家在强调“有机体作为整体”时，会以反机械论的方式表述。

extraExplanation: “mechanistic（机械论的）”常用于哲学、科学史与心灵哲学等语境，指用可分解的部件、物理因果与“像机器一样运作”的模型来解释复杂现象；“anti-”表示反对，因此 anti-mechanistically 常接在 argue / explain / interpret / view 等动词后。
这个词较偏学术写作，日常英语中更常见的表达是 “in a non-mechanistic way（以非机械论的方式）” 或 “against a mechanistic view（反对机械论观点）”。
相关思想常与 anti-reductionism（反还原论）、holism（整体论）相邻；在文学或人文写作中，有时用来对比“冷冰冰的机器式解释”与“意义、价值、目的”等维度。

summary.en: Anti-mechanization means opposition to mechanization or automation, or something expressing that opposition.
summary.zh: anti-mechanization 指反对机械化/自动化，或指表达这种反对的立场/态度。

definition.en: Opposition to using machines or automation, especially when it is believed to harm workers, society, quality, or the environment.
definition.zh: 反对机械化（或自动化）：尤其指认为机器会伤害工人、社会、产品质量或环境时，对使用机器/自动化的反对。

examples.en: Some unions expressed anti-mechanization concerns because automation could reduce jobs.
examples.zh: 一些工会表达了反机械化的担忧，因为自动化可能会减少工作岗位。

examples.en: The novel portrays anti-mechanization feelings in a village where machines threaten traditional crafts.
examples.zh: 这部小说描绘了村庄里的反机械化情绪：机器威胁到传统手艺。

definition.en: Showing or expressing opposition to mechanization or automation.
definition.zh: 反机械化的：表现出或表达对机械化/自动化的反对。

examples.en: The group released an anti-mechanization statement after the factory announced new robots.
examples.zh: 工厂宣布引进新机器人后，该团体发布了一份反机械化声明。

examples.en: He took an anti-mechanization stance and argued for more human-centered work.
examples.zh: 他采取反机械化立场，主张更多以人为本的工作方式。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对……”，“mechanization”意为“机械化/用机器替代人工”。这个词多用于讨论工业化、自动化与就业、劳动权益、手工艺传统之间的冲突。
在英语文化语境里，常被拿来与19世纪英国“卢德派（Luddites）”联系：他们因担心机器破坏生计而反对某些机械化措施（并不等于反对一切科技）。

summary.en: “Anti-medical” means opposed to medicine, medical care, or the medical profession, often describing attitudes or messaging.
summary.zh: “anti-medical”指反对医学、医疗照护或医疗行业的，常用来形容某种态度或言论。

definition.en: opposed to medical care, medical science, or the medical profession (often used to describe attitudes, movements, or messages).
definition.zh: 反对医疗照护、医学科学或医疗行业的（常用来形容态度、运动或言论）。

examples.en: The group spread anti-medical messages that discouraged people from seeing doctors.
examples.zh: 该团体传播反医疗的信息，劝人们不要去看医生。

examples.en: Her anti-medical views made her refuse routine checkups.
examples.zh: 她的反医疗观点让她拒绝做常规体检。

definition.en: against or criticizing medical treatment in a particular situation or policy debate.
definition.zh: 在特定情境或政策讨论中反对或批评医疗处理方式的。

examples.en: Some people called the proposal anti-medical because it limited access to clinics.
examples.zh: 有人称该提案“反医疗”，因为它限制了诊所的可及性。

examples.en: The article’s tone felt anti-medical, focusing only on rare side effects.
examples.zh: 那篇文章的语气给人反医疗的感觉，只强调罕见的副作用。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，意思是“反对/对抗”。“anti-medical”多用于描述对医学权威、医疗体系或治疗方式的总体反感或不信任。
注意语气：这个词常带有批评色彩，暗示说话者认为对方的立场不理性或可能有害。写作时若要更中性，可以改用“skeptical of medicine（对医学持怀疑态度）”或“critical of the healthcare system（批评医疗体系）”。
在公共健康语境中，它有时与“anti-vaccine（反疫苗）”“medical misinformation（医疗虚假信息）”等话题相邻，但含义不必然等同。

summary.en: Anti-medically means “in a way that opposes medical treatment or mainstream medicine.”
summary.zh: anti-medically 指“以反对医疗或主流医学的方式”。

definition.en: In a way that opposes medical treatment, medical expertise, or the use of medicine (often implying distrust of mainstream healthcare).
definition.zh: 以反对医疗（治疗/医学专业/用药）的方式；常含有不信任主流医疗体系的意味。

examples.en: Some online groups argue anti-medically, warning people not to see doctors.
examples.zh: 一些网络群体用反医疗的方式发言，劝人不要去看医生。

examples.en: He spoke anti-medically about vaccines, despite strong scientific evidence.
examples.zh: 尽管有大量科学证据，他仍以反医疗的口吻谈论疫苗。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是英语里很常见的前缀，表示“反对、抵制”（如 anti-war 反战、anti-smoking 反吸烟）。但“anti-medically”并不是很常用的固定词，写作中更常见的表达是：“in an anti-medical way / with an anti-medical attitude / anti-medicine”。
语境上，它往往带有价值判断：说话者可能在批评“反科学、反医学”的立场。使用时要注意语气与客观性，必要时可改用更中性的说法（例如：skeptical of mainstream medicine 对主流医学持怀疑态度）。

summary.en: Anti-medication describes someone or something opposed to taking medicine or using pharmaceutical treatment, either generally or in a specific case.
summary.zh: anti-medication 指反对服药或使用药物治疗的态度，可指总体立场或针对某一具体用药方案。

definition.en: Opposed to taking medicine or using pharmaceutical drugs, especially as a general attitude or belief.
definition.zh: 反对用药的；反对服用药物（尤指一种总体态度或立场）。

examples.en: My uncle is anti-medication and prefers to treat everything with herbal tea.
examples.zh: 我叔叔很反对用药，什么都更想用草药茶来处理。

examples.en: She isn’t anti-medication—she just worries about side effects.
examples.zh: 她不是反对用药——她只是担心副作用。

definition.en: Against a specific medication plan or course of treatment (often used in discussions about healthcare decisions).
definition.zh: 反对某个具体用药方案的；反对某一疗程用药的（常用于医疗决策讨论）。

examples.en: He was anti-medication at first, but he agreed to try a low dose.
examples.zh: 他一开始反对用药，但后来同意先尝试小剂量。

examples.en: The group is anti-medication for ADHD, arguing that schools should offer more support.
examples.zh: 这个团体反对用药来处理ADHD，认为学校应该提供更多支持。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”。“anti-medication”在口语和写作里能看懂，但不算固定的常用词；更常见的表达有：against medication、opposed to medication、anti-drug（含义可能更广或偏负面）。
连字符（anti-medication）常用于把“anti-”和名词连接成形容词，放在名词前作定语更清晰：anti-medication beliefs（反对用药的信念）。放在系动词后也可以：He is anti-medication（他反对用药）。
语气提示：在医疗语境中，这个词可能带有价值判断。更中性的说法是“reluctant to take medication（不太愿意用药）/ concerned about medication（对用药有顾虑）”。

summary.en: Anti-medicine means opposing or rejecting medical treatment or modern medicine; it can describe an attitude or a movement.
summary.zh: anti-medicine 指反对或排斥医疗治疗/现代医学；可形容一种态度，也可指一种运动。

definition.en: Opposed to medical treatment or the medical profession (especially modern or scientific medicine).
definition.zh: 反对医疗治疗或医学界（尤其指现代/科学医学）的。

examples.en: Some online groups promote anti-medicine ideas and discourage people from seeing doctors.
examples.zh: 一些网络群体传播反医学观念，劝人不要去看医生。

examples.en: The article argues that anti-medicine attitudes can lead to serious health risks.
examples.zh: 这篇文章认为，反医学态度可能带来严重的健康风险。

definition.en: A belief or movement that rejects or distrusts medical care, medicines, or medical expertise.
definition.zh: 反医学的信念或运动；对医疗、药物或医学专业知识的排斥与不信任。

examples.en: His anti-medicine was strongest when he believed natural remedies were always safer.
examples.zh: 当他认为天然疗法永远更安全时，他的反医学倾向最强。

examples.en: Public health officials worry that anti-medicine movements may reduce vaccination and treatment rates.
examples.zh: 公共卫生官员担心反医学运动会降低疫苗接种率和治疗率。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”。“anti-medicine”不是特别固定的常用词，更常见的相关表达有：anti-medical（反医学的）、anti-vaccine（反疫苗的，更具体）、anti-pharmaceutical（反制药/反药企的）。
使用时注意区分：批评医疗体系的某些问题（如费用、歧视、过度用药）不一定等于“anti-medicine”；而“anti-medicine”通常暗示对医学本身或医学专业整体的否定或不信任。

summary.en: Anti-medieval means “opposed to the Middle Ages/medieval ideas” or “not in a medieval style.”
summary.zh: anti-medieval 指“反对中世纪/中世纪观念”，也可指“非中世纪风格的”。

definition.en: Opposed to the Middle Ages or to medieval ideas, culture, or styles; critical of things considered “medieval.”
definition.zh: 反对中世纪（或中世纪观念、文化、风格）的；批判被认为“中世纪式”的事物的。

examples.en: Some writers took an anti-medieval view, blaming the Church for slowing scientific progress.
examples.zh: 一些作家持反中世纪立场，认为教会拖慢了科学进步。

examples.en: The architect rejected anti-medieval criticism and defended Gothic design.
examples.zh: 那位建筑师反驳了反中世纪的批评，为哥特式设计辩护。

definition.en: Not using or not inspired by medieval styles (especially in art, architecture, or literature).
definition.zh: （尤指艺术、建筑、文学）不采用或不受中世纪风格启发的；非中世纪风格的。

examples.en: The museum chose an anti-medieval layout with clean lines and minimal decoration.
examples.zh: 博物馆选择了非中世纪风格的布局：线条简洁、装饰极少。

examples.en: Her novel is anti-medieval in tone, focusing on modern skepticism rather than knights and faith.
examples.zh: 她的小说语气并非中世纪式的，而是聚焦现代怀疑精神，而非骑士与信仰。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对、抵制、与……相反”。因此 anti-medieval 通常用于学术或评论语境，表达对“中世纪”或“被贴上中世纪标签的做法”的否定态度。
英语里 “medieval” 有时带贬义，引申为“落后、残酷、不人道”（例如 medieval punishment“残酷的惩罚”）。所以 anti-medieval 有时也可理解为“反对落后/残酷的做法”，但是否带这种含义要看上下文。

summary.en: Anti-medievalism means a negative attitude or bias against the Middle Ages or medieval culture.
summary.zh: Anti-medievalism 指对中世纪及其中世纪文化的负面态度、批判或偏见。

definition.en: Opposition to, criticism of, or prejudice against the Middle Ages (medieval times) or medieval culture, often viewing it as backward, irrational, or undesirable.
definition.zh: 反中世纪主义；指对中世纪（及其中世纪文化）的反感、批判或偏见，常把中世纪视为落后、非理性或不值得向往。

examples.en: Some historians argue that anti-medievalism oversimplifies the Middle Ages as a “dark age.”
examples.zh: 一些历史学家认为，反中世纪主义把中世纪过度简化成“黑暗时代”。

examples.en: The film uses anti-medievalism to make modern life look automatically superior.
examples.zh: 这部电影借助反中世纪主义来衬托现代生活似乎天然更优越。

examples.en: In political debates, opponents sometimes use anti-medievalism by calling a policy “medieval.”
examples.zh: 在政治辩论中，反对者有时会用反中世纪主义，把某项政策骂成“中世纪的”。

extraExplanation: “anti-medievalism”常出现在历史写作、文化研究和媒体批评中，讨论现代人如何用“中世纪=愚昧/黑暗”的刻板印象来对比“现代=进步/理性”。
它和“medievalism（中世纪主义/中世纪风：对中世纪的想象、复兴或浪漫化）”相对：一个偏负面排斥，一个可能是欣赏或复古。
在英语里把某事骂作“medieval”往往是一种修辞（夸张/贬义），并不等于对真实中世纪历史的准确描述。

summary.en: Anti-medievalist: opposed to medievalism or to idealizing the Middle Ages; also a person with that view.
summary.zh: anti-medievalist：反对中世纪主义或反对美化中世纪的（人）。

definition.en: Opposed to medievalism or to an idealized/romantic view of the Middle Ages; critical of medieval-style ideas, art, or traditions.
definition.zh: 反对“中世纪主义”（对中世纪的美化/复兴倾向）的；对中世纪风格的观念、艺术或传统持批判态度的。

examples.en: Some critics take an anti-medievalist stance, warning against romanticizing the Middle Ages.
examples.zh: 一些评论者采取反中世纪主义的立场，警惕人们把中世纪浪漫化。

examples.en: The novel is anti-medievalist in tone, questioning myths about knights and honor.
examples.zh: 这部小说在基调上反中世纪主义，质疑关于骑士与荣誉的神话。

definition.en: A person who opposes medievalism or who argues against idealizing the Middle Ages.
definition.zh: 反中世纪主义者；反对中世纪主义或反对美化中世纪的人。

examples.en: As an anti-medievalist, she challenges popular images of the ‘golden age’ of chivalry.
examples.zh: 作为反中世纪主义者，她挑战大众关于“骑士黄金时代”的想象。

examples.en: Anti-medievalists often emphasize the period’s complexity rather than its legends.
examples.zh: 反中世纪主义者常强调该时期的复杂性，而不是它的传奇色彩。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，“-ist”表示“某种立场或思想的支持者/相关者”。因此 anti-medievalist 通常指反对把中世纪（medieval）浪漫化或当作理想典范的观点，而不一定是否定对中世纪历史的学术研究本身。
注意区分：medievalism 常指对“中世纪风格/价值”的复兴或迷恋（如文学、建筑、审美）；medieval studies 则是对中世纪历史与文化的学术研究。anti-medievalist 多在评论、文化研究或历史写作语境中出现。

summary.en: Anti-medievally means “in a way that opposes or criticizes medieval ideas or styles.”
summary.zh: anti-medievally 指“以反对或批评中世纪观念/风格的方式”。

definition.en: In a way that is opposed to, critical of, or reacting against medieval (Middle Ages) ideas, styles, or institutions.
definition.zh: 以反中世纪的方式；以反对、批评或抵制中世纪（中世纪时期）的观念、风格或制度的方式。

examples.en: Some nineteenth-century writers described industrial progress as a force that would sweep away society’s problems, speaking almost anti-medievally about monasteries and feudal rules.
examples.zh: 一些十九世纪作家把工业进步描述为能一扫社会问题的力量，谈到修道院和封建规则时几乎带着反中世纪的口吻。

examples.en: The critic argued anti-medievally, praising modern realism while mocking medieval romance as childish fantasy.
examples.zh: 这位评论家以反中世纪的立场论述，称赞现代写实主义，同时嘲讽中世纪传奇为幼稚的幻想。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”。“anti-medievally”并不常见，更常见的表达是“in an anti-medieval way”或用形容词“anti-medieval”。
它常出现在讨论文化史、文学史或建筑风格的语境里，用来描述一种立场：把“中世纪”当作需要被摆脱或纠正的对象（例如强调理性、科学、现代化来对比宗教权威或封建制度）。
注意“medieval”在英语里有时会带贬义，指“野蛮/落后”（如“medieval punishments”），因此“anti-medievally”有时也隐含“反对落后、反对残酷”的态度。

summary.en: Anti-men describes attitudes, messages, or actions seen as opposed to men or biased against men.
summary.zh: anti-men 用来形容被认为“反对男性”或“对男性有偏见”的态度、言论或做法。

definition.en: (usually before a noun) strongly opposed to men or showing prejudice against men.
definition.zh: （通常作定语，置于名词前）反对男性的；对男性带有偏见的。

examples.en: Some people criticized the ad as anti-men.
examples.zh: 一些人批评这则广告带有反男性倾向。

examples.en: He said the policy felt anti-men and unfair.
examples.zh: 他说这项政策让人感觉反男性、不公平。

examples.en: Be careful not to label all criticism of masculinity as anti-men.
examples.zh: 要小心，不要把对“男性气质”的批评一概贴上“反男性”的标签。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/抵制”。“anti-men”多用于社会议题或媒体评论中，语气往往较强，可能带有情绪或指控色彩。
拼写上常见作定语的连字符形式“anti-men”；也有人写作“anti-male”（更抽象）或“against men”。具体用哪种取决于你想表达的是“反对男性群体”还是“反对某些男性行为/特权”。
在讨论性别议题时，这个词容易引发对立。更中性、更具体的表达（例如“critical of certain male behaviors/privileges”）通常更有助于沟通。

summary.en: “Anti-merger” describes someone or something opposed to a company/organization merger, or refers to a person/group that opposes the merger.
summary.zh: “anti-merger”指反对公司/组织合并的（形容词），也可指反合并者或反对合并的阵营（名词）。

definition.en: opposed to a merger (the combining of two companies, organizations, or groups into one).
definition.zh: 反对合并的；反对（公司/组织等）并购或合并的。

examples.en: The anti-merger campaign argued that the deal would reduce competition.
examples.zh: 反合并阵营认为这笔交易会减少竞争。

examples.en: Several employees voiced anti-merger concerns about layoffs.
examples.zh: 几名员工表达了对合并的担忧，尤其担心裁员。

definition.en: a person, group, or position that opposes a merger.
definition.zh: 反合并者；反对合并的团体或立场。

examples.en: Anti-mergers say the smaller company will lose its identity.
examples.zh: 反合并者认为较小的公司会失去自身特色。

examples.en: The board listened to both supporters and anti-mergers before voting.
examples.zh: 董事会在投票前听取了支持者与反合并者双方的意见。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对、抵制”。与“merger（合并）”连用时，多见于商业新闻、公司治理（股东投票、董事会决议）和政策讨论（反垄断、监管审查）语境。
拼写上常见连字符：anti-merger。也会看到不加连字符的anti merger（作定语时较口语/简写），或更常见的表达“opposed to the merger / anti-merger stance”。

summary.en: “Anti-merging” means opposed to mergers or aimed at preventing mergers.
summary.zh: “anti-merging”指反对并购/合并，或旨在阻止并购的立场与措施。

definition.en: opposed to (or intended to prevent) companies or organizations from combining into one through a merger.
definition.zh: 反对（或旨在阻止）公司/组织通过并购合并为一体的。

examples.en: The senator took an anti-merging stance to protect small local businesses.
examples.zh: 这位参议员采取反并购立场，以保护本地小企业。

examples.en: Some regulators use anti-merging rules to limit market concentration.
examples.zh: 一些监管机构用反并购规定来限制市场过度集中。

definition.en: the policy, attitude, or movement that opposes mergers.
definition.zh: 反并购政策；反并购态度（或运动）。

examples.en: Anti-merging grew stronger after several big mergers led to higher prices.
examples.zh: 在几次大型并购导致价格上涨后，反并购情绪变得更强。

examples.en: Their platform includes anti-merging measures for essential services.
examples.zh: 他们的平台包含针对基础服务的反并购措施。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/对抗”，而“merging”来自“merge（合并）”。在新闻与商业语境中，anti-merging常与“anti-merger（反并购）”互换使用；写作时也常见连字符形式（anti-merging）来强调这是一个整体概念。
该词常出现在反垄断（antitrust）、监管（regulation）和市场集中度（market concentration）的讨论中：反并购立场通常担心并购会减少竞争、推高价格或削弱员工与消费者的选择。

summary.en: Anti-Merina means opposed to the Merina people of Madagascar, or relating to prejudice/hostility against them.
summary.zh: anti-Merina 指反对梅里纳人（马达加斯加族群之一），或与针对他们的偏见/敌意有关。

definition.en: opposed to the Merina people (an ethnic group from Madagascar), or showing prejudice/hostility toward them.
definition.zh: 反对（或对……抱有偏见/敌意的）梅里纳人（Merina，马达加斯加的一个族群）。

examples.en: Some politicians used anti-Merina language to gain support in other regions.
examples.zh: 一些政客使用反梅里纳人的言论来争取其他地区的支持。

examples.en: The article criticizes anti-Merina stereotypes in the media.
examples.zh: 这篇文章批评媒体中的反梅里纳人刻板印象。

definition.en: a person or group that is anti-Merina (opposed to the Merina people).
definition.zh: 反梅里纳者；反对梅里纳人的个人或团体。

examples.en: The historian describes how anti-Merina groups shaped regional politics.
examples.zh: 这位历史学家描述了反梅里纳团体如何影响地区政治。

extraExplanation: “Merina”指马达加斯加中部高地的主要族群之一，历史上与王国、殖民时期以及现代政治结构常被联系在一起；因此“anti-Merina”在新闻与历史写作里往往涉及族群关系、区域竞争或歧视问题。使用该词时要注意语境：它可能是描述社会现象的中性标签，也可能被用作带有偏见的攻击性说法。

summary.en: An anti-meson is the antiparticle of a meson in particle physics.
summary.zh: 反介子是粒子物理中介子的反粒子。

definition.en: In particle physics, the antiparticle of a meson (a particle made of a quark and an antiquark).
definition.zh: （粒子物理）介子的反粒子（由一个夸克和一个反夸克组成的粒子所对应的反粒子）。

examples.en: An anti-meson has the opposite electric charge and other quantum numbers compared with the corresponding meson.
examples.zh: 反介子与对应的介子相比，电荷和其他量子数等性质相反。

examples.en: In high-energy collisions, mesons and anti-mesons can be produced in pairs.
examples.zh: 在高能碰撞中，介子和反介子可能成对产生。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“相反的、反的”，如 anti-matter（反物质）、anti-particle（反粒子）。在物理学里，反粒子通常具有相反的电荷等量子数，但质量相同。
介子（meson）一般由“夸克 + 反夸克”构成；反介子则把其中的夸克/反夸克类型对调，因此整体量子数会改变。实际写作中也常见拼写为一个词：antimeson。

summary.en: Anti-messiah means a figure who is the opposite of a savior—often promising salvation but bringing harm or control instead.
summary.zh: Anti-messiah 指“反救世主/反弥赛亚”的人物或叙事：表面许诺拯救，结果带来伤害、欺骗或控制。

definition.en: a person or figure seen as the opposite of a savior (messiah)—someone who is expected to bring harm, deception, or spiritual/political “anti-salvation” instead of rescue
definition.zh: “救世主（弥赛亚）”的反面人物；被认为不是来拯救而是带来伤害、欺骗，或制造“反拯救”的人/形象

examples.en: In the novel, the charismatic leader is portrayed as an anti-messiah who promises hope but delivers control.
examples.zh: 在小说里，这位有魅力的领袖被塑造成“反弥赛亚”：口头许诺希望，实际带来控制。

examples.en: Some critics call him an anti-messiah because he turns public fear into power.
examples.zh: 一些评论者称他为“反救世主”，因为他把公众的恐惧转化为权力。

definition.en: describing a message, movement, or role that rejects or reverses the idea of a savior bringing redemption
definition.zh: （作定语）形容一种信息、运动或角色：否定或颠倒“救世主带来救赎”的观念

examples.en: The film has an anti-messiah storyline: redemption never arrives, and the hero becomes the threat.
examples.zh: 这部电影有“反弥赛亚”式剧情：救赎并未到来，英雄反而成了威胁。

extraExplanation: messiah（弥赛亚）来自犹太—基督教传统，通常指“被拣选来拯救、带来救赎的人”。anti- 作前缀表示“反对、对立、相反”。因此 anti-messiah 多用于文学、影评、政治评论等语境，强调“看似救世、实则反向”的人物功能。
注意区分 anti-messiah 与 antichrist（敌基督/反基督）：后者在基督教末世论中更具体、更宗教化；anti-messiah 往往更宽泛，常用于比喻或叙事分析。

summary.en: Anti-metaphysical means opposing metaphysics or rejecting abstract speculation about ultimate reality, often favoring empirical evidence.
summary.zh: anti-metaphysical 指反对形而上学或拒绝关于终极实在的抽象思辨，常强调经验与证据。

definition.en: Opposed to metaphysics (the branch of philosophy that asks about reality beyond the physical world, such as being, God, the soul, or ultimate causes).
definition.zh: 反形而上学的；反对形而上学（形而上学讨论超越物质世界的终极实在，如“存在”“上帝”“灵魂”“第一原因”等）。

examples.en: The scientist took an anti-metaphysical approach and focused only on what could be tested in experiments.
examples.zh: 这位科学家采取反形而上学的立场，只关注能在实验中检验的东西。

examples.en: His writing is strongly anti-metaphysical, avoiding talk of souls or invisible forces.
examples.zh: 他的写作很反形而上学，刻意避开关于灵魂或看不见力量的讨论。

definition.en: Rejecting abstract speculation about ultimate reality, especially in favor of practical, empirical, or scientific explanation.
definition.zh: （尤指）拒绝对终极实在的抽象思辨，倾向以务实、经验或科学方式解释问题。

examples.en: In this class, the mood is anti-metaphysical: students want clear evidence, not big theories.
examples.zh: 这门课的氛围偏反形而上学：学生想要清楚的证据，而不是宏大的玄学理论。

examples.en: The novel’s tone is anti-metaphysical, keeping its characters grounded in everyday life.
examples.zh: 这部小说的基调偏反形而上学，让人物始终扎根于日常生活。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，metaphysical 来自 metaphysics（形而上学）。在哲学史上，经验主义与实证主义传统常被描述为更“anti-metaphysical”，强调可观察、可验证与可证伪的论证方式。
使用场景多见于哲学、社会科学与文学批评。它通常不是日常口语高频词，更像学术或评论写作中的立场标签。

summary.en: Anti-metathetic describes something that resists or does not involve the switching of sounds/letters (metathesis).
summary.zh: Anti-metathetic 指“反换位/非换位的”，即不发生或抵制语音、字母顺序对调（metathesis）的现象。

definition.en: Opposed to, or not involving, metathesis (the switching of sounds or letters in a word).
definition.zh: 反对或不涉及“换位”（metathesis；指词中语音或字母位置对调）的；非换位的。

examples.en: In this dialect, the sound change is anti-metathetic: consonants keep their original order.
examples.zh: 在这个方言里，这种语音变化是 anti-metathetic 的：辅音保持原来的顺序。

examples.en: The editor preferred an anti-metathetic spelling that matched the standard form.
examples.zh: 编辑更倾向于一种 anti-metathetic 的拼写，使其符合标准形式。

extraExplanation: “metathetic”来自语言学：metathesis 指语音/字母顺序互换（如某些方言里把 /sp/ 说成 /ps/ 之类的现象）。在真实语料中，“anti-metathetic”非常少见，通常出现在语言学讨论或较技术性的写作里，用来强调“没有发生换位”或“与换位倾向相反”。

summary.en: “Anti-method” means a deliberate rejection of fixed rules or formal procedures, often favoring improvisation and experimentation.
summary.zh: “anti-method”指刻意拒绝固定规则或正式流程的方法，常强调即兴与实验。

definition.en: An approach (especially in art, literature, or philosophy) that deliberately rejects fixed rules, formal techniques, or step-by-step procedures; working in a way that is intentionally non-systematic.
definition.zh: （尤用于艺术、文学或哲学）一种刻意反对固定规则、正式技法或按步骤流程的方法；以“故意不系统化”的方式来进行创作或思考。

examples.en: The director’s anti-method style relied on improvisation instead of a strict script.
examples.zh: 这位导演的“反方法”风格依靠即兴发挥，而不是严格照着剧本。

examples.en: In that workshop, anti-method meant experimenting freely and learning from mistakes.
examples.zh: 在那个工作坊里，“反方法”指的是自由实验、从错误中学习。

examples.en: Her essay defended an anti-method approach to criticism, arguing that rules can limit insight.
examples.zh: 她的文章为一种“反方法”的批评方式辩护，认为规则可能限制洞见。

definition.en: Describing something that rejects or goes against formal methods, procedures, or techniques.
definition.zh: 形容某事物反对或背离正式的方法、流程或技术。

examples.en: They took an anti-method stance toward research and focused on open-ended exploration.
examples.zh: 他们对研究采取“反方法”的立场，重点放在开放式探索上。

examples.en: His anti-method writing process produces surprising connections between ideas.
examples.zh: 他的“反方法”写作过程会在观点之间产生意想不到的联系。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，因此 anti-method 字面意思是“反方法”。它常见于艺术与理论语境，用来强调：不把“步骤、规范、套路”当作唯一正确道路，而更重视偶然性、即兴、直觉与开放性的探索。
注意语气：anti-method 并不一定等于“乱来”或“不专业”，很多时候是在批评过度僵化的流程；但在学术或工作场景中使用时，最好说明你仍然有目标与原则，以免被理解为缺乏计划。
相关表达：rule-breaking（打破规则）、nontraditional approach（非传统方式）、experimental approach（实验性方法）、improvisational（即兴的）。在表演领域也有人用它与“method acting（方法派表演）”形成对比，但 anti-method 更常指广义的“反套路/反程式化”。

summary.en: “Anti-Mexican” describes hostility, prejudice, or discrimination aimed at Mexican people or culture.
summary.zh: “anti-Mexican”指针对墨西哥人或墨西哥文化的敌意、偏见或歧视。

definition.en: showing dislike of, hostility toward, or discrimination against Mexican people or Mexican culture
definition.zh: 对墨西哥人或墨西哥文化抱有反感、敌意或歧视的

examples.en: The report documented anti-Mexican comments in the workplace.
examples.zh: 报告记录了工作场所里针对墨西哥人的歧视性言论。

examples.en: They organized a campaign against anti-Mexican harassment at school.
examples.zh: 他们发起活动，反对学校里针对墨西哥人的骚扰。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/针对”，通常用连字符连接：anti-Mexican。写作时首字母是否大写取决于你是否把“Mexican”当作国籍/族群形容词使用（一般应大写）。
这是带有强烈社会与政治含义的描述词，常用于讨论偏见、仇恨言论、歧视、排外或相关政策。为避免标签化个人，有时更中性的说法是：“hostile toward Mexicans / prejudice against Mexicans（对墨西哥人的偏见）”。

summary.en: Anti-militarism means opposition to militarism or to strong military influence in society, often promoting diplomacy and peace instead of war.
summary.zh: anti-militarism 指反对军国主义或社会中过强的军事影响，通常强调以外交与和平取代战争与军事扩张。

definition.en: Opposition to militarism: the belief that a country should rely heavily on the military, military values, or war to solve problems.
definition.zh: 反军国主义：反对一个国家过度依赖军队、军人价值观或以战争来解决问题的思想/立场。

examples.en: Her anti-militarism grew after she saw how war affected civilians.
examples.zh: 她看到战争对平民的影响后，反军国主义立场更坚定了。

examples.en: The movement’s anti-militarism called for diplomacy instead of military expansion.
examples.zh: 该运动的反军国主义主张用外交取代军事扩张。

definition.en: A social or political movement that works to reduce military power, military spending, or the influence of the armed forces in society.
definition.zh: 反军事化运动：致力于削弱军力、减少军费或降低军队在社会中影响力的社会/政治运动。

examples.en: Anti-militarism was a major theme in the protest posters.
examples.zh: 反军国主义是抗议海报上的重要主题。

examples.en: Some students joined an anti-militarism group on campus.
examples.zh: 一些学生加入了校园里的反军国主义团体。

extraExplanation: 词形提示：anti- 表示“反对/对抗”，militarism 指“军国主义/军事至上”。因此 anti-militarism 不是“反军队”，而更常指反对把军事力量当成首要手段或核心价值。
语境差异：在讨论政治思想时常译作“反军国主义”；在强调减少军费、限制军方影响等政策取向时，也常译作“反军事化”。
常见搭配：anti-militarism movement（反军国主义运动），anti-militarism sentiment（反军国主义情绪/倾向），anti-militarism stance（反军国主义立场）。

summary.en: Anti-militarist describes someone or something opposed to militarism and the social or political dominance of military power.
summary.zh: anti-militarist 指反对军国主义与军事力量在社会或政治中占主导地位的人或事物。

definition.en: Opposed to militarism (the belief that a country should strongly rely on military power and values).
definition.zh: 反军国主义的；反对军事至上（主张国家应强烈依赖军事实力与军事价值观）。

examples.en: Many anti-militarist groups campaign for diplomacy instead of war.
examples.zh: 许多反军国主义团体倡导用外交而不是战争来解决问题。

examples.en: She wrote an anti-militarist article criticizing the government’s huge defense budget.
examples.zh: 她写了一篇反军国主义的文章，批评政府庞大的国防预算。

definition.en: A person who opposes militarism and the political influence of the military.
definition.zh: 反军国主义者；反对军事至上及军方政治影响的人。

examples.en: As an anti-militarist, he supported reducing compulsory military service.
examples.zh: 作为一名反军国主义者，他支持减少（或取消）义务兵役。

examples.en: Some anti-militarists joined peace marches during the conflict.
examples.zh: 一些反军国主义者在冲突期间参加了和平游行。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/对抗”，与“militarist（军国主义者/军事至上主义者）”组合成复合词。
语境上，“anti-militarist”通常不是单纯“反对军队存在”，而是反对把军事力量与军事价值观放在社会与政治的中心位置；常与“peace movement（和平运动）”“pacifist（和平主义者）”等话题相邻，但“pacifist”更强调反战或非暴力，不一定涉及对军方政治影响的批评。

summary.en: Anti-militaristically means “in a way that opposes militarism or military-focused thinking.”
summary.zh: anti-militaristically 指“以反军国主义/反军事主义的方式（表达观点、写作或描绘）”。

definition.en: In a way that opposes militarism (the belief that a country should be strongly organized around the military and prepared to use force).
definition.zh: 以反军国主义（反对国家以军事为中心、强调军事力量与武力使用） 的方式；反对军事主义地。

examples.en: Many students spoke anti-militaristically during the debate about increasing the defense budget.
examples.zh: 在关于增加国防预算的辩论中，许多学生以反军国主义的立场发言。

examples.en: The film portrays the war anti-militaristically, focusing on human cost rather than heroism.
examples.zh: 这部电影以反军国主义的角度呈现战争，更强调人类代价而非英雄主义。

examples.en: She wrote anti-militaristically in her newspaper column, calling for diplomacy over force.
examples.zh: 她在报纸专栏中以反军国主义的笔调写作，主张以外交取代武力。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/抵制”，militaristic 表示“军事主义的/崇尚军力的”，-ally 让形容词变成副词，合起来就是“以反军事主义的方式”。
这个词较少在日常口语中使用，更常见于政治评论、学术写作或媒体分析。口语中常用：“in an anti-militaristic way / from an anti-war perspective（从反战角度）”。
拼写上常见带连字符（anti-militaristically），也可不带（antimilitaristically），两者含义相同。

summary.en: “Anti-military” describes someone or something that opposes the military or military influence.
summary.zh: “anti-military”用于描述反对军队、军事行动或军方影响力的立场或事物。

definition.en: Opposed to the military, military action, or the influence of the armed forces in society or politics.
definition.zh: 反军方的；反对军队、军事行动，或反对军队在社会/政治中影响力的。

examples.en: Many students joined an anti-military protest against the war.
examples.zh: 许多学生参加了反军事的抗议活动，反对战争。

examples.en: The writer became known for his anti-military views in his essays.
examples.zh: 这位作家因其在随笔中表达的反军方观点而出名。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，意思是“反对……/与……相对”。因此 anti-military 常用来描述“政治立场、观点、运动或情绪”，语气可以是中性（立场描述）也可以带批评（指反军方情绪）。
常见搭配：anti-military protest（反军事抗议）、anti-military sentiment（反军方情绪）、anti-military activist（反军方人士）、anti-military stance（反军方立场）。
相关词可对比：anti-war（反战，更常见、范围更广）；pacifist（和平主义者，强调不使用暴力）；militaristic（军事化的/崇尚武力的，含贬义）。

summary.en: Anti-mine means intended to counter mines (or actions to reduce mine danger).
summary.zh: anti-mine 指“用于对抗/排除地雷或水雷的”，也可指“排雷等反地雷行动/措施”。

definition.en: Designed to detect, neutralize, or protect against mines (especially naval mines or landmines).
definition.zh: 用于探测、排除或防护地雷/水雷（尤指海军水雷或陆地地雷）的。

examples.en: The navy deployed an anti-mine ship to clear the harbor.
examples.zh: 海军派出一艘反水雷舰来清理港口。

examples.en: They installed anti-mine equipment on the vessel before entering the area.
examples.zh: 在进入该海域前，他们在船上安装了反水雷设备。

definition.en: Measures or operations taken to remove or reduce the danger of mines.
definition.zh: （泛指）排雷/扫雷等反地雷行动或措施。

examples.en: Anti-mine operations continued for several days after the conflict.
examples.zh: 冲突结束后，排雷行动又持续了好几天。

examples.en: The report focused on anti-mine training for local teams.
examples.zh: 该报告重点介绍了对当地队伍的排雷培训。

extraExplanation: “Anti-”表示“反对、对抗”，所以 anti-mine 字面意思就是“对抗地雷/水雷的”。在军事英语中常见搭配有 anti-mine ship（扫雷舰）、anti-mine warfare（反水雷作战）、anti-mine measures（反地雷措施）。
有时也会写作 anti-mine（带连字符）或 antimines/anti-mine（作定语），具体取决于出版规范；含义基本相同。

summary.en: Anti-ministry means opposed to the current government cabinet (ministry) or its policies; it can also refer to the opposition group itself.
summary.zh: anti-ministry 指反对现任政府内阁（ministry）或其政策；也可指反对内阁的政治团体/派别。

definition.en: Opposed to a government ministry (the executive cabinet) or against the policies of the current ministry, especially in parliamentary politics.
definition.zh: 反对（现任）政府内阁/部会的；反对（现任）执政当局政策的（尤用于议会政治语境）。

examples.en: Several anti-ministry MPs voted against the budget.
examples.zh: 几位反对内阁的议员投票反对这项预算。

examples.en: The newspaper took an anti-ministry stance during the election.
examples.zh: 这家报纸在选举期间采取了反对内阁的立场。

definition.en: A political group or faction that opposes the current ministry (government).
definition.zh: 反对现任内阁/政府的政治团体或派别。

examples.en: The anti-ministry argued that the cabinet had lost public trust.
examples.zh: 反对派认为内阁已经失去了公众信任。

extraExplanation: “ministry”在英式议会制度里常指“内阁/执政团队”（the Ministry），不是宗教意义上的“事工/牧职”。因此 anti-ministry 多见于历史或政治新闻/论文，意思接近“反内阁、反执政”。
连字符写法 anti-ministry 常用于作定语（anti-ministry MPs / press / campaign）。也可能写作 anti ministry（不带连字符）但在正式写作中连字符更清晰。

summary.en: Anti-missile describes or refers to weapons, technology, or systems used to defend against incoming missiles.
summary.zh: anti-missile 指用于防御、拦截来袭导弹的武器、技术或系统。

definition.en: Designed to stop, destroy, or defend against incoming missiles.
definition.zh: 用于拦截、摧毁或防御来袭导弹的；反导的。

examples.en: The country invested in anti-missile defense systems to protect major cities.
examples.zh: 该国投资反导防御系统，以保护主要城市。

examples.en: An anti-missile radar can detect threats at long range.
examples.zh: 反导雷达可以在远距离探测威胁。

definition.en: A weapon or system that is used to intercept and destroy incoming missiles.
definition.zh: 用于拦截并摧毁来袭导弹的武器或系统；反导系统。

examples.en: The navy tested an anti-missile system during the exercise.
examples.zh: 海军在演习中测试了一套反导系统。

examples.en: They upgraded their anti-missile capabilities after the new threat emerged.
examples.zh: 新威胁出现后，他们升级了反导能力。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对/对抗/防御……”。因此 anti-missile 字面意思就是“对抗导弹的”。
在新闻与国际关系语境里，你常见到 anti-missile defense（反导防御）、anti-missile shield（反导防护网/盾）等搭配。
写作上它通常作定语（anti-missile system/technology），也可写作 antimissile（不加连字符）但带连字符更常见、更清晰。

summary.en: “Anti-mission” describes opposition to religious missionary work, or the movement/attitude against it.
summary.zh: “anti-mission”指反对宗教传教活动，或指反传教的立场/运动。

definition.en: Opposed to religious missions or missionary activity (especially efforts to convert people).
definition.zh: 反对宗教传教或传教活动（尤其指劝人改宗的行为）。

examples.en: Some local leaders took an anti-mission stance after repeated conflicts with missionaries.
examples.zh: 一些地方领袖在与传教士反复发生冲突后，采取了反传教立场。

examples.en: The article describes anti-mission protests in several towns.
examples.zh: 这篇文章描述了几个城镇里的反传教抗议。

definition.en: Opposition to missionary work; an anti-mission position or movement.
definition.zh: 反传教立场；反对传教工作的运动或思潮。

examples.en: Anti-mission grew quickly when residents felt their traditions were being challenged.
examples.zh: 当居民觉得传统受到挑战时，反传教情绪迅速增长。

examples.en: The policy was shaped by both pro-mission and anti-mission voices.
examples.zh: 该政策受到支持传教与反传教两方意见的影响。

extraExplanation: “mission”在这里通常指宗教层面的“传教/布道”，不是“任务/使命”。因此 anti-mission 多见于宗教史、殖民史、社会运动等语境。
在中文语境里常可对应“反传教”“排外与反传教（某些历史时期）”等说法；具体含义要看是反对传教方式、反对外来宗教势力，还是更广泛的反殖民立场。

summary.en: Against missionaries or missionary work; or a person who opposes it.
summary.zh: 反对传教士或传教活动的；或指反对者本人。

definition.en: opposed to missionaries or missionary work (efforts to convert people to a religion, often Christianity).
definition.zh: 反对传教士或传教活动的（通常指反对以宗教传播、劝人改宗为目的的行动）。

examples.en: Some local leaders took an anti-missionary stance and asked foreign missionaries to leave.
examples.zh: 一些地方领袖采取反传教立场，要求外国传教士离开。

examples.en: The article describes anti-missionary protests in the early 1900s.
examples.zh: 这篇文章描述了20世纪初的反传教抗议活动。

definition.en: a person who is opposed to missionaries or missionary work.
definition.zh: 反对传教士或传教活动的人。

examples.en: He was labeled an anti-missionary by the newspaper.
examples.zh: 报纸给他贴上了“反传教者”的标签。

examples.en: Anti-missionaries argued that religious conversion should not be pushed by outsiders.
examples.zh: 反传教者认为，宗教改宗不应由外来者推动。

extraExplanation: 这个词常见于历史与政治语境，尤其涉及殖民时期、外交、文化冲突等话题；“反传教”有时并不等于“反宗教”，而可能是反对外来势力、反对强势文化介入，或反对以救助/教育之名进行改宗。
写法上常用连字符 anti-missionary；也可见不带连字符的 antimissionary（较少）。
更中性的表达可用 “opposed to missionary activity / critical of missionary work”（反对/批评传教活动）来避免把立场简化为对宗教本身的敌意。

summary.en: Anti-mitotic describes something that blocks or reduces cell division (mitosis), often in cancer treatment.
summary.zh: Anti-mitotic 指“抑制/阻止细胞有丝分裂”的，常见于癌症治疗等医学语境。

definition.en: Preventing or stopping mitosis (cell division), especially to slow or stop the growth of rapidly dividing cells.
definition.zh: 抑制或阻止有丝分裂（细胞分裂）的，尤指用来减缓或阻止快速分裂细胞的生长。

examples.en: Many chemotherapy drugs have anti-mitotic effects to stop cancer cells from dividing.
examples.zh: 许多化疗药物具有抗有丝分裂作用，用来阻止癌细胞分裂。

examples.en: The researchers tested an anti-mitotic compound on tumor cells in the lab.
examples.zh: 研究人员在实验室中用一种抗有丝分裂化合物对肿瘤细胞进行测试。

extraExplanation: 在医学语境中，anti-mitotic 常用于描述“抗有丝分裂药/作用”。这类药物往往针对微管（microtubules）等结构，干扰细胞在分裂时形成纺锤体，从而让细胞无法顺利完成分裂。
因为毛囊、肠道内壁等组织的细胞也会快速更新，抗有丝分裂治疗有时会带来脱发、恶心等副作用；这些都是学习相关英文医学资料时常见的搭配语境。
词形上 anti- 表示“反/抗”，mitotic 来自 mitosis（有丝分裂）；写作上也常见连字符 anti-mitotic。

summary.en: Anti-modern means opposed to modern ideas or styles, often favoring traditional ways; it can also describe movements that resist modernism in culture, art, or architecture.
summary.zh: anti-modern 指反对现代观念或风格、偏向传统的；也可形容在文化、艺术或建筑中抵制现代主义的思潮。

definition.en: opposed to modern ideas, styles, or ways of life; favoring older or traditional ways.
definition.zh: 反对现代观念、风格或生活方式的；偏好旧式或传统的。

examples.en: Some anti-modern critics argue that technology is weakening community ties.
examples.zh: 一些反现代的批评者认为科技正在削弱社区纽带。

examples.en: The book takes an anti-modern view of city life and praises rural simplicity.
examples.zh: 这本书以反现代的角度看待城市生活，并赞美乡村的质朴。

definition.en: relating to movements in art, architecture, or thought that resist modernism or modern culture.
definition.zh: （艺术、建筑或思想中）与抵制现代主义或现代文化的思潮有关的。

examples.en: The church’s design is deliberately anti-modern, using traditional stonework and symmetry.
examples.zh: 这座教堂的设计刻意反现代，采用传统石材工艺与对称结构。

examples.en: His essay connects anti-modern themes with nostalgia and distrust of industrial change.
examples.zh: 他的文章将反现代主题与怀旧情绪以及对工业变革的不信任联系起来。

extraExplanation: “anti-”是常见前缀，表示“反对、对抗”。“anti-modern”常用于讨论社会文化变化（如工业化、城市化、数字化）带来的焦虑或批评。
在学术或文化评论里，它不一定等于“反科技”，更多强调价值取向：认为“现代性”带来的速度、效率、消费主义会损害传统、宗教、手工艺或社区生活。
写作中常与“sentiment/attitude/view”搭配：anti-modern sentiment（反现代情绪）、anti-modern attitude（反现代态度）、anti-modern view（反现代观点）。

summary.en: Anti-modernism is opposition to modern ideas and changes, especially in society, culture, and the arts.
summary.zh: Anti-modernism 指对现代观念与现代社会/文化/艺术变革的反对或批评。

definition.en: Opposition to, or criticism of, modern ideas and changes in society, culture, or art (such as industrialization, urban life, or modern art styles).
definition.zh: 反现代主义；对现代观念与社会/文化/艺术变革（如工业化、城市化或现代艺术风格）的反对或批评。

examples.en: Some writers expressed anti-modernism by praising rural life over industrial cities.
examples.zh: 一些作家通过赞美乡村生活、贬低工业城市来表达反现代主义。

examples.en: The movement’s anti-modernism shaped its preference for traditional values and forms.
examples.zh: 该运动的反现代主义影响了它对传统价值观与传统形式的偏好。

definition.en: In literature and the arts, a tendency to reject certain modernist styles and to return to older themes, techniques, or moral and religious traditions.
definition.zh: （文学与艺术）反现代主义倾向；拒斥某些现代主义风格，转向更传统的主题、技巧，或道德/宗教传统。

examples.en: The poem’s anti-modernism shows in its classical rhythm and distrust of rapid progress.
examples.zh: 这首诗的反现代主义体现在古典的节奏与对快速进步的不信任上。

examples.en: Critics link anti-modernism in the early 1900s to anxieties about war and technology.
examples.zh: 评论家把20世纪初的反现代主义与对战争和科技的焦虑联系起来。

extraExplanation: “anti-modernism”常出现在讨论19世纪末到20世纪初的欧洲与美国文化史时：当工业化、城市化、科学与大众消费快速发展，一些思想家与艺术家担心传统社区、宗教信仰与手工技艺被削弱，于是倾向强调“回到传统”。
它不一定等于“反对一切新事物”。很多反现代主义者可能接受某些现代技术，但反对现代性带来的价值观变化（例如过度理性化、功利主义或消费主义）。
相关词：modernism（现代主义，常指文学艺术流派）、modernity（现代性，指现代社会状态）、traditionalism（传统主义）、reactionary（反动的，语气更强、政治色彩更重）。

summary.en: Anti-modernist means opposing modernism or modernist movements; it can describe a viewpoint or a person.
summary.zh: anti-modernist 指反对现代主义或现代派运动；既可形容一种立场，也可指持这种立场的人。

definition.en: Opposed to modernism (especially modernist art, literature, architecture, or ideas), often favoring traditional styles or values.
definition.zh: 反现代主义的；反对现代主义（尤指现代派艺术、文学、建筑或思想），常偏好传统风格或价值观。

examples.en: Some critics were openly anti-modernist and preferred classical painting techniques.
examples.zh: 一些评论家公开反现代主义，更偏好古典绘画技法。

examples.en: The building’s anti-modernist design uses historical details instead of minimalist lines.
examples.zh: 这座建筑的反现代主义设计采用历史细部，而不是极简线条。

definition.en: A person who opposes modernism or modernist movements.
definition.zh: 反现代主义者；反对现代主义或现代派运动的人。

examples.en: He became known as an anti-modernist after arguing against experimental poetry.
examples.zh: 他因反对实验诗歌而被视为反现代主义者。

examples.en: Anti-modernists and modernists debated what art should represent.
examples.zh: 反现代主义者与现代主义者就艺术应表现什么展开辩论。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对/对立”，modernist 指“现代主义者/现代派”。因此 anti-modernist 既可描述立场（形容词），也可指持这种立场的人（名词）。
在文化语境里，modernism 常与20世纪早期的“打破传统、形式实验、强调主观体验”相关；anti-modernist 往往意味着更重视传统规范、清晰叙事或历史风格。具体含义会随领域（艺术/文学/建筑/宗教思想等）而变化。

summary.en: Anti-modernity means opposition to modernity—preferring tradition over modern ideas, culture, or social change.
summary.zh: anti-modernity 指“反现代性”，即反对现代性及其观念、文化或社会变迁，倾向回归传统。

definition.en: Opposition to modernity (modern ways of life, ideas, or social changes), often favoring tradition, religion, or older cultural values.
definition.zh: 反现代性；反对现代性（反对现代生活方式、观念或社会变迁），常倾向于支持传统、宗教或较旧的文化价值。

examples.en: Some critics describe the novel as a protest against industrial life and anti-modernity.
examples.zh: 一些评论家把这部小说形容为对工业生活与反现代性的抗议。

examples.en: Anti-modernity movements sometimes grow when people feel rapid change is harming community life.
examples.zh: 当人们觉得快速变迁正在伤害社区生活时，反现代性运动有时会兴起。

definition.en: An attitude, style, or set of ideas that rejects “modern” aesthetics or values in art, culture, or politics.
definition.zh: （在艺术、文化或政治中）拒斥“现代”审美或价值的态度、风格或思想体系。

examples.en: The film’s anti-modernity shows in its preference for rural settings and old customs.
examples.zh: 这部电影的反现代性体现在它偏爱乡村场景与旧习俗。

examples.en: In architecture, anti-modernity can mean returning to classical ornament and traditional materials.
examples.zh: 在建筑领域，反现代性可能意味着回归古典装饰与传统材料。

extraExplanation: “anti-modernity”常见于人文社科与评论写作（如历史、文学、社会学、政治理论）。它不一定等于“反科技”：有些人反对的是现代性带来的价值观与社会结构（如个人主义、消费主义、官僚化），但仍可能使用现代技术。
搭配上常见：anti-modernity sentiment（反现代性情绪）、anti-modernity discourse（反现代性话语）、a critique of modernity（对现代性的批判）。在中文学术语境里也常写作“反现代性/反现代主义倾向”（注意 anti-modernity ≠ anti-modernism，后者更常指艺术流派立场）。

summary.en: Anti-modernization means opposing or criticizing modernization and its effects.
summary.zh: anti-modernization 指反对或批评现代化及其带来的影响。

definition.en: Opposed to modernization (changes that make a society, system, or place more modern), or critical of the idea that “modern” is always better.
definition.zh: 反对现代化（使社会、制度或地方变得更“现代”的变化），或批评“越现代越好”这种观念。

examples.en: Some community leaders are anti-modernization because they worry new development will erase local culture.
examples.zh: 一些社区领袖反对现代化，因为他们担心新的开发会抹去本地文化。

examples.en: The essay takes an anti-modernization stance and argues for protecting traditional ways of life.
examples.zh: 这篇文章采取反现代化立场，主张保护传统生活方式。

definition.en: A movement, attitude, or group that opposes modernization.
definition.zh: 反现代化的思潮、态度或群体。

examples.en: Anti-modernization has appeared in different forms throughout history.
examples.zh: 反现代化在历史上以不同形式出现过。

examples.en: The politician tried to appeal to anti-modernization in rural areas.
examples.zh: 这位政治人物试图争取农村地区反现代化群体的支持。

extraExplanation: “anti-”表示“反对……”。“modernization”常指工业化、城市化、科技引入、制度改革等带来的“现代化进程”。因此 anti-modernization 不一定是“反科技”，更多时候是反对某种发展方式（如过度商业化、拆迁、文化同质化）。
使用上它常见于社会学、政治评论、文化研究语境；日常口语里也可用，但更常说“against modernization”或更具体地说“against redevelopment/urban renewal/rapid development”。

summary.en: Anti-modernly means “in a way that opposes modern ideas or modern styles.”
summary.zh: anti-modernly 表示“以反对现代观念或现代风格的方式”。

definition.en: In a way that opposes modern ideas, styles, technology, or social changes; in an anti-modern manner.
definition.zh: 以反现代的方式；以反对现代思想、风格、科技或社会变迁的态度/方式。

examples.en: The essay argues, somewhat anti-modernly, that technology weakens real community.
examples.zh: 这篇文章带点反现代地认为，科技削弱了真实的社群关系。

examples.en: They dressed anti-modernly, choosing handmade clothes over trendy brands.
examples.zh: 他们穿着很反现代，选择手工制作的衣服而不是流行品牌。
